name: Callie Smith
text: Waited 30 minutes to get a bottled beer. There were maybe 10 people around the bar and the bartenders skipped us several times. I notified the bartender that he had skipped us and he told me that they weren’t paying attention to who was next for a drink. Bad first experience I hope this place can figure out the kinks because it has such great potential.

name: Leonard Kasmet
text: A very classy, cool Huntsville experience! The rooftop patio is great. Unfortunately we went during a rainy, muggy evening so we stayed mostly in the indoor section. Comfortable enough to host a large group!

name: MoonlightFoxTV
text: Drink prices match larger cities like New York. Rooftop provides okay view of downtown, but if they built the patio on the other side of the building it would have been better. Interior seems very sterile and undecorated.

name: Adrian Contreras
text: Nice addition to Huntsville. Just beautiful and elegant!

name: Keith Jackson
text:
visited summer 2021

This is one of the few rooftop bars downtown.  Located on the top floor of the Curio (Hilton) hotel, this bar has a great rooftop view of Jefferson's Pub, and surrounding area.  The cocktails are well made, and the inside portion is very nice as well.  Would go again.

name: Nevin Hauser
text: By far the best bar in Foley, AL. They have live entertainment often, karaoke weekly, and poker matches which are also weekly I believe. The pool tables are kept in excellent condition and they even serve food on special occasions. There is simply no contest, Docs is the best.

name: Robert Brown
text: Great place. Not to big not small. Bartenders have quick wit and dont put up with any BS. Great environment.

name: Camren Wall
text: Amazing establishment and atmosphere,  owners are equally awesome and genuine.  Safe place,  fun times,  everyone is family and is very clean.  Bathrooms are immaculate.... I recommend Max's Bloody Mary or the Bushwacker w floater for sure!

name: Sherrell Roper
text: GIGI was an amazing bartender/ personality. Service and drinks were perfect. Will always go back when in town !!!

name: Daniel Crain
text: Had a great time here! Kind of off the beaten path. It may be the best kept secret in Foley!.. Everyone was nice! The place is clean and had lighthearted atmosphere! My bartender, Sarah, made some great drinks and drink recommendations and was very friendly, attentive, and professional.  Pool tables and music.Thanks so much! I'll be back.

name: Chris B Griffiths
text: Not to sure what was going on at this bar last night, but the group I went with went in while I was having a smoke & by puff two they were leaving with a look of dissapoint I haven't seen in a while. So, two stars for everything you could've done, but probably never would've. My peak inside was all I needed. One word..... Locals only.

resp.text:
I don't know what you were looking for. On Sunday night, we are generally a local hang out, but we are all about building our clientele. Without you telling us what you felt was missing, or uncomfortable for you, it is impossible for us to improve.
I think it was a little premature for you to judge Doc Holliday's by a "peek inside".
I hope you'll give us a second chance and discover just why so many locals call us home.

name: Terry Quinn
text: Had the best time , best holiday weekend ever. I'm making plans for a weekend get away to Doc Holidays again. I live in Alexandria, La it's so worth the trip . Great music , great people, best. Bartenders ! If you go ask to meet G G she's awesome ! Can't wait for my next weekend visit !

name: Sarah Greer
text: Fantastic atmosphere with very sociable customers and staff. The owners treat you like family. The bar itself is extreamly clean and relaxing. Perfect place to unwind after a long day or let loose for the weekend!

name: Julie Britt
text: Great staff, COLD beer, LIVE music. This is a clean win-win good time! The owners will meet and greet as well! We are going back next weekend!

name: John Spivey
text: Great service, prices were reasonable. I definitely recommend this establishment!

name: Angila Sarvold
text: This is my favorite bar to go to outside of the one I work out. The most amazing cocktails! The entire staff kicks ass!

name: Shaun V
text: Great bartenders, pool tables are kept. Good choice.

name: Jackqulyn Salser
text: Friendly staff. Good pool tables. Fun environment. Im going back. Dig it

name: Mary Nobles
text: It was my Birthday when my boyfriend and I went on a Tuesday night and it was awesome.  Locals mostly  . Not busy. Just enough people to keep it interesting and not to loud . Dj was awesome play our request all night long . Bartender was great her name is GIGI . Go out have some fun , but drink responsibly.  They aim to please . If you need anything , anything at all if they don't have it they will get it for you , I'm sure they will do that there . Even if thats to call you a cab or call someone who cares for you . So go out and check them out and tell Gigi Mary sent ya'. They have love bands to boot . They are wheel chair accessible . With there public restrooms .  It's time for Christmas to you guys they are having a dinner and dirty Santa on December 17, 2017 that starts at 6:00 pm . Then on New Year's day they have Journey 2 mars Sunday December 31st , 2017. So go out have some fun but get a cab it's so much cheaper that away . Be careful out there and bring in this new year with a bang and good memories to go with you when you get home. Hope to see ya'll there .

text: A GREAT place for live music! and yes.. they have BOOM BOOM music in between band sets. Don't forget to ride the BULL in the back before you leave!  If you want to get ROWDY head on over to R&B-Ttown!

text: Never going again food was horrible $20 for a plate of small end ribs with no meat just black inedible black crust around the edges and there was exposed bone on each piece with the ends crusted with what I thought was meat but just burnt inedible crust then on top of that I asked would bbq sauce come with the ribs and I was told yes and once I got my food there was no bbq I spent $34 for food that I could not even eat I do not recommend

text: The food was amazing and so was the service. A top notch family owned restaurant. I was greeted at the door by TJ and the hospitality didn't end there. My waitress did an amazing job also her name was Darien. I even had the pleasure of meeting the owner Kachief who was not only very knowledgeable about culinary but was also very pleasant to have a conversation with. Very clean environment and the atmosphere was second to none!  I definitely enjoyed myself and look forward to returning to this establishment soon. Thank you to all who I had the privilege of meeting.

text:
The fall of the bone ribs were Delicious!
From the light crispy salad to the “to-die for” cheese and chocolate cake and everything in between it was delicious.
The Chef came by the table and checked in with us before and after the meal.
The staff were all very kind and did there jobs well!
Comfortable environment for any occasion.

text: Food is good! Best place to eat in miles! *** More than likely your only place to eat in miles take advantage of it.

name: Craig Nixon
text: Despite a noticeable lack of staff, the bartender did an outstanding job running the entire restaurant and bar. The food was surprisingly good - we had the chef salad with chicken breast and the grilled shrimp. Delicious on both counts. Hats off to our bartender for persevering!

name: Rob Masters
text: I couldn't care for the food. The atmosphere is friendly and it within the Holiday Inn at Birmingham. There is room for improvement and a chance to grow.

name: ashley triplett
text: After reading the reviews, I was nervous to order from here but since I don't have a car, I had to roll the dice. The bartender was less than thrilled to speak to me or take my order. When I got back to my room with my food, I was pleasantly surprised to taste the well seasoned fries and hot burger. The burger was overcooked but not inedible. The cheese was very good and melted. The soda was flat but I didn't really mind, I was just happy to have food! The area of this hotel isn't great so eating here isn't a bad option.

name: Squirrel Boogie
text: Great place to unwind.  Courteous service, great food.  Highly recommended.

text: Great food and drinks

name: Ashley Austin
text: The food was so over cooked. My steak was burnt on one side so they just served the good side up. My child's"burger" off of the kids menus was just the sliders off the appetizer menue. The sliders were hockey pucks! So burned on one side and so dry she could only eat one bite. The last straw was the chip in my beer glass that cut my lip. This is a rundown place with terrible food and sub par service.

name: Eric Brooks
text: Do not order a burger. I just waited 30 min on a frozen over cooked burger. Next time I'll stick with the Cajun chicken pasta.

name: Wylie Brace
text: Don’t order the turkey club wrap... i think they got the club from one of the gas stations across the street... for 13 bucks plus 4 dollars for fries, take your 17 bonez and grab a box of frozen Hotpockets, 1 bag of Lays classic potato chips, and a cobra 40 ounce malt liquor beverage... it’s bound to taste better than that club wrap...

name: Michael Benninghoff
text: They served me raw chicken.

name: JeriN TV
text: The experience was great!! But the people at the bar were rude and mean! Me and my friends wanted the rainbow shots and the white lady at the bar told us she wasn’t making them because she made 3 in a row before us and didn’t get a tip so she wasn’t making them. People do not have to tip you grist off, and second you don’t refuse a service to someone based off of previous customers.

name: James Nelson
text:
Great experience, very Social but yet can be a very personal and private place to take a significant other.

Very comfortable atmosphere.
If you're into hookahs they have those as well.

Bartenders and bar waiters are always on point. Excellent

name: Dea H
text: Beautiful lounge, the atmosphere is chill but hip and grown. I celebrated my friends birthday here recently one night and she purchased a booth. The hostess manager was very gracious after one of her hostesses made an error while servicing us. I would highly recommend.

text: I just live the cozy atmosphere! And oh, did I mention the drinks are great and the service is astounding...

text: The atmosphere is really nice but there’s no where to sit unless you want to pay $150 to reserve a booth. Drinks were expensive and watered down. It’s not worth the hype.

name: Nee nee
text: Listen I've been to plenty of lounges but this one took the cake ! No cap . Maybe one in Atlanta I was feeling a bit but to have this spot in Bham I'd amazing. The decor,  the bar tenders were so sweet! ,like if I could give 10 stars I would.

name: RuMeisha Harris
text: They did not have enough room to accommodate the party I was bringing , so whoever manages the booking said that she would give me a “deal”. She said I received the “deal” only because the room hadn’t been booked yet. When I arrived I saw that the room I paid a deposit on was given to someone else. They attempted to seat 18 individuals in a section that only accommodated 6 individuals. After commuting 2 hours to have a good time , this was the service we received. I am beyond disappointed in this bar and lounge. Professionalism is very important when you are managing a business.

name: Teresa Buker
text: This bar/lounge is absolutely beautiful! Whomever designed it has great taste and set a wonderful vibe for the place. Highly recommend the "Velvet Room" - my favorite drink there.

text: The place is really pretty . I stood in line for 45 minutes. And when i finally got in paid and sat down I waited 30 minutes for the bottle girl. Me and my friends finally ordered drinks it took 45 minutes for her to tell us they were out of vodka and Hennessy. We ordered 3 shots of casamigos instead . Here is almost 2 AM never got them and I was still charged .

text: We reserved a section and had to wait 35 minutes to be asked what we was drinking. Once asked by the waitress, the waiting game started again.  They were servicing everyone at the bar, when we paid for a section and didn't receive our drinks until one hour later after we arrived, which were watered down. Poor service, Why pay extra?????

name: Riley White
text: As close to the old Sahara Restaurant as you will get in Montgomery...Food is just good...Red Snapper is excellent,,pricy but well worth it.They have made some changes no longer bringing a menu out but instead put a paper one on the table.They no longer bring warm bread and butter to you while you wait and a few times have had  to ask for water. Steaks are excellent and my daughter in law loves the Chicken Fettuccine..Good food ,well prepared and staff always puts courtesy first.You will not be disappointed unless you get a group of rowdies near you and they ruin your night.Thats happened to me only once in several dozen visits but when you walk in prepared to drop 150 to 200 it should not happen at all.Some people just were not raised to know how to act in a upscale restaurant . There are a lot of people in this city who do not understand how to act in public no matter where they are at.Montgomery was once a very nice city and family friendly.Those days long gone.

name: April 504
text:
Best steaks in Montgomery
Wonderful desserts
This is the spot for fine dining

name: Edythe Dansby
text: Steaks are amazing

name: Craig Courtney
text: I was with my girl friend.

name: Julia Richardson
text: Never been here

name: Anthony Roberts
text:
First time eating here was tonight. We had two servers for our party of six and they did fantastic. Drinks never got low and the went above and beyond our needs. My steak was cooked to perfection and the sides tasted fresh.

It is more expensive than your average steakhouse, but worth the money.

name: David Barnett
text:
This was a really good dining experience. The best I've had in a very long time.

Not only was the food excellent but the service was unbelievable. There were three waiters serving us and they were all professional, friendly, and helpful. It's hard for me to understand others who have rated the service as anything less than stellar.

My hat is off to the entire staff at Shula's.

name: Steph M
text:
The combination hostess/bartender/waitress was a great server. She went out of her way for me.
I went for spinach salad, so I can't comment on the steak aspect, but the salad was really good and the drinks were delicious.

name: Stacy Giovinco
text: Steak was average and very expensive and i have had better.  The desert we ordered was out of this world.  The service was great as well.  Great atmosphere.  Only giving it two three stars bc of the desert and service. My bill was $250 for a two average steaks.

resp.text: Hi Stacy - Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback, we very much appreciate hearing what our customers think.  We're so glad you enjoyed our high level of customer service, the atmosphere and your dessert!  But we want to make sure you loved your steak as well!  We would love the opportunity to have you back to "wow" you with our Shula Cut steaks.  If you would like, please email me directly at kt@shula.com and we can communicate further.  Thank you!   - Kristen Thompson

name: Anita Frederick
text: My husband and I come and enjoy date night about once a month at Shula's we love the atmosphere at the bar and enjoy getting to interact with the bartender and patrons. Our best experience has been with Lindsey who went out of her way to make sure we had great service and learned more about the cocktails we were interested in trying as well as taking our food order and delivering great customer service. We love our date night and can't say enough good things about Shula's.

name: Anna Goloforo
text: They  need to change their  dress code.  Just because we didn't come from work, with a suit or pant suit they wouldn't serve  us.   Well they list about 200!ir more dollars for dinner.  That's not too wise

name: Andrew King
text: Failed to cook a rare Ribeye...... twice!! Manager and server had an attitude when we showed them the overcooked steak. The second steak they served us was cold. Also ordered the Filet Trio (medium-rare). Two were medium and one was well-done.... J. Alexanders has better service and they know how to cook a rare steak. Cheers!

resp.text: Hi Mr. King.  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your experience. We use feedback like this to identify issues and address them.  Your feedback has been forwarded to our executive team and to our Shula’s team in Birmingham.  We would like to follow-up with you on your experience.  If you are open to it, please email me directly at kt@shula.com with your phone number. Thank you! - Kristen Thompson

name: David Aarons
text: Service great.  Food way overrated.  Ruths Chris and J Alexander's steaks are much better.  Would not go back.

name: respect my privacy
text:
Felt I was prejudiced against because I’m white, and my GF is Mexican. We went to Shula’s on Valentine’s day. I made reservations 5 days before which gave me the options of 3 time slots. I took the earlier time. When I arrived, (5 minutes late and we called to say so) we had to wait an additional 15-20 to have our table which gave me the impression that they were busy. There was nobody in the PLACE and we had to wait! Olive Garden, Outback does this too: They make you wait and the place is only half full! They purposely make it seem as if they are busy when in fact out of 16 tables in the back room, only 3 were occupied. There were 2 black couples and us.
The black female waitress didn’t have “her game on” as she expressed to the couple behind me. For $150.00 + you better have your S—t together!  We ordered different wines and she never identified to us which wines they were. She just placed them in front of us and proceeded to take our order. She incorrectly took our order by not remembering. Did not write it down either. I ordered the 14 oz. rib eye grilled Pittsburg style, med-rare. She returned to our table telling me that they gave me the next size steak for the same price of the 14 oz. because she did not remember the order. We’ll  guess that was OK. When it came it was not P-Burg style. I asked for sour cream for the mashed potatoes and she did not bring that as well. I noticed the lack of friendliness to me and my GF compared to her report w/ the other American-African couples. She just did not care,
When I commented to her about the experience, I tried to do so in a kindly fashion. She never listened to my advice. Her response was “you don’t have to tip me”. Well I still tipped , but only 10% for the service. So in closing, the prejudice I felt, the sub-par alacrity, overly apologetic waitress I’d rather go to Flemmings Steakhouse instead.

name: Robert Woods
text:
So my wife and I go there for our anniversary. May 17th 2013. We make reservations for 6:45PM. The weather was bad that afternoon and it was Friday so we decide to go a little early. We arrived at 6:20PM. We walked in at the same time that two ladies staying at the Wynfrey did. They got to the maître d's desk a split second before we did. They told the maître d' that they did NOT have reservations but could they eat anyway. They were told yes. I was asked if we had reservations. I told them my name. We were told to have a seat, they would be with us soon. The two ladies got seated immediately. We had to wait almost 25 minutes! When we got our food, my baked potato was not done completely.

Point being, there is apparently no benefit to making reservations!!!!!

name: Charnessa Mz. Watch Me Campbell
text: First time here and the young lady walked us all the way to our table to sit down, once we sat down, she tells me I can't wear my bball cap which is plan gray with no writing at all, so we left and came to J. Alexander's. Thanks for a first time bad experience.

name: Christina Simmons
text: My friend and I decided to try this restaurant out for lunch one day.  When we arrived the lady taking our order told us they were out of basically half the menu and the menu is not very big to begin with.  I ordered a chicken salad sandwich and mashed potatoes, they were extremely plain tasting, not enough seasoning...But edible.  My friend ordered a salad which she paid $8.99 for, and all she got was a small bowl of lettuce, a little bit of chicken, some crutons, and some dressing.  I felt really bad for her, because when she was finished she was still very hungry, but didn't have time to go anywhere else and get anything before going back to work.  Maybe this place needs to call Chef Ramsey from Kitchen Nightmares to help them out, haha.

resp.text: Christina we would definately like to have the chance to prove that our food is above ordinary.  Because we are an independent, chef-owned business, we take great pride in bringing the freshest, highest quality products to the table.  There are times that we choose to let our inventory run low...usually before holidays or times when we know we will be closed for an extended period of time. It's not that we are ill-prepared, instead we try to bring only the best to the table.  We sincerely apologize for the "nightmare" you & your guests experienced here.  We hope you will give us a chance to show you a truly great lunch.

name: Shenon Williams
text: I wish i could give this place zero stars!!!!  My cousin rented out the place for his wedding reception they bragged on how this is their favorite place. They must not have recieved such harsh service as i did. There was a server assigned to our table she was a delight. But for some reason another very rude disrespectful server kept approaching me. I felt as if i was in high school and she was a bully. She was very aggressive towards me for no reason and kept coming to our table to address me as uf she wanted to start a arguement. She damn near snatched my glass of water away from me and continued to harrass me throughout the night. Now it was obvious to everyone at the table she was a bully. The crazy thing about this whole situation is that SHE WASNT EVEN MY SERVER!!!!  there was no reason for her to come to our table in the first place and the fact she continued to come back and harass me was. Crazy.   When i told the manager about this server he chumped me off as if i was just complaining to complain. I am a bartender so i know all about customer service. And This place is the worst. I hope they stay closed so no one else has to endure what i went through. I am soooooooo pissed. I wish thetevwas more i could do to keep this place closed. I have never been so disrespected in my life.

name: Vincent EDenfield
text:
My friend and I went checking out all the karaoke venues in the Wiregrass area this past week. On Tuesday July 6, 2018 we stopped by Buck Wild Saloon to check out their version of karaoke. We were a little surprised that there were no cars in the parking lot but considering this was the day before a major holiday it wasn't too much of a surprise. We checked to see if the venue was open and it was. Venturing in, the building was completely devoid of customers. Great! No waiting in a long queue to sing karaoke. We were informed by the very nice bartender that they didn't have a KJ and she was the one doing karaoke at the bar. The TV/video monitor was behind the bar..ok. Also, we would have to listen to the audio through the TV as she didn't know how to get audio working to the sound system across the room. I offered to help and after tracing the audio cables to the mixer, I deduced it was a laptop issue and corrected it for her. I showed her how to fix it in case she ever needed to do so in the future since there was no KJ.
My friend and I sang a few songs, chatted a bit, drank a few sodas and was informed that the owner had ordered the bar to be closed early so we said our goodbyes and left.
Very nice bartender/employees. Come for the conversation but not karaoke.
Three stars for the bar, one star for karaoke.
Will review again in the future for band/general bar on a busier night

name: Kodi Reed
text: I came to Alabama for work from Texas; I walked in to Jelly's Bar and was treated like family instantly. This has become my home away from home and will always be my bar of choice. From the second you walk in you can feel the love and passion the owner has for her bar and every customer, new as well as regulars. This is a great place to come have a few drinks and meet incredible people. I always have a great time here. And when I leave I will be back to visit just for this place! "Jelly Jelly" this is a must stop!

name: Jim Faulk
text: Rachel Rose is the best! She's a great owner, bartender, and person.  The regulars are welcoming and are nice people.  Love the dart tournaments here.  Try the Snake Bite and the Grateful Dead!

name: Han Bowers
text: Susan the bartender is great! And the custom drinks that her daughter Rachel makes are delicuous! They are moving venues soon to near the home depot down the road. Was a great place for a date, not too loud and extremely friendly with good music. The custom drinks are $8 each which is a bit steep but worth the occasional drop by. If they were a little cheaper I would make this place my daily spot! Be sure to ask the bartender where the name "Jelly's" comes from.

name: Matt Johnson

name: Cheyenne Taylor
text:
Semi-sexy dive bar in Pelham, Alabama..?

Pros: really friendly and enthusiastic staff; place has a sense of humor, is no frills/not pretentious; cheap drinks (seriously, 28 oz Grateful Dead served in one of those big plastic cups your aunt busts out at the beach for $8); owner uses agave syrup and, apparently, other natural ingredients in cocktails. There's also something oddly satisfying about the fact that there's somewhere around here that isn't afraid to promote sexy male dancer events.

Cons: ventilation is bad to nonexistent, so you leave reeking like ashtray to your bones even if you're not smoking; the infused liquors and cocktails are overly sweet and they don't offer regular whiskey; the music was extremely loud and unsettlingly all over the place (She Thinks My Tractor's Sexy, D*ck in a Box, I Believe in a Thing Called Love, P*ssy Control as a sampling) which was funny honestly but, you know. You have to walk through a long line of dart players to get to the bar, which felt hazardous; literal debris on tables. Doesn't seem to know if it wants to be erotic or not, comes across like it's trying to be sexy in some ways but ends up feeling sleazy.

text:
I was here with my friend Gaaaarrrrrrry. Everybody thought we were city slickers, but little did they know I graduated in a class of 12 people.  We were drinking some mic ultra and everyone was looking at us funny so we bought everybody shots and then they bought me a beer. And so I played pool with Gary,  and some nice lady's husband paid for me to get another shot. And I said thank youuuu. So we were getting ready to go and we got a box for our Walmart pizza and bought shots for everyone before leaving.  I would like to strongly recommend this place for everybody looking to have a enlightening dining experience.  Please go give them a try.

Yours truly,
Samuel Chris L. Jacksonian

text: This place is great. I have been to several game stores that do not welcome newbies to the scene, but at R.O.E. I was welcomed from the get go. It is clean, does not smell like a basement, is family friendly, and is being constantly improved for a upscale evening destination at the “tavern”.  I highly recommend you spend your gaming dollars here and make a few new friends in the process.

resp.text: Thanks Terry !!!

text: I'm happy to see this come to Calera both the cafe and the game center. The cafe was very pleasant despite the train. A great place to stop and relax while we were waiting. We will be returning often.

name: andrew traywick
text:
Joined a weekly game here for several months with my son and had a lot of fun. Got to know the owners, the staff and many of the regulars. We definitely felt like part of the family. They have gaming tables set up in the back and even a private table/room for ‘guild members’. Last year, our weekly game fell on Halloween night.. everybody dressed up and they had it catered. The new location in Calera is next door to a gaming themed coffee shop(!), and I believe ROE has a small (limited) bar in house now? Pretty cool for a gaming shop.

We were fairly new to tabletop gaming, but the owners and the rest welcomed us and helped us fit right in. All in all, easily one of the best spots around greater Bham for tabletop gaming. Go check it out. Have fun!

name: Kyle Crider
text: I am sharing this in hopes that those who feel as I do won't waste a trip. I had been planning to visit ROE for quite a while (I do not live in Calera) and was looking forward to visiting both their bar and game store. According to Google Maps, ROE identifies itself as Black-owned, veteran-led, and women-led; three things I would normally go out of my way to support. However, the following sign greeted me upon arrival, prominently featured in ROE's store-front window: "Guns are welcome on premises. Please keep all weapons holstered unless need arises. In such cases, judicious marksmanship is appreciated." So despite making a special trip to Calera specifically to visit ROE, I turned around and never plan to visit so long as this ridiculous and dangerous policy remains in place. As a university professor, I believe in evidence-based reasoning, and data shows that the "good guy with a gun myth" is just that -- a myth. I prefer to keep my tavern interactions with folks armed with deadly weapons to the realm of fantasy, where they belong; NOT my not-so-local hobby shop.

resp.text: As the owner, I would like to say I am sorry that you felt that way about our store without speaking with us about it.  My husband is a combat arms vet and I am military raised, and so we have a slightly different humor.  I agree that our store is not for everyone, just like not every shop is for us.  That being said, spending any time in our store with our regulars would show that while we allow carry (and only a small amount actually carry), misbehavior with such items is NOT TOLERATED.  We have found that those that stay with us, stay because they feel welcomed and accepted for who they are without judgement; and we have ALL types here.  No one here gets away with bullying or criticizing others for their various believes as long as said believes bring no harm to self or others.  We consciously monitor the behavior and body language of everyone that visits as should be done no matter the type of shop.  Once again, I am sorry you felt your trip a waste of time, and hope that you do find a shop where you feel comfortable and happy, because end the end, that is what is important.

name: JBrown270
text:
Nice clean space below Aqua restaurant in the Wyndham. Good live entertainment, billiard table, dart board, etc. The staff seemed friendly and attentive. My only criticism is regarding the mixed drinks, which were sub-par in my opinion. I ordered an old fashioned which was possibly the worst old fashioned I had ever tried. I question if they put any bitters in the drink, albeit impossible to tell because the glass had been completely topped off with club soda, drowning any whiskey that was present. I also tried a rum & coke and a lemon shot (girlfriend’s order lol), both of which I could not taste any alcohol. My girlfriend said the rum & coke was too strong so it was probably good for the average drinker.

TL;DR - good atmosphere, bad mixed drinks; stick to beer, wine, and whiskey on the rocks

name: Ferman Smith
text:
We intended on visiting a different bar and found they were closed so decided to visit this one.

For some reason it had an intimidating look from all of the bikes parked outside but we were pleasantly surprised. The bartender was extremely friendly even though she knew we were from out of town and was not only prompt but welcoming and very kind.

The drinks were moderately priced and the bar food was pretty good considering the fact it was actually bar food. 😂

The patrons were also friendly and were extremely laid back.

The atmosphere was rock and there was a variety of music playing. It was refreshing to listen to music new and old as well as being able to play the jukebox remotely via the TouchTunes app.

If you're looking for a fun bar off the main grid, give this one a shot. I assure you that you won't be disappointed.

name: luv for evs Benjamin-Dobbins
text: Horrible experience.  Food decent but the service was sub-par! I went there for lunch with 2 work colleagues.  I spoke with the General Manager about finding something (I didn't order/put in my bowl) that wasn't supposed to be in it.  He basically argued with me, never apologized and was very rude. My colleagues and I were shocked (especially since we were all in hospitality/hotel management).  I sent an email to their corp. office and found out it was a franchise. The lady at the corp. office was VERY nice and apologetic for his rude behavior. I asked to be contacted on a Regional or Ownership level and never heard from anyone.  I sent another email to corp. office expressing how discontent I was that no one even contacted me.  So now I'm posting the experience everywhere.  And it could have all been avoided with some very simple, good old fashioned, CUSTOMER SERVICE!!

text: Bravo!!!!! The food was absolutely amazing. The crab avocado and lobster appetizers were both divine! The sushi rolls were creative and so delicious! Best sushi in Birmingham hands down! name: Joseph Upshaw
text: Overall not a good experience. Long wait for a table even though the restaurant was half empty. I understand staffing issues beyond their control may cause that but when i made that comment to the hostess she said they were fully staffed. The waitress was a sweetheart but she had no idea about the menu or really about serving in general. One bright spot that kept me from giving them only one star was the sushi roll I ordered was pretty good. It was a ‘special roll’ not on the menu (which the waitress was unaware of and the sushi chef came to the table to explain). Charged me $27 for it. It was good but not $27 good. Unlikely to give them another try.

Was okay right after opening, but quickly went downhill.  The food is between mediocre and okay and the prices are quite high for the quality.

There's better food on the block and better sushi in Birmingham for less money.

text: Great new spot in Birmingham for sushi! Large open windows give it a nice atmosphere, delicious food, and great service. We had Riley as our server who was excellent and made great recommendations.

text: Best sushi in bham! My friends and I wandered in late one night and enjoyed everything! From the cocktails to food to atmosphere, everything was 10/10. Food tasted super fresh. I got the Lakeview roll and a ginger salad, it was filling and full of flavor.

text: Fantastic food, fantastic service, fantastic aesthetic. Came here not knowing it was opening night, and was thoroughly impressed. The pork belly taco, caiparinha sushi roll, and London’s Calling cocktail were particular standouts. Do yourself a favor and come here.

name: Vasilios Tsantes
text: Great experience! Love the tapas style part of the menu so you can try different dishes at a fair prices. Steak and Ahi tuna tacos were packed  with flavor, scallops were perfectly cooked, Hokkaido potatoes were crisp with a great taste, fried octopus was a hit(I'll have 2 next time) and fried Brussel sprouts were impressive. Being the 3rd day it's been open the staff was strong and pleasant. Looking forward to our next visit.

name: Ashley Robinson
text: This place has been open less than a month and my friend and I were excited by the concept. Went there around 8:50 on a Tuesday night and they were not busy at all. The hostess was quite happy to tell us that they were closed early despite the online and door posting of a closing time of 10pm. When I asked why she referred me to some excuse riddled supervisor whining about their GM quiting them high and dry abruptly and them not being able to run very well as a result. As a former restaurant manager I can say this place is a disaster.

text: Best. Sushi. In. Town. Seriously, I think between everyone in my party, we ordered about 36 different rolls, and they were rach more amazing than the last. Plus, it's a beautiful space and the staff is fantastic. I cannot recommend Umatilla highly enough. Get in there!!!

name: David Persol
text: We were really excited to try Watkins Branch, but what a disappointment. The wine was rough (what happens when it’s a $9 bottle retail). The crab cake was really good, but the boar chops, elk burger were very over cooked (both ordered med-rare). The swordfish was completely inedible. Server was very nice and helpful, but will not be back. Don’t waste time or money here.

resp.text:
We are incredibly sorry you had a bad experience. As we have com spit of Covid we have had truly a hard time keeping kitchen staff. While this is no excuse, we do hope you’ll give us another chance sometime in the future.
-WB

name: Steve White
text: Friendly folks nice place to shoot a game of pool on very good tables some nights they have food out and we went there to play pool on a Saturday night when they have open tournament which will cost you $15 to get in. My problem was that the owner Billy is some kind of a I'm really not sure but he has trophies all over the place even from a Las Vegas tournament and he apparently never loses and as the owner of the bar and sponsor of the tournament my friends and I don't feel that is appropriate that he is playing in the tournament which he usually does and always wins the major cut of the pot. my friend was second place being beaten by Billy who did not lose as usual I personally was third place and receive no cut. I've talked to other people around at other bars and for the same reason they don't play at these bar tournaments anymore. there's something just wrong with that, there are just as good of places you can play for a dollar. The owner of the bar is supposed to be setting up entertainment and challenges for the customers not for himself. if he wants to play pool which obviously he enjoys he should do that on the side.  we had a good time and I guess that's what it's all about when you go out to play some pool. But nobody enjoys being taken. Don't fall into the Trap don't play the open tournament if Billy's playing Unless you feel you're just really damn good if so go for it! The key is to have fun and if you think you're that good you might just have one of the best damn nights of your life. I only mention all this in all fairness in case you're not, I don't like to see anyone get taken and my friend and I are pretty damn good. Otherwise it seems to be a great place. By the way it's sort of a dive nothing fancy, but it's clean friendly and trouble free and that's hard to find nowadays. So in all honesty kudos to Billy for that and he has Diamond pool tables with a very fast bumpers in case you're not used to that.... And Billy is a really a very nice fellow I like him personally as well as all the rest of his employees I'm not trying to disrespect anyone here. I just think people should know what they're getting into I actually wish a lot of good players would go there and somebody would actually beat him maybe one day I can but I don't know when that day will come oh hell of a lot more practice I guess,  just go there kick some ass if you can, like I said this all for fun and entertainment and if you can't afford to lose 15 bucks you probably should stay home. Enough said!

text:
The energy was not only very welcoming but, the vibe was very energetic and vibrant.

I was only in town for a short time and visited Roxy's on a Thursday and then again on a Friday.

Thursday was relaxed and chilled while Friday is the start of the partying for the weekend. It was full but not overwhelmingly crowded, you could still easily maneuver your way to the bar and the restrooms in the back and the staff was highly attentive.

Let me not forget to mention the amazing downtown location just minutes away from the beautiful UA Campus.

The owners are doing this very well and I hear they plan to expand and I am all here for it.

name: C H
text:
After my visit last night I’m pleased to say I will be returning. I’ve been to a few places claiming to be speakeasies before but this was by far the most authentic.
I see a lot of reviews complaining about the smoke.
I can’t understand what people were expecting when they walked in. The cocktails have a smoked option and it’s a small intimate venue with limited seating, hence the reservation necessity. Why the surprise? IT’S A SPEAKEASY!! Speaks WERE smoky, cozy hideouts and thankfully, this time around it’s not cigarette or cigar smoke, it’s a light, fragrant smoke that adds a little authenticity to the experience. Yes it got stuck in my hair too but shampoo works folks!
Stop whining!

If you want your standard IBA cocktails and modern day atmosphere then visit any other bar in Huntsville.
And finally, the cocktails are made to order and this would be the main reason I return. Know your tastebuds and ask if you’re not sure. For the best experience, try to be open-minded and push the envelope when choosing flavors. Trust the bartender’s recommendations.

name: Justen Wood
text: The experience was cool. The process of getting in is awkward but unique. A lot smaller than expected. We were directed away from the couches and cushioned chairs in the middle by the male bartender. The other seating available was not very comfortable. We later found out it was for a party of 5 (actually 3) that were friends of the male bartender. Once they showed up, for every 1 drink everyone else around the room got, they easily got 3. The male bartender likes to light a lot of things on fire so it gets smokey in there pretty quickly. The drinks tasted great, light on alcohol, heavy on flavor. We only received drinks made by the female bartender because, like I said, the other was a bit busy. In the end, we spent about 3 times more than we would somewhere else for 4 drinks. Yes, you read that right, 4 drinks. That is as many as we could get out of them in 2 1/2 hours. Good to bring some out of town clients to entertain while you talk, maybe. Won't be back.

name: Brad Horton
text: Amazing and unique drinks with outstanding service.   Very small venue that requires reservations and a password to get in the door.  Highly highly recommend.

name: Warren Stewart
text:
While Catacomb 435 appeared to be an outstanding speakeasy, it turned out to be far less than desirable. After speaking with Ms. Carla of Church Street Family properties, as prompted by the reservation contact for Catacomb 435, it was conveyed that my party of 6 had a reservation at 10:45p for that evening. Upon reaching the entrance to the speakeasy, we were informed that there was no reservation on the books and Carla was unable to be reached; however, the bartender answering the door contact service informed us that there was no space available due to Covid-19 social distancing regardless of reservations booked. Interesting enough, 4 guests exited the speakeasy moments prior to our reservation time.  Carla later called and stated there was no availability which is why we did not have a reservation. Note that Carla quoted us a specific time earlier that same day for our reservation.

Overall, extremely disappointed in Catacomb 435 and their inability to communicate  effectively and/or uphold reservations committed. After 20 minutes of standing in the rain for the reservation attempting to reach Carla to confirm the reservation she had previously scheduled the very same day, I can’t say that Catacomb 435 is worth the effort.

text: So I'm new in town and an associate of mine suggested that we go to this club for the night. First of all the club is small compared to what I'm use to in Atlanta but expected because it wasn't overly packed like I'm again use to. My problem with the club is the bartender. He politely tipped himself an extra $6 that I didn't authorize. I ordered two drinks, gave him my card, and he just gave my card back with no receipt. Now I know it's partly my fault for not asking for a receipt but at this point I'm drunk and the bartender knows this so he takes advantage of the situation. I would have given him a tip had it been clear that he needed one but don't just take money from someone knowing that I know nothing about it. Needless to say I will not be going back to this club and will not recommend it for future new party goers.

name: Nicole Beaver
text:
UPDATE 2: The owner has changed their response 3 times already and has not once denied being drunk while working! I will also note on the positive side that the venue lets you have food delivered and will let those with food allergies bring their own food, which is quite nice. The music was also pleasant without being overwhelmingly loud.

UPDATE: it turned out was actually the owner who was quite drunk!

The "owners friend" was very invasive and no one wore masks.  There was a good variety of canned beers but not much on tap. Generally nice outdoor setup with a children's area.

resp.text: First, I would like to remind you that the mask mandate in Alabama has been lifted. Second, I’m sorry you felt that I was invasive but we do not allow outside beverages, nor do any other establishments.

name: Ashley Vogt McGough

Our Baldwin County Department of Health score is 100 and publicly posted. Also, the only food we serve are “frozen” pizza, burgers, and assorted chips. We open our SandBar each spring & have a tiki bar and “beach sand.” We don’t have a volleyball court, Tropics (located about 15 minutes south of us) on the Causeway does. The RiverPub at Cliff’s Landing

text: Never disappointed 😊We had the good fortune to re-discover this location. They were just the BEST in Slidell,LA  21 years ago.

name: Taylor Snow
text:
We are here twice while in town. The restaurant dining room appears to be closed forever and this has been turned into carry out also. Our first experience we stopped in on our way home. The woman who I assume owns the pace helped us and could not have been nicer. Our food was delicious. However, all of that is overshadowed by our experience in attempting to order over the phone a week later. A man answered who I assume is her husband and he was extramural rude. I could not get a word in with him, constantly cutting me off and getting angry with me for trying to tell him our order. I ended up telling him he was being rude and that we would be taking our business elsewhere, he informed me he did not care. Pirates Pizza is highly recommend on the island. Go there instead.

I would eat here again, if I hear he is gone.

resp.text:
It's been tough for everybody since this pandemic. We've tried our best to remain open, with takeout only during this time.

Sorry your experience wasn't up to par. In this area, bad phone reception is common. And sometimes, we must take orders under very noisy kitchen environment, talking over loud equipment, exhaust fans, woks . . .

It happened to be so that day. Couldn't hear you at all the 1st call.

When we called back, it was still a spotty connection. We heard you wanted 102 (Palace Special Shrimp) with rice noodles. We tried explaining the 102 comes with white rice (or fried rice). It was frustrating because of the connection - something out of your control. If you heard our voice grew loud or shout-y, it was due to the environment, not our intentions. Then you said you changed your mind.

Again, sorry it came off as a less than happy experience! We hope you give us another chance, and our doors remain open to you in the meantime.

text: Love this restaurant!  It's a standard go to when we are in the area.  Consistently great good, and the service is second to none.  It won't take long for you to see what I mean.  Give it a try, I guarantee you won't be disappointed!

The food here is absolutely amazing... I stopped by for the first time tonight... Picked up a couple of entrees and am simply surprised how great the food is...

There is no dine in service currently.... I spoke to one of the owners of this establishment tonight too... She was pretty awesome and really described the cuisine well...

I honestly did not expect this quality of food down so South... I believe that this restaurant has been in operations since 2001 and now I understand why...

Orange chicken is awesome!!! I have found a gem...

#Godspeed.

name: Comrade Salad
text:
Let me preface this by saying I have eaten at almost every Asian restaurant in the Theodore and Mobile area, so I've been around.

This place has the potential to be good, but it isn't it falls short. I ordered the General's Chicken and it came with Fried Rice and a Vegetable Roll. What I got was.... bad. I watched them microwave the food from my seat, so I already knew what was coming. The chicken has a strange after taste and tasted nothing like what you might expect it to taste like, and the Vegetable Roll was uneatable. Worst of all though was the Fried Rice. It was mushy, not at all fried and made to order and tasted like prepackaged rice.

If this place wants to become a great eating place it needs to wake up. COOK my food, don't reheat it. NOTHING is worse than Fried Rice that is just microwaved. Conversely, I LOVE fresh made rice and won't mind the wait.

Until they start actively making their food to order WHEN it is ordered I will not reccomend this place. Sorry.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for taking time out and giving us feedback! We're sorry your meal did not satisfy your expectations.

Our General Chicken is served fresh from the wok with our own recipe, and eggrolls here have always contained vegetables and shreds of pork.

True fried rice will naturally vary, and today's was on the soft side. We apologize that it didn't match your tastes. We always take good feedback to heart, and aim to improve next time!

name: Dennis Sheffield
text:
Food was very tasty.  All three in my party enjoyed their meals.
The time to get the food was a little long.  But would rather have slow, good food than fast, bad food!
Service was GREAT.   Everyone, everyone was smiling and friendly.  Everything we asked for was attended to promptly.
Only downside was the music.   Not my kind of music.  But I went there to eat, not dance.  Music was NOT too loud.
Would go back in a heartbeat!

name: Bobbie Lee Parker
text: This place is amazing!!! We have been here twice in the past month and absolutely love the food, people, and atmosphere. We had the same server(DD) twice and she is awesome and very attentive. Although we live an hour away, it has become our date night spot.

resp.text: Thank you we appreciate the kind words!

name: Pamela Sparks
text: Best in Jefferson County in my book! We've received great service every time! The music creates a fabulous atmosphere! I'm singing and snapping my fingers the whole time!

name: Dresden Statum
text: As a chef who specializes in seafood, I must say I am very impressed. The food was brilliant. They had very authentic Cajun flavors and the presentation was superb. The only reason it’s not 5 stars is due to the service, the servers don’t seem to have a good system in place for greeting and seating and their attitude left a lot to be desired. Not the worst service I’ve ever had but far from the best. However, the food, atmosphere, and prices are unbeatable. Do yourself a favor and stop by.

resp.text: Thanks, hope to see you soon

name: chantel wilson
text: Love this place. The atmosphere is friendly, pleasant, warm, and inviting. I can't tell you about the seafood you have to try it for yourself. The waitress on top of they game. This the place!

resp.text: Thank you and look forward to seeing you next time

name: Danielle dillard
text: I absolutely love this place! So far I have been twice. The first time I rated my experience an 8/10. However, I also ordered fried food!! No one told me that the boil bags were the way to go. Went back today for lunch and BAYBEEEEEEEEEE those boil bags are the truth. On top of that the atmosphere is laid back and fun. They play a lot of 90's R&B music. I can't wait until the bar opens. I will definitely be visiting frequently

resp.text: Thanks, hope to see you soon

name: Bobby
text: Crab Du Jour is a great place for seafood of all types!  My wife & I have had King Crab Legs, fried fish, shrimp, oysters & the fried calamari.  Their food beats any other seafood restaurant that we’ve visited hands down!  The booths & tables are cleaned well & restrooms are also clean. We always feel welcomed here!  The only thing that we dislike a little is that the hip hop music is sometimes too loud.

resp.text: Thanks, hope to see you soon

name: KeKe Pettis
text: I absolutely love this place!! I went when they first opened and I've been in love every since. My food is always fresh, always seasoned to perfection, and the waiters are fast and knowledgeable!!!

name: Brian Czup
text: Really enjoyed the seafood. Surper fresh, well spiced and plenty to eat. Cajun fries are the bomb. Shrimp were awesome! One thing I hated was the music! Too loud and didn't match the restaurant theme.

name: S. Necole Suggs
text: My daughter and I have tried several places with seafood boils throughout the AL and GA area and we must say this is top 2 on our list of many! This is the first place we did not have to peel the shrimp so that was definitely a PLUS for us and the shrimp were deveined (yes some places don’t have that sadly). We had the Du Jour special mild seasoning and it was so good!! Other places seem to just throw the food in some liquid with minimal to no seasoning but this was perfect! The price is right, not as high as some places but to me you get more of your money’s worth and it’s in a good location in the Galleria. They were fast and the customer service was awesome. We will definitely be back!

resp.text: Thanks, hope to see you soon

name: Brittany Burney
text:
If I could leave less than 1 star I definitely would. This was the worst seafood I have ever had. We got a boil bag and there was so much butter that the seasoning wouldn’t even stick to the food and you couldn’t taste the seasoning. We ordered a Cajun spicy boil bag and all you could taste was butter and garlic. No Cajun in sight. I also ordered a separate order of corn and potatoes and had mild du jour sauce on it and it was corn and potatoes floating in butter with wet seasoning sitting on the top. We had the fried fish basket and it was okay compared to the rest of the food, but definitely not the best. We spent $80 on a bag of butter. I do not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
However, I would give our server 5 stars. Her name was either Dez or Dee I believe. I’m not 100 percent sure. But she was a delight!

resp.text: We will pay attention to your comments, thank you

text: ordered them from doordash and a lot of times i expect average quality food bc it gets cold and soggy during delivery and what not but holy shet was this good. i got the chicken tender poboy because i was craving tendies, and the remoulade sauce? GREAT. the bread? FANTASTIC. not too thick but just thick enough. i also made THREE special requests that they followed to a T. the fries with the poboy are awesome, highly recommend the cajun fries as they aren't too spicy at all. AMAZING i'll definitely order from here again soon

resp.text: Thank you for you review. Unfortunately at our bar we follow all the rules of the law when it comes to alcohol, ingredients to our specialty drinks are all posted. By law we cannot take any hard liquor off a ticket for any reason. And yes when a patron aggressively tells a young manager they are not paying for something then the manage has no option but to get assistance from the police on the matter.

name: Mike Breeding
text: I was sorely disappointed in the birthday party we scheduled. The party was scheduled 1:00-3:00. We showed up around 12:50 assuming it was going to take 10-15 minutes to get all 6 kids setup and ready to play. Unfortunately that wasn’t the case. The kids didn’t get setup and playing until around 1:40 (leaving only an hour to play).  At 2:40 the kids we sent into the party room to eat pizza and open presents.  At 2:50 the guy came in to inform us that we had to be out of there within 10 minutes.  Keep in mind that we paid for 2 hours of playing for the kids and it took 45+ minutes before they all could start playing. The guy that was working informed us that it normally isn’t this troublesome and he wasn’t sure what was wrong  ( we even had a PC crash in the middle of a game within 5 minutes after we finally got it up and running). I will say the only positive to the experience was how nice the staff was but for $275 I expected to at least get an hour and 40 minutes of playing time before eating and we only received maybe an hours worth.  Not worth the money that was spent.

resp.text: We are so sorry to hear this. If it is okay we would like to contact you and offer 1 hour of free gaming for each child who attended.This is not our standard for our parties and we are so sorry. We do hope you give us another chance to redeem our store. We hope to speak to you soon.

name: Josh Serena
text: Great Venue! I came here with my girlfriend and it makes a great date night or a cool family night out. The staff is super fun and helpful. The restaurant is also super good. It's not just cheap arcade food, it's super fresh and made right in front of you! Highly recommend whether you're into video games or not! They really have something for everyone; 6 Solo Virtual Reality Booths, 2 Multiplayer Virtual Reality Booths, a ton PCs, 7 XboxOnes, 7 PS4s, and 2 Custom Virtual Reality Racecars!! The restaurant has custom made pizzas, subs, salads, wings, soft drinks, 20 beers on tap, and a few wines too!

resp.text: Thank you for your review! So glad you both had a wonderful time!

name: Derrick cain
text: I was blown away. I am not a gamer but my kids love to play and I actually got to spend quality time with my children playing VR and console games. The staff was tremendously helpful making me feel like I was part of the gaming community. I enjoyed it so much we booked a birthday party and all 10 kids that came could not believe how fun it was to have an arena for them to compete in. They felt like professional gamers. I could play the VR games all day. They have cold beer on tap and a restaurant with food that was really good and not crazy expensive. We are making this a monthly family fun day.

resp.text: We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your visit. We appreciate the positive feedback. Thank you for your review and hope to see you again soon!

Its a MUST GO TO for gamers of all ages!!
All of the staff were so nice ,attentive, respectful and kind. Two thumbs up for excellent customer service!
They have so many gaming options available at your finger tips you can easily spend hours there and enjoy every minute.  The VR head sets are a definite fav. Eplex is a good clean environment and a wonderful place to go hang out, relax and game hard, its easily 5 stars. I can't wait to go back.

resp.text: We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your visit. Thank you for your review and hope to see you again soon!

name: Jesse Stewart
text: Awesome location. There is plenty of space for events and their hardware is great. This is the best esports location in Birmingham.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review we do appreciate it!

name: Noah Holmes
text: Simply amazing. Loved how good the food was, amazing tournament experience. Kind people and great staff!

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your experience. See you again soon!

name: Ainsley Cohn
text:
Eplex is really a fun time for the whole family. We visited all the way from Baton Rouge (6 hrs away) because there is nothing like it around us. The virtual reality experiences were not only amazing to experience yourself but also fun to watch each other experience. We drove virtual cars, walked virtual planks, fought virtual zombies and so much more. And, of course, if anyone in the family is a gamer....that side of the building is a paradise for them. Not to mention the food was great, and there is even a bar for adults!!
This would be a great place to have birthday parties, a group of friends, or even a fun experience with co-workers too!

resp.text: We are so glad you had a wonderful time! Thank you for leaving us a positive review!

name: Segun Ajigbeda
text: Cool place but got to make sure you're a gamer in order to get your money's worth.

resp.text: Thank you for visiting come again soon!

name: Hornaday quickfire
text: Awesome! I have never golfed but son wanted to try. Let me be clear....reserve your booth early! We called at noon to reserve at 4. The golf experience was great! Staff was terrific! Explained everything. We had fun. Ordered pizza and root beer. Pizza was overpriced, overcooked, frozen pizza. But this isn't a restaurant. Pizza was a snack, same quality at bowling alley or arcade. At the end of the day, yes I will go back.

text: Nice staff. Just as advertised. Bring your own clubs ever if you aren't any good. They have some but can't accommodate everyone for all clubs and lengths.

name: Spencer Callahan
text: I have a blast every time I'm at Fairways. They have a great craft beer selection and the golf simulators provide great feedback for working on your swing, or you can just go and have a good time while enjoying the awesome graphics and wide range of courses. What's better than drinking a good beer and hitting golf balls? Not much... and now you can do it when it's dark or when it's raining outside!

name: Alabama Lucey
text: Only place I know of in Mobile to play inside golf.  They have a bar to get drinks but didn't offer real food, just some snacks.  They had four simulators.  We went on a Thursday and didn't have to wait.  My only real complaint was we paid for an hour, the machine froze up a couple of times and they kept the clock running while we waited for the attendant and while she was fixing it. A little steep on price but if it's raining or very hot it gives you another option.

name: Haley S

I highly recommend checking this place out, especially if you are looking to avoid the "amateur hour" scene!

name: Demetria Jackson
text: They over charge me for a drink and told me I couldn't get my money back or at least they to fix it. He told me 7 for the drink and they charged my card 10 for the drink.

resp.text: We are so happy this was just a misunderstanding. All tabs opened have a single dollar tab charge(standard practice in most bars). All tabs left without closing have an automatic gratuity added (standard as well). Your $7 drink had a $1 tab charge and because the tab was left unclosed there was an added tip making the whole charge an even $10. Please come back soon and we appreciate you communicating any concerns.

name: Toni{JuneBug} Evans-Henderson
text: THIS Place has been a bar as long as i can remember! It's had it's Share of Names&Owners.It's been Beer Garden,Marie's Place,Buddy's Tavern&Many many more.Over the years ive had some great memories made here-The Best Are The 1's with My Daddy Tony Evans. He's deceased now since 98,He spent many hours(every1 teased him about)holdin up the Bar Here, Legion,Alabama Owls,Crazy 8 & BackStreet..Lol.He was Always standin at end of bar holdin it up😂😃😜He Never Sat Much in a bar&he was Always at the End Of The Bars Standin.He was actually 1of the Many Owners Of Beer Garden,Him&his Friends,Buddy's all Hung Out in This Bar&the others I Named as well as Back Street&The H'way Beverage.My Mom Has been a Bartender at all Bars mentioned as well as workin here many moons ago.I can't remember the name when she worked there.I have some Good Memories w/friends&family in Beer Garden,I also have some bad one's(Like The Nights/Mornings I got put out&put on barred list), not proud but been in a couple fights there.(I'm Totally Not Same Person I Was Back Then)I've Grown Up&Grown Period,I'm a Better Person 2day&some that is owed 2the Lessons I Was Taught& I learned at the BeerGarden.I've known all the owners of the Bar,I Knew some from Family,Friends, Mom&or Daddy so I've been goin here since I was under 16yrs old. 1 Great Memory I have from here is Drivin Dwn Bessemer Super Hway& Seein the Car I wanted 4my 16th B'day Parked out Front w/a Big Ribbon&Balloons Tied 2it.Also across My Windshield Said "JUNE- BUG".I REMEMBER ME BALLIN MY EYES OUT WHEN I SEEN IT..LOL. I had No Clue He had Bought it Till I was Driving by&Seen Balloons& A Ribbon on the Dodge Colt Turbo I picked out&I seen"JUNEBUG" Decal on Window&Knew it was mine{I WAS SO HAPPY WHEN I WENT IN 2THANK MY DADDY}I Was A Very Happy 16yr old....I was a Daddy's Girl growin up,I enjoy goin in2 the BeerGarden&Having my Daddy's friends tell me how much I look like him&how He Would b so Proud of me 2day...A friend from school actually owns it now-Carrie Pennington.They use 2have some Good Karaoke Nights w/good Dance Music,a dance floor,  The Best Bartenders&waitresses n Bessemer.They have Pool Tables, Jukebox,Dart board,Great drinks, Great Ppl,Great times= GREAT MEMORIES!!

name: Dee Hem
text: This bar (not a club) is bias on its patrons. They, just like most of the establishments in the Huntsville Downtown district, are catered to a "certain" crowd. Weekly, the dress-code for access changes without any prior notification, mainly because this establishment has no clear guidelines of dress and make the judgements clearly on how they feel that morning. If you are in a group and you do not fit into their certain demographic regardless of dress in accordance, they will refuse service. Groups of certain people of a party over ten have to walk up to the doors in two people teams just to be allowed admittance, only to be followed the entire night. The barkeep would only allow one drink at a time (shot) versus other groups were allowed over several at one time.  It is unfair and it becomes an issue when this business is using business arbitrary rights to hide behind a discriminatory agenda. I will be reporting this business to the BBB.

Make requests of what cigars you'd like to see. BTW..Drew Estates no longer perfumes their boxes so having Acids and traditionals is of zero consequence and does not reflect poorly on this retailer. text: I always have a great experience here. If I'm not sure what I'm looking for, or where to find it, there is always someone behind the counter willing to help me out. Everyone I've meet who works here are genuine nice people. They have a wide selection!!! Just about anything you'd want you'll find here. Highly recommend! I will continue to be a recurring customer!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review! We love helping our wonderful customers!

name: P Guice
text:
I love liquor express. They have the biggest and best selection of craft beer in town. There are plenty of small craft beer stores with great selection in the area but you can usually find something you haven't seen anywhere else in the area.

I can't say I've bought much liquor or wine here (Unless the advertise something on sale or something rare on social media) but they do have a very large selection of both.

They also have a craft beer and whiskey bar. Probably the most taps in town and they always have interesting stuff you can't get anywhere else on tap. It's hard to just pick a few! Also I've only ever dealt with nice bartenders and staff here.

Whether it's going and having a drink or picking up something to go, liquor express has got what you need.

name: Gene Vogel
text: Has to be the best store in Alabama. Great selection of craft beers, and a good amount of wine and spirits as well. (Cigars are also available.)

name: Mino Matathia
text: Excellent place. Very incoming and servicing people. Many kinds of beers and also local ones. Havent seen such variety for a long time. Great experience!

name: Doug Shelton
text: A great selection of beers from around the country and the world.  Surprising findings (a shelf of meads!) and a long tap list if you have time to sit and sip.

name: Sean Terry
text: Great selection of beer, wine and mead. Also a decent whiskey selection though the process on whiskey are a bit much. Definitely go here for the beer though, just the best.

text: Great selection! And it has my favorite hard cider, 1911! And cheaper than Windmill too and it's near where I live. It may be pricier in some liquors, but it is worth it for the selection and convience

text: I love this place. They have a huge selection of both domestic and craft beer and the descriptions of the wines are great.

resp.text: Thank you! We work hard to ensure you always have a wide selection and enough info to make an informed decision on your purchase. Thanks for being our customer!

text: This place is amazing. I'll make the hour and a half drive just to stock up here.   It's a beer geek dreamland.  The alabama brew review podcast approves!

text: Largest beer selection in HSV. Growlers available and large tap list as well.

name: Dawn Cangelosi
text: Place have everything under one roof.   Stop by for local and craft beers and wine.  Plus liquor.   It even has the local beers.

name: Stéphane Schneider
text: Good selection and pprices as reasonable as possible in the area. The tap wall is hit or miss depending how well the lines are cleaned though.

name: Robert Yentsch
text: Great selection and helpful staff.  Helped me find a special beer that we couldn't get anywhere else in town.  Nice ambiance in the store, too.

name: Chris Browning
text: Prices are a little high but great service nonetheless

name: M Mac
text: If you want it, they got it. Liquor express is a great place to pick your poison. They have a massive selection of alcohol! I was able to find my Soju! The store even has a bar inside for those wanting to sample their stuff. 10/10 will come again. Its better than just about any other plain liqeuor store I have been to. Definitely check it out. 🖤

name: shaun mclaughlin
text: Amazing selection. Definitely going back to try the beers on tap

name: Carla Dupree
text: Most of the staff is rude and they seem annoyed to deal with customers.  ...prices are high... 2 stars because they have a decent wine selection.

name: Chase Dyer
text: Great hours, but obviously higher prices.

name: Danik Sh
text: A great variety of beer and nice atmosphere:)

name: Stephen Kerr
text: The staff is super nice, all wearing masks, and the beer selection was phenomenal

name: Daniel Richard
text: Haven't lived in Huntsville in years but always swing by to stock up on local beers when I get the chance.

name: ken bubbett
text: Great service! Good selection.

name: Bartlee Linton
text: Great selection and very knowledgeable staff.

name: Jeff “Houpty” Houpt
text:
Great selection of draft and packaged beers.  If they don't have what you're looking for, then there's probably something even better there to try.
Plus a large selection of wine and liquor if you're in the mood for that.

name: Ashley Gendron
text: Great variety of craft brews and wines! And a great tap if you're looking to have a drink.

name: Stephanie S
text: Great beer selection bottles, cans and draft. And also a friendly staff.

name: Bailey Childers
text: Mine and my boyfriends favorite liquor store. Prices are pretty reasonable and its close to home

name: Martin Jankowski
text: Great selection of local and regional beer.

name: Jacob Authement
text: Pretty good selection of bourbon. Good prices on some things, others not so much, but liquor prices in alabama are all over the place so...

name: Robbie Burns
text: High quality selection, and good prices!!!!

name: Abebe Abchebe
text: Nice place, friendly owner and staff and variety of beer, call it beer garden. You don't have to buy and leave, you can hang and drink some at the bar. You can test before buying. I was lucky to get a beer that is only available once a year.

name: Paul Garcia
text: Always a large selection of beer. They have e a large selection of craft beers on tap.

name: Garrett Hipkins

name: Garrett Hipkins
text: Great craft beer selection.

name: Paul Garcia
text: Always a large selection of beer. They have e a large selection of craft beers on tap.

name: Kevin Bishop
text: Good place for craft beer

name: Ethan Couch
text: Baller, Clem da shiz

name: Guy Incognito
text: Unfortunately I've had a pretty bad experience.  I ordered a 1/6bbl keg over a week ago.  I talked to two different store associates and told them that I need a keg of Oktoberfest by October 10th.  I told them that I am hosting an Oktoberfest party that day.  They assured me that they can have it for me and that they'll call if things don't work out.  Alas, today, October 9th, I call.  "Oh, yeah, that wasn't available..."  So now I'm scrambling to find a place that may have a keg of something.

name: Jason Hickey
text: Awesome selection of beers of all kinds at great prices. We find ourselves stopping by at least weekly.

name: Bruce Woody
text: Pretty fair service at tha tap wall bar, and as always an excellent as always!

name: Angel Queen
text: Huge selection. Everything was easy to find & the employees were very helpful. Will definitely be back!

name: Shannon Bradley
text: They don't never have what I want.

name: Brandon Whorley
text: Tiny bit more expensive than ABC l, but not by a whole bunch. People are helpful, and pretty chill for the most part. Freakin huge selection

name: Shannon Bradley
text: They don't never have what I want.

name: Todd Hess
text: They have a great selection of beer and wine here. They also have liquor, but you will have a hard time finding the fine wines and beers they carry here. They also hold weekly events several days each week. You will not be disappointed by visiting here.

name: Russell williams
text:
Very knowable about there product
Greeted you at upon entrance of the establishment and professional.
Go and see fir yourself
Great service and good PRICES👍👍👍

name: kishan patel
text: I just turned 21 today and was very much excited about the whole day. I really enjoy beer expecally German. The women that works there was amazing. I could not find the beer that I wanted so she willing went to the back and got the 6pack of the beer that I wanted and gave me a free glass because she realized it was my birthday. Definitely going back there.

name: Seth Presley
text: Fantastic establishment of spirits and ales. Highly trained and knowledgeable staff. Good atmosphere. Good public participation events plus a bar that runs tap through the depth of the building. One complaint and it's more at the Alabama ABC setup... Ehrmm...  It's pricey

name: Ted Elam
text: Need to live closer, love the on tap beers

name: Wm Thor Kissman
text: Always great selection in the coolers and scores more on tap for in store or at home imbibing

name: ROCKET CITY RECORDS
text: Always excellent except for the top flight security of the world 🤷🏾‍♂️

name: Nate Mehl
text: One of the best craft beer selections in Huntsville. Reasonable prices. Also lots of craft beers on tap at the bar!

name: Sherry Farmer
text: Found out about the small bar area with LOTS of draft beers tonight. ☺️ Impressed & will be back to visit as well as make this my regular stop for 🍻 🍷🍸🥃.

name: Craftpocalypse
text: Awesome craft beer shop. Fantastic selection, knowledgeable staff. Highly reccomended.

name: Tom Koch
text: Lots of liquor choices. Friendly service. Many craft beers including international choices. I am not a wine drinker,  but I noted a fairly large selection of wines. There is also a beer bar where you can sample quite a few options on tap.

name: Jaime E.
text: Even if you don't want them to, they'll really do it to ya! Great job! Excellent work! Keep it up!

name: Deb Lattimore
text: Not much to choose from ☹️
