text: Meh, didn't have what we were looking for

name: Erica Ham
text: I mean they sell Liquor. Whats not to love lol

name: Lady K
text: Sit and sip or grab and go. Nice little place to stop for beers on tap.

name: Brittni Simms
text: I love this store. It's literally like walking into a mall with alcohol!

name: Talesha Pritchett
text: Very convenient and open daily

name: Seth Anderson
text: Good place to buy specialty craft beers from out of state. But local craft and popular craft is way cheaper at Target, Walmart, Kroger, etc. It is frustrating when you buy a 12 pack of craft beer at Liquor Express and find out at the counter it's more expensive than two six packs of the same beer. Bought a 12 pack of Bell's Two Hearted Ale it was $21.50. The total was $23.42... a six-pack of the same beer is $9.99 per the label.

resp.text: Was the 21.50 including tax?

name: jason clement
text: Very good place for that off the wall beer and some of your favorites also. Plus many many beers from around the region. Good place. And they have a good bit on tap as well.

name: maria meador
text: It seems like every time I go there is this one store associate that acts like I am bothering him when I am checking out. I ask for another bag because the clerk put all the beers in one bag  and the bag start to split open. When I asked him for another bag , he gave me an attitude and ask why? Plus a lot of the time they don’t wear masks.

name: Brandon Williams
text: Best beer store in town. Come for a a six pack, stay for a fresh one at the bar chatting with the locals, more selections than you'll have patience, but they're all good, so don' worry mon.

name: Jeff Bennett
text: Nice place but the prices were substantial

name: dab 8430
text: This place is awesome. They have one of the largest displays and largest selections of just about every type, brand, flavor, and size of about any alcoholic beverages made. They have all local breweries down to some of the strangest imports from around the world. If your looking for a certain type of alcohol or just looking to try something different from the other side of the world then this is the store for you. I garuntee you will find something to try and enjoy.

name: Elsa Roberts
text: They have every beer I could ever want and then some I didn't even know I wanted. I could live inside of this establishment.

name: Jonathan Hayes
text: Always enjoyed the vast selection and availability of both local and other American craft beers

name: Victoria Duncan
text: I found something just like what i was looking for; to replace my supervisors gift

name: Corey Lyman
text: Love this place if they don't have it they can get it. And the selection provides something you will love even though you didn't know you wanted it or it existed

name: Chris M
text: Great choice and nice environment. Every time I want to buy liquors, this is my first try. I always find something suitable. They could also add a tasting section/evening for some products... that would be amazing!

name: Crowe
text: Always courteous, always have great music. I appreciate the positivity and the speed in which they operate.

name: Snake Oil String Benders
text: Had a beer in the taproom. Great atmosphere,  friendly and knowledgeable staff

name: Jon Black
text: If you have a thing for beer.. craft beers and anyting relative to the more versatile and variously variety beer market... From Sours, Gosé, Tripels, Stouts and (I)nsanely (P)leasing (A)wesomeness... This is the spot. Don't get me into the wine variety because this is going to be a long post. Have a beer on tap... then proceed to go next door and get your top-shelf bourbon bottle and drive safely home. But this is a spot. 💯

name: Lawrence Nevils
text: Best Prices in Huntsville. Tarantula Tequila hard find. My to go place for all my party needs.

name: Kyle Howard
text: Great selection of spirits and craft beer. Also a great spot to sit for a casual beer or 4

name: Tito
text: The best beer selection in Huntsville. On tap or in a cooler. Liquor or craft beer they have it all. A true gem.

name: Caleb
text:
The selection of beer is better than most. I like malty and dark beers and had no trouble finding something. I haven't looked at the wine, yet.

And the service was excellent. I couldn't say an unkind word about the gentleman who served us.

name: Charlie Murphy
text: There are a lot of great beer stores in town but liquor express has a huge selection or wine and liquors as well.  I like to drop buy and grab random bottles/beers without looking at it.  Haven't been disappointed yet!

name: Steve K
text: Absurdly overpriced.  Plan on paying 20-30% more for beers that are also available in a grocery store.   $28.99 for a case of Miller Lite.  SMH

name: Kristaleen Bellamy
text: HUGE selection of craft beer and wines. Not a ton of liquor but they did have some harder to find things.

name: Erik Walsh
text: Best beer store in town. Extremely helpful employees.

name: bev bauer
text: Great selection of all forms of alcohol. Clean pretty store and taproom.

name: Jeremy Ray
text: Super friendly staff. Excellent beer and wine selections. The tap room is a great place to duck out of the Alabama summer time heat and try out some different suds. I love this place, and I love that I can bring my dog!

text: Great huge selection

text: Great place lot’s of choices you can sit down and have a beer and if you like it get some to go . Wine to . And they are working on being able to try whiskey at the bar .

text: I like the place! Nice folks, great beer selection (need more Mad Malts beer). Always treat me right!

text: They have a great amount of taps with every style of beer represented well.

name: Richard York
text: Great service and prices. The staff is always helpful and are willing to help. Plus they will take the time to order things at special request if you ask.. Excellent business

name: Amber Robertson
text: Store is always jammed packed..yardley any packing spaces. Ppl working bv the always act like you're bothering them if u have a question  or need help. Now I remember why I stopped coming here

text: They were great!! Great employees as well!!!

name: Amputee Adventurer (Sochi)
text: Great selection in the store and at the bar.

name: Mister JSL
text: Wonderful as usual!  Ashleigh was great and can't wait to go back!

name: kyle brown
text: The absolute best place in the city to buy beer. If you want it, they have it. Einstok, Kronenbourg, Golden Monkey, etc. They also have the best selection of local brews. If you don't know what to get you can go in the corner and grab a 6 pack topper and mix and match some cans to get a good variety.

name: lioninarobe
text: I love this store. Great customer service. Very well mannered. Prices are average, craft beer excellent! Bar closes earlier then the store. Just wish the bar could stay open as long as the store does.

name: Will Taylor
text: Next best place to the ABC Store

name: Trina H
text: I came home for about a week, and  came here for about 3 of those nights just for the "beer, in a liquor store" service - even invited friends! The bartenders were friendly and attentive. Patrons of the bar had food delivered from nearby restaurants. They have wifi. The beer list is AMAZING!!!!! I loved the Madura.

name: Frankie Bradford Jr.
text: The guys are very knowledgeable. Gave some good advice. Worth going back again.

name: christopher hardemon
text: I would like to start by thanking Aaron and staff for all their diligent efforts in assisting in the launch GG's speakeasy and events. The ambience of the room was incredible from the projection system along with the various works of art and pottery (all pieces I do believe can be purchased). We were provided with ample kitchen that made set up and break down seamless. I truly hope is the beginning of a very mutually beneficial relationship for all parties involved.

name: Brady Doepke
text: One of the best places in Huntsville to find something interesting and different to drink

name: Joshua B
text: They'd get a 5 if they ran an honest business.  Hard to be an honest business when your advertised hours difference than reality.   Hire a person who is honest to open it on time, and apparently close as advertised.

name: Jimmy Bailey
text: Flights are the best thing! Perfect for trying all these unique beers.

name: Stacey Schrimsher
text: No longer allows the breaking of packs, and the selection has really gotten bad. Miss the way it was a few years back. Staff was much better and more friendly. They don't carry much of anything we like anymore.

name: Pedro Acosta
text: Why can't I return unopened product ?

name: Taylor Von Terror Pinup
text: Best spot!!! Great beer, 100 taps to choose from and fully stocked refrigerators so you can take home your favorites. The service is always great and Jessa is the bomb! Love it here

name: Rick Hyburg
text: Excellent beer selection!  Gotta check them out if you're looking for craft beer!  Also looked like they had about 50 taps or so.

name: Brooke Graham
text: The new location is amazing and definitely worth a visit!  Best variety of beer in east Huntsville.  Also sells beer games, home brew equipment and guides, one-of-a-kind decorative growlers.  Check their calendar online too - they host some cool events.

name: john hillin
text: The best place if you're looking for craft beer they have just about everything you could want and if they don't they will find it for you

name: Jamie Tersinar
text: They have pretty much any and every type of liquor and beer

name: Deric Conner
text: My after normal business hours spot. Love it, but kinda pricey.

name: Jose Rey
text: Not sure why this place was rated high, large selection but high prices. The two guys at counter lacking people skills not friendly at all.

name: princessncntrol G
text: The cashier saw my military ID and said you get a 5% discount. This was my first visit but it won't be my last...

name: Dennis Woods
text: Best selection of craft beer in Huntsville. It has hundreds of beers on tap, bottled and canned. The ultimate go to beer store.

name: Matt Frost
text: Best place in Huntsville to get craft beer and liquor. They have wall of draft beers, you can drink while you shop, or just chill and crack open a cold one with the boys. Plenty of seats with a bonus theater room. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff.

name: Kalvin Click
text: Ain't never been there

name: Brian Windsor
text: Excellent selection, great staff, nice layout.

name: William Hill
text: Selection was amazing. Craft beer paradise

name: Austin Craft
text: The new location is very sweet. Its a very nice spot to get a beer and to watch a game in their lounge. Good prices. A lot nicer than going to the ABC store

name: Thomas Groover
text: It's seriously a great place. Liquor Express has been my go-to place for over a decade and has only improved over that time. It should almost be called Craft Beer Express these days, but they still have plenty of liquor...and wine. I like it all!

name: Tyler Parker
text: Love the selection of craft beers!

name: Kris Gibson
text:
Definitely one of the best stores in North Alabama to beer shop at. Extensive selection both on tap and bottled/canned. A good go to for liquor if the ABC store is closed.

The staff can be hit or miss sometimes but almost all of my interactions and transactions here have been pleasant. Most of them will have really good recommendations if you just ask.

The hit or miss about the staff has to do with pricing. Three out of the last five times I've been in there a product rings up more at the register than what's indicated on the pricing sticker (both on the shelf and attached to the product itself). Once I found a single product with three different prices on the bottles. When brought to the staff's attention they've acted put out that I called them on the pricing issue. At this point I think this is a pretty consistent issue with this store. It's at worst defrauding people on purpose or at best laziness on the staff's part.

name: Brett Rogers
text: Great selection and a great staff. Always a pleasant experience and plenty of beer to choose from. The bar closes a little early, but they will still fill growlers after 11.

name: Kathleen Skemp Zimmerman
text: Liquor Express is the best place in town to find a variety of good beers. The staff is knowledgeable and helpful. The huge selection can be overwhelming and their guidance is welcome. Unless you are stopping by for a specific brand, be prepared to spend a long time pursuing the case with awe. My only criticism is that they emphasize craft so much that there isn’t enough of the imports that are hard to find.

name: james ivy
text: Great selection, decent prices, great n friensly staff, some of which (some of the guys) are eye candy haha. Definitely recommend atleast giving the place a try. 👍

name: Michael Colston
text: I love the selection of draft and bottles. A little pricey though. The staff is good too

name: Battle Kitten
text: Way overpriced. Hipster crowd I hate was here. Bar waitress stayed behind bar you had to walk up to get drinks they kept my card like we were going to Rob them. Some of the beer was good. Not the kind of place I would hang though

name: David Jentink
text: Pretty good selection for such a small location.

name: whitney randolph
text: Always a nice selection

name: Kay Campbell
text: Beer Lover paradise -- gobs on tap to taste, & widest selection of regional & international brews. Knowledgeable workers who aren't condescending to a customer who doesn't know that much about beer.

name: William Moore
text: Liquor Express in Huntsville is the best place in north Alabama to get local and not-so-local beer on tap.  Most of their staff has a large amount of experience in local brews and can almost always recommend something to your tastes.  If you have a chance, take Wednesday's suggestions; he's a beer snob and proud of it.  You won't regret his suggestions.

name: Cooper Bloom
text: Yes! A little expensive on bottom shelf and well but very reasonable for middle and top shelf. Has bar with many taps. Good selection

name: OrissaStorm
text: Even though a little under staffed, they still have a nice facility and a polite manager. He was very helpful.

name: vidalia jewel
text: Great selection but need to have a better selection of pick six or allow you to break packs

name: Chris Moore
text: Largest selection of beers in Huntsville for both take home and on premises consumption.  They also have a fair wine selection as well as liquor.  The staff is always friendly and willing to help you find your favorite beer or make recommendations for new beers to try.  The bar is a nice place to have a pint and join in good conversation.

name: OrissaStorm
text: Even though a little under staffed, they still have a nice facility and a polite manager. He was very helpful.

name: Lee Stockman
text: Good beer selection for sale and on tap.  Friendly engaging staff that will talk with you if you engage them.  Awesome media room in the back now that football season is here.

name: David Jentink
text: Pretty good selection for such a small location.

text: Fun place for a beer and pet the local dogs. They need nuts or popcorn or some snack. Otherwise quaint.

name: Tyler Parker
text: Love the selection of craft beers!

text: Huge selection of beer and wine.  I love that you can just grab one or 2 bottles or even build your own 6 pack. Super nice workers. Clean beautiful space.

text: Great selection but need to have a better selection of pick six or allow you to break packs

text: Finest destination I've found for a wide variety of fine & craft beers in Alabama.  In all honesty I never came across a place of this caliber even when I lived in Atlanta.  (Though I'm sure there could be one) I would estimate around one hundred beers on tap and many MANY more bottled & canned. Also Southern Growler located there makes growlers that are art as well as functional!

text: Not being from there, it was awesome to find such a wide range of adult beverage choices. If I travel to again, definitely would stop if in need. :)

text: Love the bottle and tap selection. Love the new location now that we can sample/drink beer there on the spot. The only negative is the organization. If I am in the mood for a stout or an IPA or whatever, I should be able to hit section by beer type. Finding beer by region is lame and terribly inefficient.

name: Bo Hines
text: Amazing selection! Handsome, knowledgeable staff! 10/10 will come again!!!

name: Derek Battle
text: Lots of taps, lots of beer, wine, liquor. Friendly staff.  They don't have every beer you know of but considering it's Alabama, It's a good effort.

name: Doug Ehrle
text: Very friendly.  Store hours do not reflect service hours due to Alabama State law.  Bar service ends at 10:00PM.  This is both a package store and a tap room.

name: Essentially Shannon
text: This is not my first time going to liquor express, however it will be my last. I went into the store last night not realizing that my drunken neighbor works there. We've had words a few times about our dogs and especially if she gets drunk. It's my birthday haven't had time to drink been busy working. I spend at least 15 mins trying to decide what I want to drink and she never says a word to me. As I approach the counter she proceeds to say "I'm not coming home to another drunken fight about the dogs, plus you look intoxicated I'm not going to sell to you." I stand there for a second speechless because she is the one always drunk coming down to my house talking mess about nothing. I say to her really? Then I ask her for a number where I can reach someone in management. You can Google it I don't know it, is her response. I look on their Facebook page and see that a few other people have had to deal with the same thing. I thought a business' main goal was to make money.... apparently if she doesn't like you she will try to embarrass you and use the line I have the right to refuse service to anyone in the state. Thankfully Liquor Express isn't the only liquor store in Huntsville. I hate that I am only one person because if I could I would stop as much business from that store as possible. It's a shame because I have been going there for years...

text: I only go on league nights (Friday) to watch a friend play. Tables are many, around 20 maybe more. A/c is good. They sell supplies and offer repair services. Best pool hall I've ever been to!

name: Jason Burrus
text: I just walked in and said I wanted to play league billiards. These guys got me signed up and on a team that week. Has been a great place full of friendly faces to learn and improve my game. Great tables, good food, clean, friendly staff...awesome!

name: Angel
text: One of the best places to shoot some pool and hang out with friends. The staff is awesome and will take great care of you. They have a great drink selection and they also have a small kitchen that pumps out one of the best club sandwiches in Pelham.

name: Robert Chambers
text: I went to papa g’s tonight to shoot a few games and check the place out. They have a great atmosphere and really good tables. There’s no smoking inside which was even better. Very clean, everything neat and in place. Plenty of room around the tables to shoot and good lighting over the table. The pro shop really does good work, had him install a new tip for me, he took his time and made sure it was right(sorry can’t remember his name). They also have a nice selection of cues in house competitively priced. I will definitely be going back.

name: Heather Bridgman
text: Huge pool hall. Prices are great, for the regular tables. Wasn't properly informed on prices for 9 foot tables. Overall, a great place to play. Staff was very friendly.

name: Hayden Wood
text: The staff here is INCREDIBLE! It seriously feels like walking into the set of Cheers. Everyone is friendly, personable, and helpful. They keep a tight ship and the place always looks nice. And The food and drink is really good too!

And the owner: Michael Glass is one of the most humble men I've ever met.. So.. With that being said.. We are apart of the POPPA Gs family... You will love it and I... promise u will come back for the 2nd, and 3rd and so on..  God bless

text: website said 6$ a table, rude lady said 6$ per person, and why do you have to be 21 to play pool????

resp.text: Hey Carloss,  sorry to hear about this.  As you can see our official website @ https://poppagsbilliards.com doesn't show any pricing.   You don't have to be 21 to play pool but you do have to be 21 to be in a bar in Pelham, AL.  We'd love to chat with you in regards to any of our staff being rude so that we can fix any issues necessary.  As you can see by all our other reviews that are 5 stars, customer service is priority and something we take great pride in.  Feel free to give us a call or come by during business hours and we'll be happy to do whatever possible to make sure your next Poppa G's visit is nothing shy of a 5-star experience.

text: Great little bar in auburn.  Ordered the spicy chicken sandwich and boiled peanuts.  Very good.  Also good draft beer selection.  Wife ordered the gumbo and it was really good.

name: Wyatt Northrup
text: Really creative pub food with great atmosphere. Prices are very reasonable.

name: Marley Livingston
text: I went to Plaza twice in one week! Once to try it out with my husband on our off day and I wouldn’t shut up about it the next day at work and went and got tots and war burgers for everyone I work with at The Flower Store. They all LOVED IT. The price and atmosphere are so so great and something I feel Auburn’s been missing in its massive growth recently. Being a local, it felt like the perfect neighborhood dive bar. It also seems like they’ve been handling COVID great as a new business which I can’t imagine dealing with. Everything on the menu is great and Auburn’s lucky to have this place and the people who run it. Much love to everyone there.

name: Jack Stevens
text: The wait is a little long but worth it. Good ole  American bar/comfort food, good atmosphere, and well stocked bar.

name: Christian Long
text: Have been going to Plaza twice a week since they opened—food is fantastic, my favorites are the Soul Rolls and Warburger. Great drinks and large craft beer selection with professional and friendly bartenders! Also love the beach bar atmosphere, very welcome addition in a town with lots of college centric speed bars.

name: Clint Wilson
text: War Burgers!! Incredible food and atmosphere. Go ahead and order three burgers because they are the bomb(be sure to dip burger in the war burger sauce). Boiled peanuts were best I’ve ever had and cheesy tots were wonderful. Good local hangout with a cool staff. My whole family loved this place and will be back soon.

name: Christi Wheeler
text: Go to Plaza!!  Cool vibe,  delicious food and great service at the best new spot at Midtown in Auburn  Boiled peanuts,  tots and a super cold beer get it started and then do yourself a big favor and get that Warburger!! We had to order more for the meat eaters, halfway through the meal.  If you’re a vegetarian, go ahead and order 2 of the Impossible Warburgers, seriously they’re that good.  I’ve never had a better veggie burger!  Can’t wait to get back there- thank you Plaza!

name: Jeff Smith
text: Great atmosphere, bartender was excellent, food was average.

name: Joe Campbell
text: My wife and I shared the sausage dog, crispy chicken sandwich, boiled peanuts, and cheesy tots and we were not disappointed! The food was amazing and they have a great drink selection. Eating at Plaza will be a regular occurrence from now on!

name: Sophie Kiehl
text: My first trip to Auburn was truly amazing, and this Bar and Lounge really topped off an amazing weekend! The staff was super polite, the food was to die for, and the overall atmosphere in the facility was very welcoming and enjoyable. 10/10 would recommend!!!

name: Justin Wilson
text: Great atmosphere and food.

name: Patrick Chisholm
text: I have had the Warburger and it is so good.  I also tried the Crispy Chicken Sandwich and it was awesome. Love this place. The staff is very friendly. I will be back for sure.

name: Max Wilcher
text: I had the Soul Rolls and Wickles Boiled Peanuts!! Delicious. Soul roll sounds weird but trust me its good especially with the sauce thats at the condiments stand!! Great staff, laid back fun atmosphere! Will definitely come back often!

name: Travis Engram
text: Great new spot to hangout, enjoy a burger and a beer. The cheese tots are amazing and the war-burger is tasty and original.

name: Mark Barber
text: Not greeted when we came in. Food was very pricey for what it was. The Instagram makes it look sooo good. The burger sauce is very watery. Not acknowledged when we left. The shrimp roll was tiny for the price. The food was made hot and fresh so that was a positive. Will try it again, but the first impression was not any better than the way you are treated at McDonald’s. 25$ for a burger, a shrimp roll and one order of tots with no drink is not cheap so I think it should be great all around.

name: James Wesley
text: Excellent people, food, service, and atmosphere.

name: Paige Moore
text: Love this dive bar!! Lots of outdoor seating, original menu items, family friendly atmosphere.

name: Kaylie Campbell
text: Amazing food, amazing drinks, and an amazing atmosphere 😍 My husband and I will definitely be back!

name: Katherine Stine
text: Let me just say this place is an excellent addition to the Auburn/Opelika area. Located in the new development of Midtown, the atmosphere is relaxing, yet fun! We stopped in on a Friday and tried an assortment of food and beverages! The Soul Rolls were an egg roll with a southern bbq twist... AMAZING! We also tried the Cheesy Tots, the Wickles Pickles boiled peanuts and the chips & dip. The Warburger was also excellent and lived up to all the hype. Definitely don’t forget to get one of their slushy drinks! We will be back for round two for sure!

name: Hardy Gilbert
text: Order one Warburger and you will be furious - furious you didn’t order two!!!!

name: John Field
text: Very rarely have I been more disappointed in service. After a seven and a half hour drive and checking into my hotel I asked the front desk clerk where I might find some decent food and atmosphere (it was a few minutes before 8pm at this time), unfortunately I was directed here. I walked in and waited since there was no sign stating "wait to be seated" or "seat yourself", I stood there for 5 minutes with no one approaching me although several staff walked within 10 feet of me. Finally I just sat myself at an empty table (it was maybe three quarters full) and waited another 10 minutes without ever being approached again. At this point I simply walked out. This establishment clearly doesn't get Southern hospitality or service industry!

name: San
text: They were out of Corona 🤪 so I went with light

name: Pam Honeycutt
text: Such an awesome place!  The food was superb and so was the service.  Cheeseburgers with sweet potato fries and onion rings ... the best we have had in a long time.

name: Karen Moore
text: First time dropping by this new Cullman place.  I was expecting the normal redneck bar but to my surprise, it was a nice little clean tavern.  I had the thin pizza, met some new friends, listened to a pretty good band, and called it a night, all in about an hour and half.

name: Elizabeth B
text: So online it says they close at 1 a.m but they were closed by 12. I was going to ask what time they actually closed so I would know for future reference but  before I could ask the very rude just yelled they were closed multiple times then was very rude and said the chairs flipped up should have told you that. I will not go to a place where the staff is this rude for no reason.

name: Janna Hayes
text: The service was awful! Waited about 20 minutes just for a menu. Then an additional 45 minutes for our food that was only slightly warm. The burger might as well had been from McDonald’s. Would have rather had McDonald’s! Fries were undercooked and soggy. Only thing that saved the sweet potato fries was whatever sauce they sent with it. The water tasted like they had washed dishes in it. The chicken was dry. 10/10 do not recommend! All around a bad experience!!

name: Geralyn Boone
text:
Ok, Entertainment is the Best! I would have given a 5 for that.. BUT, getting charged for stuff you did not purchase is another thing! Myself, fiancé and son sat at the bar and had several drinks, enjoying the Band. We got our bill, paid with a 20% tip. I thought the bill seemed steep, therefore, asked for the break down bill! Weird, that wasn't given to me in the beginning? I even questioned the amount with the bartender, Andrew, who reassured me the bill was correct.That was a Lie! There were charges for alcohol we never drank!! Fact! We realized after getting home and checked the bill, we were charged for other people's drinks! I felt I was stolen from...called immediately, of course, they act like no big deal We just stole from you!
What if I would have never questioned or checked?  Manager says it was only $17/$18 ....?? WOW!! No big deal..??Thank God I questioned and looked at the bill!
Be weary!
They were so nonchalant about accidentally stealing my money?Do Not leave your card with them!!!!!!!!
Be leary!

name: Katie Broach
text: Really enjoyed our night! I got the Buffalo Wrap and my husband got the Chicken Parmesan sandwich! Both were amazing! Andrew was very nice! We already want to bring family and friends back!

text: Great food , great beer selection! Brian , Carl, Krissy are the best!

Great beer variety on tap and in cans, and the people who work here are both friendly and knowledgeable. Atmosphere-wise, the train theme is really neat and the background music is always good.

In terms of covid precautions, barstools and tables are spaced appropriately and all staff wear masks properly.

text: The mixes of the iced drinks were really good. It was a fun time sitting outside with family and we even ordered food to go with the drinks. This establishment doesn't serve food. But it was fun.

name: Debbie Miller
text: The Customer Service is Top Notch, as well as the drinks. I got a mixture of everything, except the chocolate & the whites, it was very good & I slept very good😉 I did NOT drive: Side note, PLEASE DON'T DRINK & DRIVE. I like how you have choice to sit inside or outside. The location is Great as well because it's next to Mellow Mushroom; they don't sale food, but you can eat next door (you can NOT bring your drink in there though).

name: Tiffany Eubanks
text: Breanna took great care of us here!! Atmosphere and drinks were fabulous, and Breanna was so fun, caring and conversational, even suggesting awesome drink combinations for us. 10/10, definitely will visit again!

name: Sherrita Moncrief
text: Mike was super in finding something my tastebuds liked. I really enjoyed with my daughter and momz!  I will return. Can't wait till they serve bar food with it. Nice atmosphere also!!!

name: Lewis J
text: It's "Wet Willie's" but it's not Wet Willie's. They don't serve food and their drinks aren't as good as the ones in other locations but it's still "Wet Willie's". Customer service could have been alot better too but hopefully as they progress they'll get better.

name: Felecia Autry
text: Love the idea that you can bring outside food in!

name: Greg
text: Love these places. Fun drinks and Montgomery allows you to take it with you. Only one block from the Riverfront so it makes a nice stroll.

name: Robert “Clif” Weatherly III
text: The drink I has tasted sour but the service was good

name: Kenneth Porter
text: Great drinks! Good prices

name: lasioncox
text: Good location. Nice owners. Okay prices.

name: Porscha Williams
text: Great selection but confused about this location not having food. We were expecting more. Has potential for growth.

name: Cassandra Miller
text: They have really really good and the customer service is good as well

name: Thomas Van Howe
text: Nice spot! $9 for the medium, but it’s tasty.

name: Reneka huggins
text: Great drinks, pretty nice atmosphere... I just wished they served food lol

name: LeAnna Robins
text: Good service and a great idea all around.

name: Lashawn Moten
text: Great drinks with a huge selection

name: Kenny Hall
text: Nice place... Good drinks

name: JT Da Bagga
text: Ooohhh yeah the best get the  Super Women!!!!! $10 You'll be LIT!!!!!! And April's the best

name: Tyrone Graham
text: love the drinks and service

name: Stoney Michigan
text: Love the "call a cab"

name: Richard Aldrich
text: Great Hospitality

name: Sharita Bruce
text: Great service!

name: Kendall O'Neal
text: Very nice place to relax and chill

name: Crystal Williams
text: Great place to have drinks!!

name: Adonis James
text: You get try before you buy

name: Tristian Jackson
text: Had the call a cab

name: CARLTON LANDRUM
text: Try the Wille Dazed and the Shock Treatment  mixed together Its off the chain😒

name: Shoe Artillery
text: Great

name: jacob d
text: Way over priced!

name: Tamalieta Moore
text: Doesn't agree with my stomach

name: Paula Harris
text: Great place

name: Marcus Blakemore
text: This place was jumping

name: Nicole D
text: With friends!

name: Earl Mauger
text: Spin off of Fat Tuesdays....weak alcohol content, too cold to drink, and expensive.

name: Melanie Bean
text: Wonderful customer service!!! Great drinks!!!

name: Neit Hodges
text:
This place is ok. They have a bar and a pool table and karaoke. They have a red carpet to walk on outside which is cool if you like that glamorous vibe.

I had fun there when I karaoke Savage by Meg thee stallion. I also song Alicia Keys.

They smoke inside which is a downer. Also not many people of color come at all. So the crowd is NOT diverse. But still an ok place if you just want to do karaoke for an hour or two.

resp.text: I’m sorry. I’m afraid I’m not sure how to respond to this review. Are you sure you were at the bar you left a review for? There is absolutely no smoking allowed, and it’s strictly enforced. Also, we celebrate being the most inclusive bar in the area, with an abundance of representation from all races from all walks of life. We were honored to host Pride karaoke two days ago to a packed house. I apologize for not having a better response. I’m just not sure what you’re talking about. Thank you for coming by and we wish your karaoke experiences on down the road ❤️

name: Robert Pastuszka
text: Not a bad place, had a pretty good time. Just wish they had draft beer.

name: Roddy McCaesar
text:
I went there to try it out and it was great. They gave me a big hug when I came in. They social distanced properly and waved.  None of them were wearing masks. All of them were wearing masks.  Freedom is first. Safety is first. This bar can be all things to all men and women if you will but believe.

Also the owner is a super good dude who shared my favorite drink recipe with me on the house.

name: Casey Kynerd
text: This is an amazing bar. Newly renovated. Come check it out when it’s open! Disregard reviews left while it’s been closed.

name: Don Ritchfield
text: Been to worse places, but I don’t think we will be back any time soon. Venue is very small and attracts some seemingly sketchy folks. My wife didn’t feel all that at ease there tbh and had a bit of anxiety. Limited karaoke selection too which was disappointing. Our drinks seemed a bit weak as well, but I know that’s a lot of bars.

resp.text: We haven’t been open since March 13. Today is July 20. We know you’re upset because we announced today that we would be reopening as a non-smoking establishment. This is one of three negative reviews left by fake accounts in the last ten minutes. Safe travels.

name: Kristen Kuykendall
text: Best karaoke bar I've ever been to! I loved it! It was so fun, the people all treat each other like family. Even if you don't know each other. But, make sure when you order a drink to tell them exactly what you're looking for because I ordered a margarita and it was basically pure alcohol 😂 however, they made up for it afterwards.

name: Ashley Masoner
text: Everything is great. The peeps the drinks the conversation ALL OF IT

name: Nina Coats
text: You really don't want a review from me

name: Mr anon
text:
Different size cups. More you drink paying the same price they'll sneaking a smaller cup in with few ounces. Old bar trick/scam. Couple bartenders are extremely rude. Regulars get treated worse over time. 1 hit wonder, nothing more. DJ's and Security are great; however, goods and customer service is severely lacking.

Response: wow, 11 months to reply, and a rather rude one at that. I was not turned down. In fact; I had finished paying and gave the bartender a 50% tip. Then I politely showed and informed her the cup size difference and to be careful. Then she proceeded to start cussing me out. I do still have records and pictures of the cups and that gracious 50% tip if you would like to see? As well as; two other regulars as witnesses that night to the event.

resp.text:
We apologize that your visits haven’t been acceptable and that you equate being turned down by a bartender as them being “extremely rude.” Also, no bartender on earth is interested in changing cup sizes on someone mid visit in some pointless ploy to short a guest 1-2oz of mixer. I’ve considered the ignorance of that statement for 11 months and finally felt the need to reply. Please, don’t continue to attempt to educate the public on “old bar tricks.” You sincerely have no idea what you’re talking about. Good day, madam.

Dude. We know who you are, creep. “Old bar trick.” I still can’t get over how stupid that statement is. You were turned down. Stalk people elsewhere.

name: Dan Williams
text: Great karaoke bar!!

resp.text: Thank you!!!

name: Brett Ferguson
text: Great bartenders, friendly atmosphere, good drinks! Get your sing on!

name: Karen May (KayKay)
text: I haven't been here in a while but I certainly remember my visits and this is a great place for drinks, music, pool and just all around great time! If you haven't been here, my advice is to tell you to go!

name: Dakota Terrell
text: Nice to have karaoke and nice bartenders to flirt with. Shame there was a biker fight outside

name: Eric Dumas
text: Great place to hang out and have some drinks and karaoke good prices and not over crowded

name: James Roper
text: Had some beers, listened to better-than-average karaoke, and enjoyed the atmosphere. Smaller bar but chill.

name: Alana Pace
text: Great dive bar for karaoke.

name: Blair Jones
text: Great little bar

name: J. Scott Long
text: Great people. Very smoky.

name: Amy Vining
text: Enjoyed the karaoke show

name: Kinny Oldham
text: Laid back,good music

name: Brusier75 Rupley
text: No #  what is up with that

name: Brian Graves
text: Always my favorite!

name: Matt Riales
text: Honestly very good! They gave my wife a Mother's Day glass the second we got to the table. She loves it! My only complaint is my burger and I believe that was my fault with the way I ordered it, so I did not say anything. Not their fault. The draft beer that was suggested by our server was amazing! We will definitely be back for more, with a little more experience!

name: KIA HUNTER
text: My order was completely thrown together. I specified in my online order, condiments on the side, for my burger, and I asked for sautéed onions. My burger came with neither on it, or on the side. My burger was lukewarm almost cold and dry. My fries were soggy and lukewarm. I placed my order in the parking lot of the restaurant, at 8:32 p.m. I checked into curbside pickup around 8:45 after I received the text message from the restaurant saying that I could check in. There was no reason for my food to be lukewarm almost cold. I am highly dissatisfied and disappointed in the service I received. The staff for that shift literally just threw together an order. I have never received service like this from you all before.

name: Carly Stuart
text: The food truly was great! And everyone seemed to check on us while we were eating. Our waitress, the manager and even the chef came out to see how everything was. Very friendly staff. The only complaint I have is my chili came out and wasn't very hot, but it was still delicious and I ate all of it because it was that good! My boyfriends food came out and wasn't that hot either, but my pizza came out fresh! Overall, it was still a great experience and the food all tasted amazing.

name: Jamila Shabazz
text:
The customer service was good. Very busy in there. Our waiter was very busy. They forgot to bring our food to us. It took them less than 15 mins to give us our beverages. Food was salty. I had cheese broccoli (salty) Mediterranean taco (salty)
Our entrees came out cold. House salad with ranch was salty. When a person that wasn’t our waiter brought us the salad, he didn’t think to give us a utensils. We didn’t have utensils when we got to the table. My family personally will not be going back pass 8pm; we might give them another chance around lunch time. The atmosphere was pleasant, that’s what we enjoyed the most. It look like they were under staff. Our waiter was gone for so long after she gave us our appetizers & we needed refills. We had to go to the bar for a refill. The supervisor was shocked that we got up to get our own beverages.

name: Tommye Cauthen
text: Excellent food somehow getting our menus. The manager was very curious and helpful. The seared tuna was fantastic

name: LaTonya Garrett
text: Food was great. Dessert was delicious.  Customer service was excellent as well. Family friendly or can go and hang out and watch sports.

name: Sandra Nunya
text: Food was good, service was amazing. This was a whole package of a great lunch with mother, daughter and two granddaughters. Vegan selections are amazing. Very child friendly.

name: Brianna Valerius
text: Server was okay. My husbands soup came out lukewarm with his dinner. My soup was 15-20 minutes after my dinner came out. Their bison burger (which I take leave to doubt is actual bison having had it in many occasions and if it is, then it has at some time been frozen and the flavor is subpar) was 1/2 inch smaller than the bun all around so for the first 2-3 bites in all directions it was just bread. They put two skinny / skimpy onions on my burger and the singular piece of lettuce was wilted. My server did remedy the situation for us. The bartender gave my husband sass with an eye roll when he asked for a Manhattan which was served in a martini glass? While the choice of glass is odd, that isn’t a big deal, forgetting the bitters is though. My husband did enjoy his $27 steak, it was well cooked and large. Overall this place was a bit of a let down. We were disappointed with the food, timing of the food, and attitude of the bartender. Not a terrible place by any means, but there are just so many better options and ways to spend your money.

name: Kim Gebauer
text: I ordered the classic pizza, had it delivered.   It was rock hard, cold, completely overcooked.  There was almost no sauce and very little cheese. Too many herbs as well. It was literally the worst pizza I’ve ever had. Ive had other food there that was good so this was very disappointing

name: Janna Rolfe
text: We had a great lunch here.  Their berry cider was fabulous.  We also enjoyed our appetizer and meals.  The cheese curbs were delicious and were as good as ones in Wisconsin.  The chicken sandwich and bison burger and salad were all delicious.  The service was great and place felt clean and safe

name: Starrdom100 Radio
text: This has become a new favorite spot! My favorite happens to be the wings with the Root Beer sauce!!! I also love the fried Wisconsin cheese curds!

name: Andy Huber
text: I've been here twice now and had a good experience both times. Once at lunch with good food suggestions from the waitress and once at the end of my day for drinks. The waiter let me sample a few flavors of their house beer and was  regularly making sure nothing else was needed. Fair price, good food, good drinks!

name: Katlyn Campbell
text: Absolutely at a loss for words at how amazing this establishment is. The atmosphere, the employees, the wait time, THE FOOD!! Would definitely without any hesitation recommend this place to anyone looking for an excellent dining experience.

name: Kristin Fountain
text: First time trying BJ's and it's the first time, in a long time, I have been impressed with a restaurant in Mobile. Everything was so delicious and flavorful and the family meal was so convenient. Finally,  a restaurant actually worth going to. We will be back soon!

name: Cory Sprouse
text: Ordered the Brussel sprouts and kale salad for pick up. Got it home, no Brussel sprouts.  I thought ok, not a problem since I ordered avocado on the side. When I opened up the container for the avocado there was not even a quarter of an avocado cut up in the container. Not worth it and the most disappointing experience and a waste of money.

name: Nina Grandison
text: My experience was not great went on a Sunday ordered a pork chop was told my companion ordered the last one. Later waitress come back to table and companion was told there wasn't any pork chops left. Another companion ordered an appetizer and salad they didn't receive it till after their  entree after informing the waitress. Refills filled only after informing waitress they were needed. Not a busy day but service was awful.

name: Bryan Holder
text: Menu is quite large and diverse. Prices are what I consider too expensive for what you get. They would do better reducing their menus size and focusing to keep dishes.

name: neal moore
text:
The food was good and at first the service was good as well. Between my entree my drinks and my dessert me a solo diner spent $50 in tipped 20% accordingly.

I signed my checks before I had finished my dessert and had hoped on another glass of water before I left. I ended up sitting and waiting 10 or 15 minutes looking around for a server just to get another glass of water before I left. My server was unfindable.  Funny enough their table would have been cleared in probably three or four minutes as the only reason I was staying was I wanted another glass of water and had planned on drinking it and then leaving.

Probably not going to stop back in when I come back.

name: Pat Richard
text: The food was good.  Our waiter was delightful.  Nice and clean restaurant.

name: Jade
text: I got the baked ziti and ordered a side Cesar salad, both were good. Social distancing was in place very well, even though we were a party of 9 we were separated in the same section. The menu was online and had to be scanned by QR code to get to it. Our server was great , and checked in frequently while trying to check all her other tables and kept our drinks filled. Overall it was a nice experience given the circumstances.

name: Jacqueline Trenier
text: Absolutely love this place! I've been coming here with friends for a few years now and the food and customer service are amazing. Shout out to Austin! He's amazing!

name: Tabby Mac4
text: I've tried just about everything on the menu. The food here is really great!

name: Devin Blakely
text: The kitchen at the Mobile, AL location has no pride in presentation or preparation of food. I have patronized this location over the years and I have had the same mediocre food each time so common sense would say stop spending my money there. So this will be the last time. Several items we ordered came out cold, over cooked or horribly presented which made you not even want to eat it. Management did nothing but gave excuses on top of lazy apologies for the few times he himself had to come back to bring us food that was prepared wrong. Money was not an issue but being in management myself there would have been no way I would have made a customer pay for ANY of the horrible food that came out of that kitchen. This has to be Bj's standard because there is no way over the years that I can receive the same mediocre service and bad food EVERY TIME I come. The kitchen manager and GM should be ashamed. And if you thought the customer service that you provided was acceptable you were mistaken.

name: Josue Roman
text: Ask for Ashley, extraordinary service!  Thank you!  The best service you can have.  As for the food, super delicious.  You must try the spaghetti and meatballs;  I loved!  It is the first time that I go and I really liked the place.  Super clean and clean bathrooms.  If you have not gone this is a place which you should not stop going and more if you like to spend it with your family.  A cozy place, an extensive bar and the perfect music.  What did I not like?  that I left on the table the food I had to take home 😭😭😭Lol.

name: Sam morris
text: BJ's was wonderful... I've never been to a restaurant that had such great service so quickly. Cybreena was especially wonderful behind the bar.  thank you so much. Keep up the good work. The other restaurants in the Mobile area should come and observe your service and they could learn a lot

name: Leigh Davis
text: Great food, atmosphere,  and great service. Bartender was phenomenal. Highly recommend.

name: David Seward
text: Great service, great beer,  great food, just a bit pricey

name: Stacey Steiner
text: Didn't go there. Was next door at Jason's Deli. It was fantastic. They have reopened their salad bar which is the best salad bar I have ever seen and it was great.

name: Morgan Black
text: Pretty good place. Food is good, and it has a comfortable atmosphere.  The wait staff is always been quick and friendly.  If you haven't tried the salted caramel cookie thing you are missing out!

name: Robert Helvey
text: I went there to get something to eat. The hostess said  I could sit anywhere in the bar area, since it was only me. I sat at a table, since that was the only space available. The manager came over and told me I had to leave that that table was reserved for guest seated by the hostess. I told him the hostesses said to sit there and he told me I couldn’t. He was very rude about it so I left. I didn’t even get a chance to order anything, I can’t review the food but the manager was rude.

resp.text:
Robert,

I wanted to apologize for the miscommunication that was had at our restaurant this past Friday evening. I wanted to clarify that you were not asked to leave, but were asked to move to the actual bar or if you would have liked, we could have sat you in the dining room. Again, I apologize for the miscommunication. Furthermore, we will be working with our team to ensure all guests are sat in a timely manner and that we are clear with our guests on how our bar/cocktail seating works. Please reach out to me with any questions at dearnest@bjsrestaurants.com.

Sincerely,

David Earnest
General Manager

name: William Bradley
text: Great pizza and huge beer selection. Monday night is half off their pizzas. Our server, Christopher, was outstanding.

name: C C
text: All about the Tri-tip Nachos! Loaded up and delicious 🤤. Friendly staff and knowledgeable about the big menu.

name: Halie White
text: Best food I've had in a long time must try the mango porkchops so delicious

name: robert stechyn
text: Very nice atmosphere, Bartender very ambitious as well the food was great.

name: Hannah Chapman
text: About two days ago I got the worst food poisoning I have ever had from eating about half of a side salad. I am still ill and haven't been able to eat. I'm just blown away that not even half of a SIDE salad did this. I hope they start taking better precautions.

name: Steven S
text: Keep in mind we came in 15 minutes before the kitchen was closing. But food should be just as good at the end of the night as it is at the beginning. Ribeye was awesome.  Cooked perfectly.  Fish and chips was cooked in old grease. But fish still had decent crisp and flavor. Enlightened Asian chicken was decent. Chicken was tender. Roasted Brussels were tough and not so flavorful. The atmosphere and cleanliness was awesome.  We will be back , just maybe earlier in the evening. Will definitely try some of the craft beers next time.

name: Scott Woodcock
text: Cleaned our own table and sat for 20 mins without drinks at 4pm on March 9th 2021. Watched our waiter sit and chat with friends until we decided to find a more attentive place to eat.

name: Pamela The Islandgirl
text: Wow! What a tasty meal we had. Price was a good value..and we loved, just loved taking home an extra meal for just $6.00. We shared an appetizer, had 2 entrees, a lovely yummy salad and dessert plus took 2 meals home for much less than usual. Can highly recommend- service was attentive and ambiance really cool! Will return for sure!!

name: Michelle Crenshaw
text: Jocelyn was very helpful and if you get a chance to sit in her section you should. The beer was good and the food was fantastic. I had tri-tip power bowl, so good. Will be going back.

name: George Spragg
text: Best prime rib I have ever had. Make sure and have the brownie pizookie.

name: CHARLES TAYLOR
text: Came in at 2 PM.  Taken to a booth.  No one waited on us.  Other customers who were seated after us were waited on.  Waiter and hostess saw us but ignored us.  After 15 minutes we left.

name: Michael Strayer
text:
It's a national chain, but this was my first time eating here. So a review.

Tonight was only the second official day the place has been open. Lots of friendly staff and trainers. Great open restaurant with nice bar and tons of craft beer on tap. Enormous menu. Plenty of tv's to watch a game.

Told the bartender I liked amber lager beer, so she brought me the house amber. Really nice beer with great flavor.

Ordered some wings with extra hot buffalo sauce and ranch dressing. Very tasty, sauce was hot but not too hot.

Overall, if I wanted some bar food or even some pizza or pasta...I would not hesitate to come back. Great place.

name: Jamie Jackson
text: BJs is great. The food is great, they have tons of beer on tap, and Caroline behind the bar is awesome. We went twice in one week. Great food, great customer service. We will definitely be back.

name: Rhonda Guitroz
text: The service was slow eventhoug the restaurant was empty, and the waitress couldn't seem to get the order right.

name: Tamara Berry
text: Very tasty Entrées. Our server, Stormy Lee, for a party of 9 & a toddler makes 10 was excellent to say the least!

name: Samantha Roberson
text: Both the tri tip and ribeye we ordered were severely overcooked. The chicken looked and tasted like it came out of the microwave. The cauliflower was undercooked to the point it was almost raw and tasted awful on top of that. The asparagus and the ribeye were so spicy it was inedible even if it was cooked correctly. The only reason it's getting two stars is because our waiter was exceptionally amazing and took care of us so well.

name: Parth Patel
text: Very nice restaurant from inside. The interior is very well maintained. They have a bar which looks really cool compared to other restaurants I go to. The service they gave was real nice and the food served was fast. The food was not great, not that it was bad. The food was decent, could be better.

name: Catrina Stevenson
text: Can I just say Amazing!!! The food selection is huge. So it's great for several people to go because there is something for everyone. The Brew list is fantastic!! Lots and lots of options. The staff are very attentive and friendly!! The birthday cookie is so delicious!!

name: P. T.
text: This restaraunt was one ok. However, I have left the last three times because the hostess makes me feel like I have been discriminated against. Today I was told the wait would be 35 to 45 minutes but there were vacant tables everywhere. We left and drove to another similar restaraunt who actually had more tables filled and were seated right away.

resp.text:
P.T.,

I want to apologize for not having seated you right away. Discrimination by any means will not be tolerated. Please reach out to me at dearnest@bjsrestaurants.com so I can get some more information regarding this incident. We would like to rectify the situation and ensure you and your guests can enjoy our restaurant at any time.

Sincerely,

David Earnest
General Manager

name: Tisha Doakes
text: Food was good I tried something different, healthy. it was a good choice very satisfied 😋 Nice atmosphere

name: Chip Hearn
text: We had a party of 4.  We all enjoyed our meal!  Would eat there again if we ever stop in Mobile again!

name: G L
text:
Sitting at a table I intensely dislike. Supposedly the only one available, even so many more people were seated right after us.
Chicken Pot Stickers cold, tough and tasteless.
Spicy Chicken with Soba Noodles,  greasy and luke warm, drowned in peanut sauce.  BRUSSELS Sprouts cold, looking like dried grass, fried, no seasoning. No Sriracha Crema. My husband enjoyed his hamburger. Beside that,  Worst meal we had here.
Our Waitress, Sabre, was friendly and attentive. The Manager waved at us once. Tried to get his attention to tell him above. However, whenever he passed, he ignored us. We did not want anything comped. Just giving feedback. I was a professional Chef, now retired. We should have left before being seated close to the entrance at a corner where everyone swept past. It will not happen again. We usually stop at BJ's whenever we have to go to Mobile. We will wait a while before we return.

resp.text:
Mrs. Landau,

This is concerning and we want to make this right. I would like to apologize for the experience yesterday and for not being the one to come over and ensure everything was up to par. Obviously, this was not the case. There is no excuse for being seated a table you intensley disliked. Also, there is no reason why the food should have been tasteless or overdone.  Please contact me via email at dearnest@bjsrestaurants.com so I can get some more information from you so that we can better coach our team to ensure a better dining experience. You can also reach out to me at the restaurant 251-581-9240. Thank you for your feedback and I look forward to speaking with you soon.

Sincerely,

David Earnest
General Manager

name: charles anderson
text: First and last time coming here. Lost my business over this covid b.s. If they were worried about masks, they should have stayed closed! Air conditioning circulates air so what is the point of wearing a mask to walk around just to take it off to eat? That is kinda stupid if you ask me. Never heard of some silly stuff like this.

name: Ultreya Park
text: Dining companion noted how long it took the waitress to arrive after a hassle about an appropriate seating place. Love the roasted brussel sprouts and the art. Kinda overpriced for what you get. VERY salty. Hostess needs more training, to allow customers in wheelchairs to sit where they need to sit. Many of the square tables have a large chunky round center pedestal, which disallow getting under the table very far, and when I pointed this out, she did not seem too concerned, so I had to ask for another table and I remembered being seated at a certain table previously. I mentioned that. She was reluctant. I nudged. We went in that direction and I pointed out the ideal table. She offered a booth with a post at the end and I pointed out the problem, and declined. I again pointed to the table that would work, and she said that section has been cleaned and I said I see that, but...Would you like me to clear it with a manager? So she offered the table beside it, same section, because it was smaller, for our party of two. The larger table did not have a center round pedestal. I gave in, because by this time it was feeling like an argument, making my dining companion uncomfortable, and the table offered was better than the first of the three. See photos for specifics on food and space. Atmosphere gets 5 stars.

name: Ahmed Nasser
text: Took an hour and half to 5 pazookies, wasn’t even busy. And then they only gave me 4. Come here if you like being treated as a nuisance. Also the pazookie could have been have been sold as a cracker and no one would have noticed.

name: Rhiannon Sweatt
text: It was fantastic and the bartender Joel was excellent and attentive to us and the other customers around us!

name: Jennifer Davis
text: I just went to met my boyfriend who is a UPS driver, working until 10:30-11 every night for dinner and they refused to seat me until he was there. I explained to them that he only has a hour for his “lunch” and I wanted to get a table and place his drink order before he got there and they told me I wasn’t allowed to have a table until he arrived. I was beyond disappointed to see the kind of customer service they showed THEIR own UPS driver during the holidays. Unlike them, he doesn’t get to clock out at 9 pm and go home to his family!  Horrible experience and we will not be back!  BTW.. they’re were only 4-5 tables in the bar area being used!  They obviously need the business and yet turned us away!

resp.text:
Jennifer,

I wanted to apologize for the terrible experience you had with us yesterday. There is absolutely no excuse on why we wouldn't be able to seat you so you could wait for your boyfriend to join you. I'm extremely sorry that this happened and would love to talk with you and make it right. Please reach out to me at dearnest@bjsrestaurants.com or call me at the restaurant at 251-581-9240. I will be speaking with all of our hosts today to ensure they know how to properly seat our guests. Please reach out to me at your convenience. I look forward to hearing from you.

Sincerely,

David Earnest
General Manager
BJ's Mobile, AL

name: Marshall OHern
text: Good food and service.  A large selection of menu items.

name: AL Jefferson
text: Food is always amazing. However, your website said half off pizza Monday’s automatically deducts the promo code at checkout. But the price stays the same. Please get this glitch fixed.

name: Aidan Screws
text: Bad service, long wait despite having a reservation, rude manager, and mediocre food. Do not recommend

name: Nedra Irby
text: Wasn't happy with my food .the steak bloody and bake potato was cool.shrimps was cooked all the way.

name: Paul LePiane
text: Everything was good our server was very nice and attentive.

name: Juan Hernandez
text: Brisket bacon burger is very delicious paired with their own tasty IPA... perfect!!

name: Jasmine Grim
text: Nice atmosphere, and my waitress Missy was lovely, attentive and quick.  I ordered the blood orange pom sangria, was very delicious but heads up it has a very strong cinnamon flavor. The fried artichoke hearts were delicious, the batter was perfect and they were juicy. Lastly I got the enlightened Pacific poke with buckwheat noodles, the flavors were great, you could taste the wasabi but it was not overpowering, my only critique is I wish the buckwheat noodles were a little chewy as they are traditionally served, but still very much enjoyed the dish.

name: Marg Fields
text:
We had an office holiday lunch here Tuesday. The food was amazing! Service was phenomenal! Two waitresses took care of 40+ individuals with excellence 👍🏼😊

I can’t wait for our next trip here!  Love this restaurant 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼😊

name: Terry Covas
text: My family and I had a terrible experience with this particular location. We were seated immediately after entering the restaurant. We waited twenty minutes for someone to take our drink order(at this point we should have left). Drinks arrived quickly. We placed our food order and waited thirty five minutes for, a burger, two fish tacos, mini corn dogs, chicken Alfredo and chicken tenders. When the food arrived they forgot to cook the tenders. So as I sat patiently across from my daughter who had not received her food I realized that everyone's beverages were empty, we never receiveda refill until the tenders arrived. We finally received ALL our food 46 min after placing our order. Food was not that great. All this would have been understandable if they were busy, but the place was practically empty. We will not be dinning at this location again.

name: Justin Kline
text:
Food is ok but they do have a big selection, which is nice. Pizzas are the best thing on the menu besides the Avocado Egg Rolls. They do have really solid drinks so I would choose this place for drinks first.

The Mobile Pay/Menu, option is very convenient. Get the app, it's definitely worth it if you plan to come regularly.

name: Terry Collette
text: This is in the Old Cheddars building. 100% improvement. Very nice open dining area. Menu was huge. Food was particularly good. Great addition to the area.

name: Sedra D
text: The gluten free pepperoni extreme was good

name: jan vickers
text: BJ'S is great! The food is awesome and our waitress was so sweet! Wasn't really thrilled with needing to scan the table to see the menu,  but I'm old school and like to see it on paper 👍

name: rjacpapbcrun
text: Ask for Joel. One of the best yet

name: Shelley Griffin
text: Our food was very good. The waiter was fabulous.

name: Aisha Lyle
text: The service at this place is always wishy washy and lately it’s just been horrible. I called to place a to-go order and someone told me the kitchen closed at 10:30, which is crazy because i’ve ordered later than that. My friend called two seconds later and another lady took our order no problem. The food is good but some of their employees are questionable.

resp.text: Thank you for letting us know about the service issue. I am so sorry about this! We would love to connect with you. Please give us a call at the restaurant so we can make this right for you and learn more.

name: Logan Smith
text: This is a unique bar and grill they serve everything you desire, from salad to Wong's to burgers. They will satisfy every taste bud in your mouth. Once you take on Vite of their tasty food you'll never want to leave. My personal favorite from Bj's is the Parmesan garlic boneless wings. Come to Bj's you won't regret it.

name: Amber Pond
text: Food and beers were both great. Well prepared. The ribs were tneder, steak was cooked to order correctly, and all veggies were fresh. ill go back.

name: makenzie mh
text: The atmosphere is very nice and it seems very elegant but that's about where it stops. Our waitress was annoyed and got attitude when we asked for a refill or salt and pepper, not to mention when we needed to go boxes. The food was over priced. For example their chicken alfredo is very bland and honestly you can make the same at home but are charging like $15 for it. While it is a big portion it didn't taste good. Our silverware wasn't clean as well. While there are always spots that you just can't get off, there was actual left over food on the forks...

name: Tim Simmons
text: Great food, kinda expensive but was a good experience.

name: Seth Shipley
text:
Rough meal, I would recommend looking for other options.  Out of deep dish large pizzas (Monday’s 1/2 off special) well before closing (though offered half off a small after I inquired).  Small deep dish pizza came out with soggy, spongy crust and lukewarm (as the last item delivered).  Ribs had good flavor, but also lukewarm with a baked potato seriously undercooked.  Tortilla soup came out closer to gelatin than soup (barely warm), though I appreciated that our waitress took the soup off our bill based on our feedback.

Staff was cordial, but perfunctory.  Didn’t want to seat us at booth due to a “rotation”, and it makes me wonder if our food quality suffered because we were “difficult” in our seating request.  Hope this was just an off night, but after multiple poor BJs Restaurant experiences, I’ll be steering clear for the foreseeable future.

name: Jerri Ledford
text: Bj's has great craft beer (most of the time)! But if you're expecting consistent food preparation, this may not be the right place. I ordered a steak, medium rare. It came out medium and the salad came out after the meal. Of course, the pizookies are always spot on and if you want fast seating, you can always go to the bar.

name: Andrew Christensen
text: Great food (overpriced), solid beer, decent atmosphere, but shoddy service. Mandy seemed pleasant but didn’t seem to know her stuff very well. Later on, we were clearly done eating but she ignored us for a solid 30 minutes. She claimed we were watching the football game and didn’t want to disturb us. We were only watching because we were bored waiting on her to bring us the check.

name: JO
text: They have a wide array of items on the menu. It's good food.

name: Ashley Hitt
text: I got made like I wasn't a inconvenience due to my size.

name: Charles Jones
text: Great service, tasty food. Ashley at the bar went above and beyond on a Thursday night.

name: Ricardo Coleman
text: Great service and great food, I will be coming back

name: Nathan Brown
text: Beers were great, food was cooked perfectly and very delicious. Our server Haley was great and after having some battery troubles in the parking lot, Lambert came and assisted. Super kind people at this place.

name: Jason Holton
text: Was recommended by family and visited today. Was definitely disappointed with the food and service. $26 ribeye no taste, was not even offered steak sauce, which in this case it needed. Steak like this should have a WOW about it but not there. Baked potato no butter, sour cream, salt or pepper. Salad just plain with maybe a teaspoon of dressing. No rolls, bread or crackers. Had sweet tea not offered a refill. Never asked how is your meal taste or prepared. Have had better food and service at fast food for a third of the price. Disappointing

name: Aaron Moore
text: The food is amazing and the services was spot on!

name: Rodney Moody
text: Busy but good. A little loud but it's just part of the scene. Get over it. I will be back.

name: Lesley Gunn
text: Waitress wasn't on her job too slow and food was nasty...

name: David Martinez
text: Food was great but service from bartender was poor. He said he "wants to go home" so we have to leave.

resp.text: Oh no! I am so sorry! This is not what we want to hear. We would love to connect with you. Please give us a call at the restaurant so we can make it right.

name: Lady V0516
text: Food was good.   Service was excellent.   Restaurant is making sure to keep to social distancing standards and servers are wearing masks.

name: TC Gurus
text: Great selection of craft beers. Pizza was surprisingly good... very good in fact. I like the atmosphere. Great happy hour specials.

name: Josephine Maddox
text: Every thing was unacceptable my family an I will not return ever

name: Summer King
text: Seriously delicious fries! Great burgers. Tasty apps, with a wide variety beyond the usual. Really really good! We'll be back Monday night for their pizza Special!

name: Tys Greene
text: Awesome place to eat. Mandy, our waitress, took excellent care of us. (Thank you, Mandy)Sampled 4 different beers, to start off. Ordered their homemade guacamole, with homemade desserts chips. AWESOME!!! Hubby ordered full strip spare ribs, with a bowl of chili and mashed potatoes. I had the mahi-mahi, fish tacos. Very good!!! All in all, very satisfied and happy

name: Jim Habeck
text: Food not cooked to request.  Manager failed to maintain social distancing.

name: David Lee
text: The bbq brisket burger was one of the best burgers I've ever had. But the sweet tea didn't have enough sugar in it. Nothing ruins a meal for me more than sugarless "sweet tea". It's like drinking brown water, and paying three bucks for it. It's down right insulting! This is the south, put more sugar in that tea!!

name: Brian McDonald
text: Had the Dark Side Flight beer assortment... Red & Brunette is always my favorite!! Lemon Tyme Chicken was phenomenal!!! Chicken was so tender it is as if it were rotisserie!! Also took the Monkey Bread Poozokie to-go... Had it in the past and was REALLY good!!

name: Summer King
text: Seriously delicious fries! Great burgers. Tasty apps, with a wide variety beyond the usual. Really really good! We'll be back Monday night for their pizza Special!

name: Josephine Maddox
text: Every thing was unacceptable my family an I will not return ever

name: Lesley Gunn
text: Waitress wasn't on her job too slow and food was nasty...

name: David Lee
text: The bbq brisket burger was one of the best burgers I've ever had. But the sweet tea didn't have enough sugar in it. Nothing ruins a meal for me more than sugarless "sweet tea". It's like drinking brown water, and paying three bucks for it. It's down right insulting! This is the south, put more sugar in that tea!!

name: Jim Habeck
text: Food not cooked to request.  Manager failed to maintain social distancing.

name: William Tackett
text: Mediocre food, burgers not hot. Asparagus tough, undercooked. Prices way too high! Will not go back.

name: Billy Shook
text: The food was sub par and overpriced. Wouldn't go back or recommend.

name: Crystal Reynolds
text: Even after a month I'm still thinking about how good the chicken and brussel sprouts was even at 12 at night it was awesome this was during Mardi Gras and there was literally nothing else good open and I happened upon this place I've never heard of amazing and everyone was super nice even though it was really and they were about to close within the hour.

name: Jamal Jamal
text: This is not a deep dish pizza. I love Chicago style pizzas and this was more Pizza Hut. They charge $ 30 for this pizza which is the going rate for a Chicago style pizza but this wasn't it. Pizza was good but not what I expected and definitely over priced. The picture on their menu with the pizza in the deep dish pan is very misleading.

name: Mike Cooney
text: It's funny how they make you wear mask to walk in but employees can't even wear them correctly or at all so what is the point

name: LaKesha Fagan
text: Tchlinda was a great and informative server. Loved her suggestions and my pizookie!

name: Courtney
text: At first glance it looks like the regular old BJ's restaurant and brewery that you would typically go to except for there are some changes due to Covid 19 which is understandable. I looked up and I saw a sign that said to go orders, I said hey I'll try that for my lunch tomorrow. So I ordered this to go pasta and when I raised the lid it smelled like putrid rotten vegetables thrown into a plastic box to the extent that it made me want to vomit immediately. I hope no one ever has this terrible experience I had and maybe they need to check the to-go boxes before handing them out to people, I was highly disappointed and I will not be getting anything from there again.

name: Nathan Jones
text: The Jambalaya made me sick, some of the contents was not fresh. I went there on 9/9 for dinner, now I have to eat soft foods until my stomach recovers.

name: Millie Hartzog
text:
First this is the first time I have ever written a review but felt it necessary.
The restaurant had an association meeting with a large group of people and instead of being prepared with enough staff to cover the large group....it was not.  First problem-we were trying to get a table to seat 8 people for a birthday celebration.  Manager at one point told me to "go figure out what you want and let me know"... After figuring out a place to sit we then have to deal with a bad first waiter.  Our "1st" waiter left our table without saying a word to us 3 times to answer questions such as (1) can happy hour prices be given to us since we did not sit in the bar area; (2) if the restaurant carried Flat Tire beer; (Excuse me but isn't this restaurant a brewhouse?); and (3)  does the restaurant have diet tonic, diet sprite or any diet drinks.  At one point the waiter told our table that he had just had a long day and was tired.  So, he complained to the manager about us and we were given another waitress.  She (Kayla B.) was great.  At one point since there was only 1 bartender on duty (really when you know you have a group of 50 to 75 women maybe more bartenders would be a good idea!) she ended up preparing our cocktails.  One person in our group ordered double meat pizzas to take home to her family.  She had to send the pizzas back because there was no meat on them!!  We arrived at 5:30 p.m. and did not receive our water and/or drinks until 6:15!

name: Elisjsha Sexton
text: I didnt even get seated, I was told 20min wait, and then another 30min, and then another 20min. I was looking forward to trying it for the first time but after seeing 3 couples leave that arrived after me, im not going back

name: Vera Ringold
text: The food was delicious and the service was great. Considering the social distancing everything was perfect. We will definitely be back.

name: Emily S
text: Love this place! Visited multiple times with the same, great service every time. Food is great! Portions are big, so expect to take some home. They offer free dessert if you download their app!

name: Michael Ellis
text: Awesome as always would give 10 stars if I could.

name: pinkesh mistry
text:
Server (Ashley) was friendly, helped me put my custom pita taco order together.
Liked the food and place.

name: Megan Bolton
text: I love the food. The whole family enjoyed it. Cant wait to try their brews.

name: Kim Kraner
text: DINING ROOM NOW OPEN in big bold letters on the sign draping the door...4:20 pm on a Tue afternoon...5 cars in the lot and approximately 10-15 total guests...walked in only to be told it would be a 20 min WAIT?!  More staff needed for SURE! :(

name: Donna Marie
text: The food is okay. The price's where a little high for what you get. The staff seemed like they had no energy at all. The place is very clean and nice looking though. I just won't be back, I've had much better food at much more affordable prices.

name: Kimberly Lombardi
text: Great menu. Good food awesome Service.

name: Markell Johnson
text: Very disappointed. The food has been very bland lately and every time I order a pizookie with CHOCOLATE ice cream I receive vanilla ice cream. It doesn’t matter which app I order it in. You guys have lost a customer and it’s a shame because the pizookies are good but you can’t even include the correct ice cream flavor.

name: Laverne Robinson
text: I had a good time I will be back

name: Neda Brewton
text: First time we've been here and we loved it. Missy was our waitress and was great. The food was really good. Restaurant was clean but needed to be dusted around the booths. A little dust will not keep us from coming back.

name: Eric Green
text: So many choices so little time. I just loved their lemon thyme chicken

name: Cynthia Young
text: The food was delicious, the restaurant could have been cleaner, dusty, finger prints on the windows, table sticky.

name: Bea Bowers
text: Ribeye was delicious, service was poor. Person seating us was unprepared and separated 2 tables for us to sit. We weren't asked table or booth. We waited a long time for water and soda.  I had to get up to ask for napkins. Salads came out and we had to wait for silverware. There was no salt or pepper on table.  My husband's dirty (salad) dish remained on table throughout meal. Garlic butter was not fully melted. Beer was cool, not cold. We were very disappointed.

name: Jessica Stuck
text: If I could leave no stars I would for the horrible service from the hostess and staff!
