name: Duane Benson
text: We try to go when they offer the endless shrimp. Our server was less than solicitous, only brought drink refills one time and had to be reminded of the further order of shrimp (traditionally we have been offered numerous refills). The menu change no longer offers my favorite flounder, an entre I have eaten for more than 30 years. Little things add up: the check was brought to us just the receipt paper, was whisked away with our payment card, returned the same way, and finally collected from the table before we were able to get up and away (we did not linger lest one think the server was trying to get rid of us) Just disappointed with the overall experience.

resp.text: Hi Duane Benson, we’re sorry to learn about your disappointing experience at our Huntsville restaurant. We'd like to personally follow up with you to find out how we can improve. Please fill out our online form to let us know more about your experience and reference GM092319A in the comments section so that we know the comments are from you: ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm. text: Had a great time I never have gone here beforehand a bit pricey but overall great service our waiter was awsome never short on drinks always asking if was ok and if we needed anything else the food was great I got crab legs and they were spot on next time I have some time and some $ I'm definitely coming back only thing I can say to make It better and a 5 stars is wash the outside of the potatoes a little better and add some sea salt because I enjoy eating the whole potato not just the inside other then that overall great and will come back

resp.text: Thank you for giving the Huntsville Red Lobster 4 stars, Wesley Mitchell, we look forward to giving you a 5 star experience next time.

name: Kelly Joiner
text: Hadn't been here in awhile  (because I don't eat seafood), so I ordered the Maple-Glazed Chicken and my friend ordered the Coconut Shrimp. Both were excellent! And the cheddar biscuits,  as always, topped the meal off just right. The restaurant was clean, servers were nice. Not rushed and visited for awhile. A very pleasant evening!

name: Mark Toland
text: Went for shrimpfest and it was awesome. The wife had the Chicken Alfredo and she loved it. Got seated quickly on Sunday afternoon and our server Arthur was outstanding. We were never rushed and everything was just great. Going back as soon as next weekend. I would recommend just make reservations ahead online or be ok with waiting for  a few minutes which was worth it. Possibly the best experience I have ever had at Red Lobster. Enjoy!

resp.text: That sounds like the perfect evening at our Huntsville Red Lobster!

name: Eddie Grissett
text:
The cheese biscuits are very good. The Crab Alfredo is very good. It has way more flavor than the Shrimp Alfredo.
I don't think Walt's Favorite Shrimp would really be his favorite. The seemed like they had been battered and frozen in a factory. They were just average. Red Lobster's prices have gone way up, while the quality of the food is not that great.

name: Teresa Sellers
text: Darius was our waiter and he was spectacular. He was very attentive to our needs and he was very friendly. The food was very good. We will definitely be back.

resp.text: We love hearing that you had a great time, Teresa!

name: Sherri Fitzpatrick
text: The food was good, however, the waitress was very inattentive.  She took our salads and appetizers away while we were still eating them.  After she brought our food, she didn't check on us again until we were almost finished eating.  My daughter had a sticker floating in her water, I needed a drink refill, and she didn't ask if we wanted more biscuits.  Their recommended tip was also calculated on the total after including the tax instead of the subtotal. I would eat there again, but I would not want to have the same waitress.

name: nikki billips
text: Was greeted promptly at the door. Nice host. Was seated and greated immediately. Great server. She took care of us. Got drinks fast. And the food came out quicker than expected. But the food was terrible. My husband and I both had the steak and lobster. The steak was tough and bland I can do much better by cooking my own steak. The lobster was tough and tasteless. The only good thing was the service and drinks.. but that will not bring me back. I wanted a good steak and lobster and was highly disappointed. And it was our date night haven't been on a date in 8 months. We'll  go back to Connors next time. Everything there is phenomenal.

text: Another sub par seafood restaurant.  These guys have been pretending for years to be a good seafood restaurant.

Made our 3 year old daughter smile and enjoy the meal which anyone with kids can understand the delight from that.

text: Our order was wrong but we had a great waitress and she fixed everything.  The food was awesome. Been a few times and it just wasn't good. Definitely has gotten better. Cant wait to go back !

text: Food was not cooked well. Waited over 30min to speak with the manager, who never came but did refund the appetizer which was not the problem. Smh... will not be eating here again. The service has truly diminished over time.

name: Tim Patterson
text: Great food, great prices, service was great! A place to return to time and again!

resp.text: Glad to hear you enjoyed your experience at our Huntsville Red Lobster! See you soon.

name: David Jackson
text:
Tiffany was our waitress - she was outstanding. Kind, courteous, friendly, anticipated our needs and checked on us often.   She reminded me of when people cared about their customers and made them feel appreciated. She is a gem.
Food was very good and the birthday dish was very nicely decorated and presented.
Thanks for a great dinner.  See you again soon.

name: Frank P
text: My portion of Lobster Alfredo was very small, child size, and I ordered a full. The fish my husband ordered was bland and over cooked. The broccoli was mushy and the color of the tops was yellowish which meant old.

resp.text: We're sorry you were unsatisfied with your experience, Frank Petrillo. Our team would like to learn more so that we can prevent these mistakes in the future. text: Superb service and food. I was also highly impressed with their functional allergy menu.

resp.text: Thank you for visiting our 1818 University Drive N.W. Red Lobster and for sharing your pleasant experience with us!

name: Alvie Rodgers
text: Excellent experience. I had Ultimate Feast. It was perfect. My wife had Walt's Shrimp and they were perfect. Seems you can always count on Red Lobster.

name: Phyllis Ledford
text:
We hadn't been there in at least a year. We finally went back 3 weeks ago and we had their Shrimp Scampi once again. We love their fried shrimp but we love Shrimp Scampi so much more. It is fixed in garlic butter. There isn't enough garlic butter for us. We had more added to it and we could tell there was garlic in the butter that time. That made it so much better...like it used to be. We like to put some of the sauce over our
vegetables, potatoes and even soak pieces of our bread in it. Sooooo good.

name: Patti Golden
text: Don't like their menu change

name: Oriana Brown
text: Had a reservation and still waited 30 minutes. While waiting we observed a low health department score that was just given days before. Mostly having food at the wrong temperature.  Server was nice and helpful but the food was just ok. The drinks were not good at all. It took awhile for the food to come out after ordering.  I would not return or recommend this place to anyone.

resp.text: Hi,Oriana Brown. We're troubled to hear this and we'd like to learn more. Would you please fill out our online form letting us know more and reference GM112618A in the comments sections? ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm. Thank you!

text: The food is great and the prices are good..

resp.text: That sounds like the perfect evening at our Huntsville Red Lobster!

name: Meagon Underwood
text: Service was undeserving of even one star. The server was very obviously annoyed that we were in her section. She walked up and introduced herself with an irritated vibe (she also added to her introduction that she was going to get us out of there fast due to the bad weather, which wasn't that bad) and asked for our drink orders then walked away without another word. Any time she came to the table she barely spoke beyond necessity, we would thank her for various things and she did not once acknowledge us. She brought half of my order out and I suppose my face expressed a question and she stared at me... the appropriate thing to say is, " Can I get you anything else?" I finally said, "Is the soup coming out now or later?" Her reply? "No, it's coming out now..." and a brisk walk away. To make dinner less enjoyable the staff were definitely not using professional language when they were in the kitchen (my table was next to the kitchen).The food was decent (hardly agree with the price verses value) but the service made the whole experience... I walked out remembering why we hardly visit that place.

resp.text: Hi Meagon Wood, we’re sorry to learn about your disappointing experience at our Huntsville restaurant and we’d like to know more. Please fill out our online form letting us know more about your experience and reference GM022619A in the comments section. Each comment receives individual attention; ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm. Thank you!

text: it's good but when they're busy you can see a decline in the service promptness but positive attitudes all around. Food is better than it used to be. I used to have to go Decatur for good Red Lobster, not anymore.

resp.text: We’re America’s #1 Seafood Restaurant because of YOU, The! 😋 Thanks for being a lobSTAR 🦞 🤩 and we hope to see you back soon!

text: It was very clean and we had no wait time and the waiter was so nice to us and the food was delicious

resp.text: Hi, Missy Brewer. Thank you for visiting and giving our, Huntsville Red Lobster, 5 stars! Happy to hear you were well taken care of and we'll ensure it's passed along! Looking forward to serving you again soon.

name: James
text:
Service:
Whether being helped at the bar or at a table I have no complaints. Waiters are prompt and very helpful.

Food:
I usually get the Salmon New Orleans and never had a problem. Sauce is extremely well made and salmon is great. Also good to note that I have never had a fish bone in my food... Thus far.

Another good recommendation is getting the 4 course meal as it's a great value and good to share.

Overall:
Never had an issue with this restraunt and hope that continues. I would highly recommend this location!

name: Kitsune of Inari
text: The place is usually packed but has a nice calm atmosphere. Servers are quick to take orders and bring drinks and are very nice. Food is always great at Red Lobster, however expensive. If your looking for a spicy dish here, order the Dragon Shrimp, really spicy and really good. Get a yuengling to go with it.

name: Jimmy Nance
text: The service was good waiting was fair

resp.text: Hi, Jimmy Nance. Thank you for visiting and giving our Huntsville Red Lobster, 5 stars! We look forward to serving you again soon.

name: Lianne Litzenberger
text: The food and the waitress were good, however there was a waiter  there who came across as very creepy when he walked passed our table, then stopped and yanked my 9 year old daughter's menu from her.  He apparently did it as a joke. Well it scared and upset her. He then kept talking and making it worse by saying things like "oh she's mad" etc.. He said sorry and then said he was going to get her and our son a toy. He came back with a broken airplane that wouldn't stop beeping and two stuffed animals. It was just a weird experience and my daughter didn't want anything from him. But why would an old man be joking like that with a child and then making it worse by continuing being in our upset daughter's presence and giving her toys that we don't know where they've been?  Are these toys from Red Lobster or did he bring them in himself? He was just a creepy guy who seemed like he had the maturity level of a 12 year old.  Why would you "joke with a child you don't even know and yank her menu off the table? Just leave us alone. he wasn't even our server to begin with.

name: donna thrower
text: Waited for over 2 hours with no chance of being seated in sight. Some of the people that were at their tables had been waiting for an hour to get refills. No wonder everyone was waiting most of the employees was having a good time out back smoking and chilling. They could have at least asked us to join their back porch party since they had no intention on feeding us.

name: Lisa Altheide
text:
Service was extremely slow...it took almost 40 minutes to get our food once we ordered ..There were 4 of us(3 adults, 1 children)...

As we were ordering, we found out they were out of a lot of items...For the prices we paid for our meals we expected to get what we wanted.. Some of the things we were told they were out of, bacon, cheese(we could not get loaded baked potatoes)...Couldn't order the  Berry mango drink they were out of the ingredients..couldn't order a daiquiri they were out of ingredients for it as well, they were out of onions

We ordered the 4 course meal for $15.99 and that came with brownie a La mode however can u guess it, they were out of that as well. We got the cake and ice cream instead and guess what they charged us and up charge for   getting the cake and ice cream even though the didn't have the brownie a La mo and our meal came with it... 😢

After we finally ordered, the kids meal came out first and it was suppose to be macaroni but it was a bowl of grease... We didn't even know grease was used to make macaroni.. The manager did come over to apologize but my nephew had to watch us eat because he is a picky eater and the only thing he will eat at Red Lobster is the macaroni.. When the manager came over she explained they usually use Kraft macaroni and cheese for the kid's meal but...can u guess. .they ran out and they were substituting ...

The manager did not offer a satisfactory resolution..

The service was so slow.. We ended up missing some of our movie..we will not return...

name: Teresa Brownfield
text: I love seafood and in Alabama you can not go just anywhere to get it. I took a friend and he was just amazed at the store, yes it was his first time LoL. Made my trip even more special. Great staff that gave us time to look over the menu so he could pick a great meal. And no one likes to be rushed on their first visit so all in all we had a wonderful dinner.

name: Chad Holland
text: Service has never been good, I ordered a Maker's Mark Manhattan. They brought me a double shot of Maker's Mark in a highball... When I asked the server she said oh they didn't have sweet vermouth... To which I asked if they were out or just didn't carry it, so I wouldn't order it again if they didn't carry it. Her answer.... " I ain't the bar tender I don't know..." Wow! I almost got up a left at that moment. Things were mediocre from that point forward as they were out of the first 3 dishes I ordered.... We never got the biscuits because "the kitchen done burnt 2 batches, I'll keep my eyes out" I tried to speak to the manager at the conclusion of our meal but to no suprise I couldn't find one... I walked around the dining room twice. We won't be going back!

WoW just WoW!!!  Ugh..... Never again will I visit this establishment. text: I went during lunch and sat at the bar. The bartender was awesome!! She made sure our glasses were full, and she checked on us to make sure that things were still going well. The food was really good, the only thing is that they didn't have any lettuce wraps to go with my meal. The manager came out and apologized, explained what happened, and took care of my tab. Overall I had a really good visit.

text: Great service, wonderful food

text: My wife calls this her favorite place to eat. We have had mixed reviews the last few visits but yesterday's meal was one of the best we have ever had. We kept talking about it all evening.

name: norm ginty
text:
Clean and comfortable
Prompt and friendly service.

I Hart the lobster Math Mac and cheese
Very good but could have had a little more lobster.
I also had the hot lobster roll well worth the price.  I am from New England so am a little spoiled but good deal for the price
The clam chowder was really good and again in groom New England so...
With a beer total came to line $32.

When my mother came to visit thus is one of the places we would go.
Yesterday would have been her 93d birthday so I celebrated in remembrance.

I would come back

name: Neil Young
text: My wife and I had a craving for some red lobster so we stopped in . We were seated very quickly and our waitress arrived and took our orders for drinks quickly.  It took a little bit but our waitress made her way back around and got our orders. Our food came out hot and fresh. My appetizer never did make it out so I asked to have it removed from my ticket which our waitress took care of. It seemed as the restaurant filled up with the Sunday crowd our waitress became more attentive which was good. The overall experience was ok, things have changed I guess with red lobster and just kinda went somewhat flat. The restroom was clean but had hand towels all over the floor and was in a slight disarray.

name: Caitlyn Hoppe
text: Customer service way off. We ate here because we got a giftcard for Christmas and it turned out to be a big mistake. We ordered an appetizer, soup, salad, and dinner entree. Our appetizer came out and the waiter set it down on the table and quickly walked away as I was trying to tell him he didn't give us any plates or forks. So from the get go I was irritated. We tried to flag several people down and were ignored each time. So after getting no help we started eating our shrimp appetizer with our hands. Finally a different server helped us and got us some forks. But still no plates. Our appetizer was gone by the time our original waiter finally came back to the table and mumbled "I shoulda been brought these out to ya" at me and finally got us plates and biscuits. Then our dinner entrees were brought out by yet another different server. We tried to ask for our soup and salad but she turned and walked away so quickly I don't think she heard me. We had nearly finished our dinner entrees by the time our original server came to check on us, and instead of apologizing for the mistake just said "yeah I know" when I said we had ordered a soup and salad. If you know, then where is my food? We both finished our dinner entrees before he brought our soup and salad out and by that point we were already full. I paid $8 for a bowl of soup I didn't even eat. The manager comped one of our meals but I will never go back there after that experience.

resp.text: Hi,Caitlyn Hoppe. We're troubled to hear this and we'd like to learn more. Would you please fill out our online form letting us know more and reference GM022019E in the comments sections? ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm. Thank you!

text: This visit was for our 10th anniversary and it was a vast improvement over last year. Our meals were just as we ordered and the price was a little more than last year but it was still a good value. The lobster my wife ordered was cooked to perfection and probably weighed more than what we ordered  (we were charged for the smaller one). The service was excellent. There was one patron that was very loud initially but he soon left and that helped restore the atmosphere one would expect from a nice establishment. Overall a satisfying experience. We will be visiting again for her birthday in May.

text:
It was Saturday night and the crowd was in. We had the choice of waiting 30 min, or we could eat at the bar.
We sit down and can immediately see the two ladies working are swamped with work. We waited patiently and our bartender got to us. She got our drinks pretty quick(Bahama Mama for my wife which she loved and in sweet tea for me which was good tea) and got us ordered.

We again patiently wait(more so than people who sat near us who just sat for a little bit and then left) and our food comes out. It was fantastic and now I have some great leftovers to enjoy. Our bartender was gracious for our patience as we were to her helping us.

name: Lynda Smith
text: Back in the good days red lobster was awesome. However, the last few years I really don't know what the hell has happened. The crab legs are smaller than a pencil, the lobster is approximately 2-3 ounces...we actually had to ask for our silverware and napkin's, obviously when you're having to crack open your food your ganna need even more napkins. What you see in TV is NOT what you get. The following week we went to out back, what a difference, I actually got the proper size lobster, with a steak! Hmm!! Lesson learned.

name: Eric B (GodSponge)
text: Food is always great here. We used to have issues with our waiters, but lately we've had incredibly good service.

name: Bee J
text: Terrible!! Not only is this restaurant dated, the food has become increasingly poor. I've gone to Red Lobster numerous times, too many too count. I have had many instances of unsatisfactory service (the latest being 5 minutes ago) but I give them chances because they are one of a few seafood restaurants in this area. And I love my snow crab. I Ordered food online was late to make sure the food would be ready (9:52) the food wasnt brought out until after 10:15. No problem.... Things Happen...but then the biscuits were burned (paid for these extra biscuits, I wish I could attach pics) asked for new biscuits and decided to order a chilled shot of patron. The bartender PUTS ICE WATER IN GLASS (in a poor attempt to chill the glass) and pours the warm shot in the glass. This is not chilled, strike 2. Asked for a lime after we had to wait to get her to turn and we were the only 2 people at the bar besides the bartender. The bartender LITERALLY brought a lime with her BARE HANDS and said here you go. No napkin, no tooth pick, straight hand to hand contact. Clearly she should have not been working the bar. Didn't even want the drink just wanted to kill time until the food came back that they screwed up. Paid for the drink and she says have a good one. WHERE ARE MY BISCUITS???? she NEVER brought them back out. I said forget it and left with the burned biscuits which are inedible. This is the LAST time I will visit this red lobster. Until they revamp and retrain their staff... They have lost 2 customers. I mean the carpet even stinks here, you can smell it reeking and there is so much dust your allergies with not like you. It's a shame you spend all this money for subpar quality. Shame on you Red Lobster!!!

name: Star Set
text:
I went here last night to celebrate our anniversary..but the service was booo!

The waitress had a nice demeanor, great attitude..exclusively toward my boyfriend...I have no idea what I did to tick her off in the time it took to greet and seat us but she made sure to let my glass stay empty until my boyfriend could not tolerate her blatant disregard for me.

Having made sure his coke was topped off throughout dinner, she came to the table yet again to ask him if HE wanted a refill When it was MY glass that was empty at the end of the table. He then told her to fill mine and she says, "oh. okay." in a questionable tone.

She also made sure to extend the "couple more minutes" we needed to look over the menu, to about 15-20 minutes..she was a ghost half the night then had the nerve to ask about dessert. I was turned so far off of asking her for anything more than the check and even getting that was complicated..

All told she served the family behind us very well so something was fishy.. The crab okay but sadly we will not be returning.

name: Kelli Black
text: We took my father to lunch yesterday to the Huntsville Red Lobster. He is 85 and a veteran from World War II, Vietnam, and Korea. He retired to   Huntsville almost 30 years ago. He has been going to the Red Lobster there for 30 years.  We had our meal and he insisted on paying the bill. He handed me his wallet which had 3 crisp 50 dollars bills inside. He asked to take two and put them in with the bill.... he wanted to pay the 47 dollar bill and get change to tip the waiter.  I removed the two bills and he ask that i lay them side by side in the envelope so that they did not get stuck together and so the waiter could see there were two and not just one. The lunch was slow taking almost two hours to complete so he finally asked if we could make our way to the car while my wife stayed and waited for the change.  i brought him to the car and we waited for another 20 minutes but my wife did not come.  Finally she did come out and was blown away.  The waiter came back by the table and through the plastic bill holder on the table and said there was no bill or money inside and that he was reprinting the bill for my wife to pay again. I went back into the restaurant to talk to the waiter, but he wouldn't even talk he left for a bit and the manager came out to talk to me. He said that i must have dropped the money and the bill and asked if it was in my pockets. I explained that I knew for sure the money was there because my dad had asked be to take the money from his wallet and to lay the bills next to each other so not to have a mis understanding and that i had closed the plastic envelope before is left and my wife had not even touched it.. only the waiter had touched it.  The manager did not seem to know what to do, but said if i left my number he would call if it turned up. It was a bad situation for everyone. The lady;s sitting across from us leaned over to my wife and said ' we saw you pay the bill"...  I finally decided that having my dad at the restaurant for 2 and a half hours was too long for him to be up so I just told them to keep our money and i left.  I guess i was hoping that the manager would say here is your 40 dollars change you asked for and we will find this mis-placed bill and work it out... i understand it is a bad situation but my dad now will never go back after 30 years and is telling everyone he sees about the lost of  his money.

name: Shannon Marie

name: Lakeysha B
text:
It's still a nice restaurant chain. Unfortunately this time we had a large party and the wait was 1 hour which actually turned into an 1hour and 40 minutes. The manager appologized for the wait around the 1 hour mark.

Finally seated and starving and irritated. It would have been nice to have a complimentary appetizer or two brought to the table by the manager to appologize for the excessive wait time. Nope. So we resorted to asking the waitress for bread which they despise because they are not supposed to bring them out till after you order. Oh well.
Other than that the menu has a good variety and the prices are decent.

name: Zachary White
text:
Can’t say I’d recommend this location, at least not based on this particular experience. The service was very poor (despite not being particularly busy, in the ~2 hours of our being there, the server only voluntarily visited our table 3-4 times).

As for the meal itself, the iced tea I was served tasted funny. The dish I ordered had a choice of New York Strip or Filet Mignon and, despite not indicating a preference, the server never asked me which I’d like. The Caesar salad had maybe 3-5 shavings of parmesan on it and the lettuce was rather limp and not crisp. The shrimp scampi was fine; it tasted of garlic and not much else. The wood-grilled shrimp was meh; it was lackluster in terms of flavor, due in part to its complete lack of seasoning. In general everything was pretty bland.The “steamed” broccoli was instead maybe half-steamed, i.e. it was half-raw, therefore rather crunchy. And even the ~$11 Lobster Tail was over-cooked, dry, and bland (also it wasn’t served with butter).

Based on this experience, I would recommend going to a different location or, if you find that the quality does not improve elsewhere, pick a different restaurant altogether. 3/10.

I went here last night to celebrate our anniversary..but the service was booo!

The waitress had a nice demeanor, great attitude..exclusively toward my boyfriend...I have no idea what I did to tick her off in the time it took to greet and seat us but she made sure to let my glass stay empty until my boyfriend could not tolerate her blatant disregard for me.

Having made sure his coke was topped off throughout dinner, she came to the table yet again to ask him if HE wanted a refill When it was MY glass that was empty at the end of the table. He then told her to fill mine and she says, "oh. okay." in a questionable tone.

She also made sure to extend the "couple more minutes" we needed to look over the menu, to about 15-20 minutes..she was a ghost half the night then had the nerve to ask about dessert. I was turned so far off of asking her for anything more than the check and even getting that was complicated..

All told she served the family behind us very well so something was fishy.. The crab okay but sadly we will not be returning.

This was our last trip to the Red Lobster on University Drive and the sad part is I use to love going there with my Father before he passed away!  We are done with Red Lobster!

name: Joanne Reynolds
text: Went there yesterday for a late lunch around two with my husband. There weren't that many people there. Stopped at the hostess stand and she was on the phone talking to someone about a lost article. No big deal so we waited several minutes while she finished her phone conversation. There was also a male employee who was stacking menus who just ignored us. The female hostess gets off the phone and seats us. We look through the menu and make our selections. I realized that we still had not even been greeted even though 3 other tables had been seated after us and were approached by their waiters and were given drinks and biscuits. Still no waiter even though there were two waiters standing by our booth right behind my husband. Our booth was at the end so they were just a couple of feet from us and I am sure that they could hear our conversation wondering why we didn't have a waiter. At that point I pulled out my cellphone to keep track of the time. We had been sitting there for almost fifteen minutes when a female waiter passed us and said our waiter would be there in just a minute. A few minutes more went by before a female waiter who had an order of food to deliver paused at our table and asked if we knew what we wanted to drink. I told her that we had been sitting there for quite some time and already knew what we wanted to order to eat. She said okay that she would be right back and would take good care of us. I saw her deliver the food and then go to another table to take their order. My husband and I just looked at each other and got up and left. I can't believe that there were waiters standing around and nobody had waited on us in all that time. It was inexcusable and I will be sure to let everyone we know what poor service we were given. I could understand if it was busy, but there weren't many tables occupied.

name: Justice Writer
text: Every time we visit a Red Lobster and especially the one in the Huntsville, Alabama on University, we say, never again.  This time, Niadja, our waitress was caring; but she gave us dinner pricing when our visit was at lunchtime. Is it legal to charge dinner prices at lunch claiming that the sizes are larger without notice or consent from the customer? We never got the towelettes we requested until the end, either.  In Japan, for instance, a nice hot cloth towel is afforded to the patrons prior to eating. On the same note, Japanese peeps don’t wear shoes indoors either so why would we expect for an American restaurant to provide us hand wipes prior to eating? Our seats were too close together, so we moved. But, the table we moved to wobbled and caused damages to us as well as to our belongings. Thomas, the manager was rude and indifferent. Niadja was to apply a $4.00 coupon which led to our finding out about the pricing deceit. Our hot-spot was being used; but Thomas wouldn't let us use their DSL to get the $4.00 coupon from our Trash. Thank GOD $4.00 won't break us since GOD has given us so much. It's the principal of the matter, though. On our visit previously, a man came in seeking stuff and it was not until he started to bother other guests did management ask him to leave. Plus $1000 was stolen from an acquaintance of ours from her purse while she and her friends were eating there a while ago. On second thought, the people there are very unhappy, the waitresses never smile and purposely catch your eye only to give you a mean look. What a shame.

text: Me and my husband went Sunday for our first date night in months. Our server was Missy! She was really sweet she moved us to a tv where my hubby could watch tv. Once moved we were seated in a booth in the bar area where we were intruded by a giant waterbug. My hubby knocked it down and a server not ours came and ran it from under our table where as i stepped on it. The manager came out and said i heard you all had a friend. We received our ultimate feast and asked for togo boxes and our check. The manager didn't take anything off evrn though it was a terrible exoerience that caused a loss of appetite for us both. I mean who wants to eat and see big roaches. We paid our whole bill tipped our waitress and left. We will not be going back!!!!

name: Meg Stroh
text:
We decided to give this joint one more try after 4 years. We had a bad experience and hadn't been back. Total transparency: most of the food was pretty good. It's the environment, employees, and lack of customer service that will prevent us from returning for probably another 4 years, if ever.

The hostess had her mask below her nose the *entire* visit. Our server and at least one other server, also had their masks below their nose most of the time we were there. However admittedly, our server did occasionally pull his up.

We had to ask for refills, napkins, and our check, as those things were not provided or offered intuitively.

Lastly, our sever rang up our order wrong. I ordered a hamburger slider/garden bar combo meal for $12.99 and he rung it up separately, $9.99 for the garden bar and $4.99 for the hamburger sliders.
When I pointed it out (after he'd rung us out, my husband was paying...), he said he'd tell his manager and she'd come handle it.
Instead he came back with $2 and said his manager said the difference is $2 so here we go.

The difference was actually $2.18 and let's be real, $0.18 doesn't matter right? I obviously don't NEED 18 cents.
However, the principle of the matter: if a manager is going to ROUND something out in order to avoid the complication of re-ringing things up and refunding money to our card... fine. But don't do it in YOUR favor. Give me $2 and a quarter?

It just got under my skin... Ruby Tuesday does have to work a little harder than most places because they're fighting off several negative experiences by myself and my husband, even before me.... so they're walking a tighter rope.

But we won't be back anytime soon. Sadly, because I do really enjoy the salad bar.

name: Chelli Flores
text: Great food and service. Salad bar had a nice selection.

name: Anita Factory
text: Food was disappointing and bland. Manager made excuses instead of acknowledging the issue. In Troy we only have a few options it would be nice to have enjoyed this meal. I will not be coming back  EVERYTIME I come I do not enjoy my experience or food. I have given it multiple chances. Hoping it will be better. I have learned my lesson Ruby Tuesday’s in Troy,AL does not have quality food. The menu is amazing and the location is perfect. There should be no issues. ALSO BATHROOMS NASTY. GLASSES OLD AND BROKEN.

name: Tiffany Dobbs
text: My bf and I went and we ordered drinks and he got a long island iced tea and I got the drink special that day. His long island iced tea came out not even the right color. It was made with margarita mix and obviously the bartender didn't know what they were doing. So the waitress brought him another one and it was still very light like the color of lemonade but he just let it go. Both of our drinks tasted extremely watered down. I got some chicken pharm and it was nothing but a frozen tv dinner. You could tell they had left it under a heat lamp while waiting on my boyfriend's steak to cook. Which was only medium rare. We asked for salt and pepper and we were given little to go paper packs and this may be a petty complaint but I feel like a 80 dollar meal should include at least real salt and pepper shakers. We used to love it. We won't ever go back.

name: Barbara Coots
text: For $30 we got 2 raw hamburgers. No condiments. Cold hard buns. We returned the order. Manager made it right and we got 2 delicious burger on steamed bun with condiments. But I won't go back because theres a 50% chance it won't be good.

name: Qwandaisia Adams
text:
I ordered takeout through door dash. Received only half of my order. I’m not quite sure who is exactly responsible for the missing items or the drink I received that was half way filled.
(Asked for lemonade no ice)
May I recommend that Ruby Tuesday staple all to go orders through door dash just to give the customer a piece of mind. I would also like to add that the rice pilaf was super salty! Food was COLD when I received it I didn’t enjoy it at all. This restaurant is to pricey to not make sure the food is served correctly and that the customer is satisfied. Maybe a better experience next time!

name: VaNessa Frost
text: The food was delicious but customer service was lacking Patiently stood at the bar to pick up my order At least 3 employees were around but none acknowledged me or said that someone would be with me After many minutes went to the car to call them to see if it was ready She said yes that it was at bar Went back in to get it Still took several minutes to get my order as she had to look for it Not the first time that I've gone there and been ignored If not never it will be a long time before I go there again!

name: John Rhodes
text: Does what it does ok, liked the steaks and food of the past better.

name: Christian Harris
text: It's a lil pricy for what you get, but that's the deal with any Ruby Tuesday's. Our waitress, Adrianna, did a great job, and the food did taste amazing! Place was clean, and the environment was nice, I've eaten here before and I'm certain I will eat here again!

name: Liz Angelica
text: Food was ok. Not worth the prices. Waitress was friendly and attentive.

name: Mike Goodall
text: We had one of the rudest servers I have ever had. She brought drinks to everyone one person in our group. His tea was sitting right beside her at the stand she was standing at. He raised his hand and motioned for her and she shouted...I will be right there, so I shouted right back, do you mind bring him his tea??  She brought it over, he thanked her and she never said a word, just walked away. 3 of us ordered salads. We got them and came back and set down. No silverware on the table. We tried to stop her two times as she walked buy. On the third time, I just leaned out to block her path and told her we needed something to eat our food with. She brought it and set them all down on the table and I handed them out to the 5 of us. She brought out one of the food orders and said the others were on their way. After 3 or 4 minutes she brought out the other two plates. One was missing his brickley, she said she would be right back with it. It never made it to the table. We had all ran out of drinks by this time and we had to stop her again to ask for refeels. 3 of us thanked he and we didn't even get so much as a grunt back from her. Then she brings out the appitser I had ordered. I thanked her, again nothing. When she brought out checks out, she put them at one end of the table, I handed them out to everyone. One of our party members left the exact change, one paid with all Bill's and the rest were paying with cards. She picked up the two that left cash and left our cards on the table. She came back and laid the money down from the order that paid the exact change, minus the change. She said, she didn't pay enough and walked away, again leaving the cards on the table. I looked at the check and the total was $13.21, I got a quarter and put it on top of the bill's. She came back, look to see how much the ticket was then counted the money. This is when she mumbled under her breath "No tip? I guess I work for free."  And without stopping to think I said, "I guess you do when you are rude as hell to everyone at our table. I then went through the list of everything above, picked up my CC and handed it to her. And I know, she could have been having a bad day, but it does not take much to say You're welcome.

name: Sherri Lynn
text: The sirloin, tilapia,  & garden bar was amazing.......Unfortunately I had to substitute my Pineapple Upside-down Cake with Cheesecake.......ok no worries. My door dash driver did call to ask my preference for the substitute 🏆 Someone forgot to include the additional cheesecake with our order. I shouldn't have to share my dessert on Valentines Day 😕

name: Angelia Thomas
text:
I took my kids here for dinner tonight. First and last time at this location. I go to Ruby Tuesday all the time back in SWFL so I thought ok the food will be good since I'm in town visiting I don't know where to go for good food. The whole experience started out horrible and ended horrible.

We get there and get seated. We waited 15-20 minutes just to put our drink orders in. We waited another 15-20 minutes for our drinks. We had an unsweet tea and a chocolate milk. Once when we got our drinks we ordered the food. I ordered my usual that I always order back home. When our food had arrived I was changing my son's diaper our food had arrived. My son's pasta was hot but my ribs that I had ordered was cold. I had waved the server down a couple of times but he never checked up on us. He saw me eating my son's pasta because my son wasn't eating it and he didn't ask if anything was wrong. When he finally checked on us we were done eating. I told him my ribs was cold and he asked if I wanted a fresh whole rack of ribs. I said no thanks and requested my meal to be removed. No manager came over to check up on us to apologize or anything. I'm so glad the one I go to all the time isn't like this.

name: MONICA MCCALL
text: Both the food and service were amazing!

name: Steven Brian Powell
text: They don’t deserve one star, I live near Troy so I visit this restaurant often over the years, or I use to, the last 3 times there it has been over an hour wait with the last time being the worse, we ordered to go curb Side pickup at 1300 was suppose to be ready by 1327, at 1320 we called in to check in when we arrived, at 1350 we called back in to see how much longer, a guy came out and said about 10 more minutes, well at 1430 I called back in and asked to talk to a manager( I prepaid with a tip, so that’s why I didn’t just leave) he then brought our food out without the drinks so he had to go back and get them, he brought out drinks, no sorry for the wait nothing, we literally opened the food as we left and it was all cold, I wanted to take it back and throw it in the floor but my wife wouldn’t let me, so we heated it up at home and made the best of it, that food was around $75 plus a $20 tip, you better enjoy that RT because I have spent my last dollar at your business, and I will be sure to tell all who will listen how incompetent your establishment is, hopefully this review saves someone the same trouble, don’t go there, hell go to McDonald’s at least it’s hot food

name: Roger Stone
text:
Excellent, had the flat iron steak. Very good and the Ruby Tuesday's cause was
also very good. Service was immediate and prices very reasonable.

text: food was great and so was the customer service

name: Samantha Sanders
text: Service and food was great will definitely be back

name: Angie Wamsley
text: We had the BEST experience at the restaurant in Troy Alabama with Cameron our waitress and Miss Kim the manager!! We went once and were so well taken care of we went back 2 days later! They were both so kind, professional and we felt like we were the only ones in the restaurant. We are visiting Troy from up north wish we lived here because we’ve never had such wonderful people serve us. Thanks so much Cameron and Miss Kim for making our dining experience so special!!!

resp.text: Thank you for dining with id's! I'm so glad we made your visit ski wonderful!!

Everything was brought out but had to repeatedly ask for items that were missing.. Also asked for a lava cake but received something totally different. Asked server If this was right( me knowing it was the wrong thing) she continued to tell me yes she was sure it was right. She brought out the chocolate tall cake instead of the lava cake. Just slow and sloppy know it all service.

We always highly recommend Olive Garden..  wish they delivered!

The fried shrimp were okay and my wifes avocado burger was good.  I had chicken tenders which were not good (old and very rubbery) and my daughter had a grilled chicken breast that was closer to a slice of rubber than chicken.  Disappointed and the food tasted microwaved and not fresh made.

text: Horrible salad bar with dried out food, nails sticking out of side of bench seat, tore my 35.00 special made shirt, they are right where small children walk by and neither waitress could give a flip that was preparing our Table. My husband's steak wasn't cooked right and he specifically asked for no sour cream on his potato. When asked​ for to go drinks, they weren't topped off. We had to ask for lids and the waiter said the manager said they did not have lids. My husband saw lids on way to bathroom. He requested to speak to the manager. No one had told her about issues. I noticed people leaving without eating full meals. The waiter didn't even know what beer they had on tap and yelled across the room at the guy who asked about beer, he asked to see menu, waiter yelled out on table. This is what it is like to eat at Troy, AL Ruby Tuesday. No wonder the one in our city closed down.

Gabe me the wrong order when my food finally did get here. Some food never came, some was burnt, replacement never came.

After telling them they gave me the wrong order, they proceded to remake the wrong dish again, after asking me if I wanted what I originally ordered.

Do not plan on returning

You order over the phone, or internet, pull up, and they bring your order right to your car. The staff are pretty helpful, and knowledgeable about their menu.

Next I was not very happy with service while checking out, upon arrival she handed me my food & went to get my To Go containers, sounds OK BUT I had called twice to make sure they understood it was a 20 min drive before I arrived & I had ordered salads I had to make...after making salads she handed me a bag and walked off, OK there are not many chances to earn that tip but here is one, it's a struggle getting those containers into the bag, its so helpful when they assist. Last but most important she did not check the food with me!
My next visit was very much an improvement!

name: Abigail Lee Broker/Owner
text: When I told my parents I was coming to the Gulf Shores area my dad said I had to stop here. Literally came here right from the airport and was not disappointed! Not even sure how to describe this place. Right on the beach, live music and literally three different places, great drinks, love the environment, and great food as well! There was live music outside, and there were two places inside where there was live musicians playing. Each had their different sound and feel. If you are in this area this is a 'must go' to place. People were in their swimsuits but also dressed in sundresses. You will see all walks of life here in all are welcome! We definitely recommend!

name: Sean Bryan
text: This place lived up to the hype and was definitely unique. We went as a large group and had a great time. Next year when we return I’m sure we will all go back again. Good live music. The food was good as well, really enjoyed the oysters. If you’re looking for a fun night in the area this won’t disappoint.

resp.text: Thanks for coming to hang out with us and for taking the time to write a review. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Justin Walters
text: Love this place! There ain't nothing like having a cold beer on the beach and looking at the local talent. Always a band playing and you can watch the skydivers from Skydive the Gulf fly in(that's how I got here this time!) Been wearing a Flora-Bama hat everyday for the last 6 years so you can tell I'm a fan!

name: Cassidy Acuff Williams
text: We ate at the yacht club. The manager is friendly and so kind. We loved one of the bartenders she made excellent drinks and just easy to talk to. Food was tasty but nothing beats the atmosphere! Would love to go again with live music. Family friendly during the day. Clean and fun place

name: Mike Vandergrift
text: Exactly what you read about it. Went two weekdays during COVID-19 and the place was still great. Good enough to buy a T-shirt.

name: Bekah Hinton
text: We went for the bushwhackers and oysters. The bushwhackers weren't my favorite, but holy cow the oysters!! We got their sampler plate with three different styles of oysters and they were all delicious. The quality of the oysters was great! They were really plump and juicy and cooked perfectly! We'd come back for the oysters if we're ever in the area again.

name: Sherard Orange
text: I’m a little late posting this review. We were on a family vacation and heard about the awesome atmosphere of this place. Went for lunch and we had a good time. Food was excellent our waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu and offered us suggestions, since it was our first time. We sat outside, since it was a nice day over looking the boat docks. We will return next year.

resp.text: Thanks Sherard for the kind words! We are so glad you enjoyed your experience with us. We look forward to having you and your family back with us.

name: Billye Logan
text: Great music, several bands and/or solo artists performing for your listening pleasure. Friendly staff. Great experience all around. Highly recommend a visit. You can walk out the back onto the beach!

name: Sony Steier
text: A historic landmark in terms of dining and a fun time! Not upscale or a dining gem but good drinks and simple tasteful grub.

name: Tricia White
text: It was a neat place, food was okay, not our favorite spot around orange beach but still something fun and different. Our little waitress was a sweet heart and did a great job especially with such a large group. It was a little difficult trying to find a parking spot.

name: B Googler
text: Awesome place, very fun. Is very busy but service is pretty good considering. They know what they're doing. This place must have 7 or 8 bars and multiple stages. Plus a nice short walk to and from the beach. This place deserves it's own song.

name: Kristyna Wickline
text: Flora-bama was beautiful!!! We went the day of the Easter Event! So much fun with the beach egg hunt and the skydiving Easter Bunny! You helped my family make so many memories! The beach was beautiful, the nachos delicious and all the staff so kind! Also loved the live music on the beach!!!

name: Al Beesure
text: Awesome place, awesome atmosphere as well and everyone are super friendly. A must visit please Perdido Key.

name: Ace
text: Great place and entertainment. The food was good and the burgers are amazing. Multiple bars and 5 stages plenty of tables. I would highly recomend this place.

name: Katelyn
text: Would’ve been a fun night if it wasn’t for the security guards punching one of the guys in our group for no reason, was a complete jerk when we came into the bar as well as coming out. Bartenders ignored us and weren’t friendly either. Am sad to leave this review as so many seem so good.

resp.text: Hey Katelyn! Thank you for your review and letting us know what happened while you were spending time with us. We truly apologize for the way you were treated. That is not our standard, not the norm, and certainly not acceptable. We will address this with our staff, but I would love some more information if you could email me at jenifer@florabama.com so we can make sure to address it with the appropriate staff members. Thank you for your time!

name: Amanda Washburn
text: Awesome! It was like an adult playhouse. We went on a Wednesday evening. The drinks were good, atmosphere was very friendly. Good music everywhere. A lil loud in some places, understandably because live music, but you could easily walk out on the beach to the quiet or other places that were not as loud. The oysters were the best!!! I will be going back. Very cool place!

name: Wendi Harris
text: The place was packed and noisy. Might be a local party spot since 3 spots to choose from. We went to the yacht club for dinner, drinks and live music. We had a great time. The food was awesome too.

name: Tonya Spell
text: So fun. Made me wish that I found this place while in my 20s but still had fun in my 40s!

name: shannon epps
text: Gretchen was amazing!! She gave us the best services EVER! Make sure you ask for her. I had the shrimps and grits. Definitely on the TOP of my list. I’ll definitely return 🥰

name: John Maier
text:
We went during the afternoon, with the family to play bingo.  Such a good time.
The caller was funny!

name: Julie Paulston
text: Food was good! Music was awesome and the beach was magical. I've lived in Pensacola 2 years and this was my first time here. I definitely will be back!

name: Theads Phillips
text: This is a really nice place to check out.. good drinks and the food is good when you finally get it.. the people there are very nice. The view is amazing ..  go so you can say you've been. You won't regret it.

name: Kelli jo Weatherford Hall
text: Way cool place to visit. Had a blast playing in the ocean with my family

name: Nicholas Reed
text: Great restaurant and great atmosphere? Try the shrimp tacos. They are excellent! If you have a boat, you can beach up at the restaurant! Awesome place!

name: David Baehr
text: Flora-bama is always so much fun.  There is always a band playing.  Make a day of it, bring your suits and towels to enjoy the beach, with a key lime pie drink of course. Food is all great and also reasonable, won't your wallet with a big family. Oysters are fantastic. If you want a non busier day, Thursdays are good.

resp.text: Hey David! Thanks so much for your kind words! We hope to have you back soon!

name: Rick Vaughn
text: Very Beach, under the boardwalk atmosphere, a corner for most every description of beach life. The drinks were small, but very good. Security was  posted discreetly throughout. The bands on various levels were fun, they work the crowd well, sing your favorites. The crowds are ready to have fun, dance if they like or toe-tap in their chairs.

name: Ed Napier
text: Great place.  Great people.  Always fun.  Right on the beach.  Highly recommended.

name: Walter Sobchak
text: Local favorite, but expensive. Multiple bars and stages for musicians. Great place. Get a Bushwacker with a spiced rum floater.

name: Al Beesure
text: Awesome place, awesome atmosphere as well and everyone are super friendly. A must visit please Perdido Key.

name: Joe Harvell
text: Wow. What a fun place. The live music is great and the drinks are cold.

name: Jen S
text: Very big with many options of where to sit, eat and what music you want to hear. Even a band on the beach. Music 365 days a year and a big gift shop

name: Vickie Estes
text: Fun but everything was WAY OVERPRICED 2 DRINKS 26 DOLLARS SMH

name: Kenneth Phillips
text: Love, Love, Love this place. One of our favs when visiting Gulf Shores & Orange Beach.

name: Jean Shultz
text: Great place to hang out & have some beers!! Loved it!!!💓

name: T Mamola
text: Great service and music, try the bushwacker with a shot on top. Also the nachos are good too!

name: Jessica Oliver
text: We went for Halloween which was a blast. The day before they had outside bingo. We took the boat out Sunday and went to the yatch club across the street that was also nice but the t.vs were a little wonky and kept changing the game channels. Staff was really nice and working on fixing it. Cool place. I'd go back. I ordered their shrimp and oysters with hesitation but was presently suprised. Thanks for the great times y'all 😘

name: Jack LaFountain
text: Great lunch. Love their Lazy Deckhand

text: Would’ve been a fun night if it wasn’t for the security guards punching one of the guys in our group for no reason, was a complete jerk when we came into the bar as well as coming out. Bartenders ignored us and weren’t friendly either. Am sad to leave this review as so many seem so good.

resp.text: Hey Katelyn! Thank you for your review and letting us know what happened while you were spending time with us. We truly apologize for the way you were treated. name: Ellen Wilson
text: Best music venue I’ve ever been to. The staff is super friendly, helpful and efficient. I was able to go twice in five days and if I lived there I’d be there every weekend. We made a lot of new friends from all over the US. Great place for music, dancing, beverages and friends.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your kind words Ellen! We hope to have you back soon!

name: Kelly L Malliet
text: Food was amazing!  Get yourself the watermelon 🍹 margaritas.   Our server was great too.  Highly recommend.

name: Maggie Mckerley
text: Came here straight from the airport since we couldn’t check in immediately. The nicest woman kept an eye on our luggage near the entrance. Ended up staying longer than anticipated because the vibes are immaculate! Couldn’t leave ❤️ She left our luggage with workers in the gift shop and a nice note telling us where to find it. Thank you so much!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! We hope to have you back on the line soon!

name: Randy Jacob
text: Love it every time we go. Staff is great, great live music. Good food.  All kinds of cool merchandise.

name: Jason Gagnon
text: Whew what a night. Tuesday, rainy cool outside but bands and drinks were poppin on inside. Was post 55th birthday celebration to me. Met some cool peeps at the bar and our bartenders were awesome!! I Had a little to much to drink. They kindly cut me off which was definitely good move for all of us. I love to have fun sometimes little to much. Staff assisted me to parking lot. Management kindly got me a taxi so I didn't attempt to drive. Great call and much appreciated. I'm here on vacation and don't need any trouble. They were definitely looking out for me. Highly recommend this place if ya never been.

resp.text: Hey Jason! Thank you so much for choosing to spend your Tuesday with us and for the kind words. Who hasn't had a little too much fun, especially celebrating a birthday, right? :). We are glad you made it home safely and that you had excellent service. Thank you again for the feedback and for being a patron of Flora-Bama. We hope you spend some more time here on your vacation with us!

name: Carrie Cook
text: Love the sea food here! Great beer and drinks! Shrimp amazing!

name: Denise Guerriero
text: This place was amazing. This was the first time i was there and my fiance and I really enjoyed ourselves. We will be back again.

name: Vickie Estes
text: Fun but everything was WAY OVERPRICED 2 DRINKS 26 DOLLARS SMH

name: gavin simoneaux
text:
Just visited from out of state and the lady at the door took my VALID and REAL drivers license and threatened to call the cops if I wanted it back. I am not a confrontational person at all and so I did as I was told. I left and tried calling back but was hung up on. She was very very rude and threatening even though she did not even really look at my ID or scan it or anything. If you scan my ID, it’ll prove it is valid and belongs to me. Being from a small state, i do get lots of questions about my ID but all scanners and databases prove that I am in fact 23 and from Rhode Island.
Dear Flora Bama, please reimburse me for my flight I can not board without an ID as well as for my new ID I must get and for the love of god PLEASE fire the extremely rude lady at the door.

name: Marcus Umstead
text: It's just like it was in 1987, despite being rebuilt, which is awesome! I don't recall all the buildings around it, though, haha!

name: Brenda Somers
text: We really enjoyed the  Bushwackers and  Big Earl. We always come there when we get down that way.

name: David Alday
text: Lots of fun. Good food in big portions at reasonable prices. Nice views on both sides and friendly staff. They even take dogs on the canal side.

text: Great entertainment with live band who really rocked this joint!! Very crowded, no social distancing, but we had our vaccine. We arrived before the cover charge, so that was great!!

resp.text: Hey Mark! Thanks so much for your kind words! We hope to have you back soon!

name: Tiffany Holland
text: It's a must stop for any ocean loving, island loving, pirates!! Foods great,  drinks will have you feeling fine, and you will not find better vibes!

name: Ryan
text: Great atmosphere! Great staff and live band! The shrimp was to die for! Oysters were good too. Drinks were pricy but also good. Definitely a place to stop at

name: Billy Cline
text: Very cool place.  Huge o. The inside with a lot to do.  One of the highlights of the place was watching staff shuck the oysters.  Staff was great and great place to have oysters in a variety of ways. Great experience!

resp.text: Hey Billy! We are so glad you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to have you back soon!

name: Timothy Matthews
text: Had so much fun! The place is huge! Great place!

name: Lynn Brown
text: A ton of fun can be found here great music and great staff

name: Joe Owens
text: What a place. The history on the walls alone is worth the trip.

name: Craig Barber
text: Awesome!!!! Insanely fun! A very must see place!! Bands all great!!
