name: Kuowen Aquino
text:
Amazing food and our server was awesome!
Steve was our server and he’s very kind we’ll definitely be back and make sure to ask for him!.
Bushwacker was a bit strong though I would suggest make the sweet flavor pop a little more so it evens out but other than that our food and drinks and server was magnificent. Don’t take my word for it go check it out for yourself fellas.

resp.text: Hey Kuowen! We are so glad to hear you had a a great time at Flora-Bama! We hope to have you back on the line soon!

name: Jessica Oliver
text: We went for Halloween which was a blast. The day before they had outside bingo. We took the boat out Sunday and went to the yatch club across the street that was also nice but the t.vs were a little wonky and kept changing the game channels. Staff was really nice and working on fixing it. Cool place. I'd go back. I ordered their shrimp and oysters with hesitation but was presently suprised. Thanks for the great times y'all 😘

name: Tiffany Snow
text: Bartender seemed to be rough around the edges but reality was she was great at her job and took very good care of us.  Great environment and food

name: Jamie Lerche
text: Awesome! Good food, love music, also enjoyed Sunday church service.

name: Deborah Stephens
text: My first trip and it was awesome. Brandon our server was the best !!

resp.text: Thanks Deborah! So glad you enjoyed it and we will be share to let Brandon know he did a great job.

name: Julz Elmore
text: Fun location.  Several rooms for various venue experience.  Music stages for variety of audiences.  Fun servers.  Lots of seating options.  Limited food selection on premise but the restaurant across the street gets rave reviews.  Most drink concoctions are available.  Reasonable prices.

name: Dianne Swanson
text: Was a chilly wet day passing thru, but was still a good time. Great burger and the shrimp...YUMMY!

name: Debbie Hill
text: Fun place to hang out!  You can sit inside and listen to live music, or go outside and sit at a table on the beach. There is also free bingo available.

name: misty baker
text:
My favorite place on the gulf coast!  You have got to do Bingo... it is SO much fun.  The jokes & stories are fantastic.

The live music is a real treat, you sit in the main stage & there is no cover charge, you get great service & you get to listen to great music!

name: Bob Hopkins
text: Fast friendly service. Yummy shrimp tacos. Very cool layout. Great view of the Gulf

name: Ted Smith
text: I've been to the FloraBama several times. One of my favorite "off beat" places to take out of town company to.

name: Dorene Towson Senesac
text: Such a great day/night.  Stee and Joe Piano Show. Awesome ...as well as Kim Carson.  Just a great 1st time visit!!!

name: Kisha F
text: Had the best day of my life at the beach again! How can it get any better than this? A bar on the beach! Huge indoors lots of music live and otherwise. I will  Be back!

name: Tommy Ford
text: All the fun in one place live music cold drinks, what more could one ask for

name: zach jurkowski
text: TOURIST TRAP! The only good thing about this place was the char broiled oysters. Mixed drinks were okay....Fish n chips were only breading with a side of greesy sides. And the fish and the shrimp tacos were flavorless. Plus the bathrooms were disgusting...no TP and trash all over the floor. Go somewhere else and don't ruin a night where you could have good food for your vacation.

resp.text: Hey Zach! I apologize that you didn't have a good experience with us. Could you email more information about your experience to mary@florabama.com? We are always looking for ways to improve and would love any feedback you can offer!

name: Ross Fischer
text: Great music, and good drinks. Definitely see the booze room, that feeds all the speed guns with liquor. Average age in the low twenties?

name: steven crosby
text: Awesome food and good times. Nothing finer then perfect.

name: Abel Richard Cruz
text: My bestie and I go here often and it's always the most fun.... Luv day Bingo

name: Jen S
text: Very big with many options of where to sit, eat and what music you want to hear. Even a band on the beach. Music 365 days a year and a big gift shop

name: Claudia Collier
text: You can't go wrong visiting this place! No matter what age you are or what type of music you like, you will always have a great time!

resp.text: Thanks so much for your kind words! We hope to have you back soon!

name: Madison Bass
text: Man talk about a blast. THE BARTENDERS ARE BORN ROCKSTARS. THE FOOD man.... it was so good.

name: Timothy Matthews
text: Had so much fun! The place is huge! Great place!

name: Darrin Spoon
text: Flora-Bama is a must when in the area. The bands played great music and the service was friendly and fast. If Rhonda Hart is playing, sit down and enjoy. She and her band were amazing. Awesome place, thanks for the memories Flora-Bama!

resp.text: Hey Darrin! We are so glad to hear that you had a great experience with us! We hope to have you back soon!

name: Steve Porter
text: It's Awesome place to be a drink very cold adult beverage and enjoy very Delicious food

name: Deborah West
text: We just visited there and were so very disappointed.  We loved the Bushwacker drinks and the star was for them even though they were expensive.  We ordered the grilled oyster sampler platter and it cost about 26.00 for 12 really tiny pitiful oysters.  These were the worst we have ever ordered out and we grill them at home when we can get them so we know good ones.  My husband is too kind and tipped 20 percent anyway.  When we got home he said he should not have tipped so much but he did not want to punish the server.  Just beware and get oysters somewhere else.

resp.text: Hey Deborah! We are so sorry to hear about your oysters. We will give this information to our kitchen manager and make sure to address it. Thank you so much for the kind words about our Bushwacker and for taking care of the staff with a generous tip. They most definitely appreciate that. We hope that you will come back to see us again.

name: John Douglas
text: This has to be the coolest bar in the world. You won't find better music or Bushwhackers! The vibe here is just the best.

name: Chad Reno
text: I go there almost every special occasion best place to get drunk at I highly recommended

name: Kevin Galton
text: Just love this place, had a great time. We come back every year

name: Paul Alidor
text: Bushwhackers! 😊❤🍻 I've been coming here for 32 years and I've never had a bad time. I didn't even know they served food until recently.. 😳

name: Keith Driscoll
text: Great spot to sit in the sand and sun to enjoy an adult beverage!

name: Jeff Williams
text: Iconic bar.  Spending a Wednesday afternoon listening to great live entertainment hanging with friends.  Doesn't get any better than that.

name: Charlie Coleman
text: Love this place. Go for bongo with Sam. He's awesome and very funny.

name: Chris Da Mech
text: Every Junior Officer from NAS Pensacola is stumbling around drunk in there, Lol.  Great place with plenty of bars everywhere inside and awesome with different bands playing on different levels, definitely a must experience.

name: Jean Shultz
text: Great place to hang out & have some beers!! Loved it!!!💓

name: Shauna Webster
text: Lovely little place to visit. Reminds me of old wood house vibe although too many stairs for me. I tripped a few times while there but overall cute local bar to go to. I tried a chocolate bushwacker for the first time. Very potent. Will visit again soon.

name: Ailani Cantu
text: Food was amazing and they did everything they could to get my order in right before they closed. And our server Matt was just so delightful and helpful.

name: Helen Wheels
text:
Fun spot.  We hit the Grille and loved it.  Food came out quickly. Everything was delicious. Casual atmosphere.  Sand on your feet. Not fussy... food is worth the visit.

We shared the fried crab claws and onion rings and everyone loved their entree.  The fish sandwich was large and well prepared. No complaints.

name: Carla Harger
text: Great food. Great atmosphere. Great service. Steve was are waiter and he did an amazing job with are party of 12.

name: Joe Owens
text: What a place. The history on the walls alone is worth the trip.

name: April Hicks
text: Girls Trip!! We had so much fun!! Fabulous music! Fantastic service! Great selection of take home goodies!!

name: Lois Rincon
text: Great music on the beach. Friendly staff. Can't beat the water views.

name: Kovaaks__TTV
text: Very fun. But got sunburnt. The mullet toss was pretty good aswell

name: O A
text: Great music, lots of space to move around, chill vibes.

name: Alisha Huff-Kirksey
text: Our server was Gretchen she was AMAZING we love her, everytime we go back we're requesting her!! I had Big Earl's Shrimp & Grits they were SPECTACULAR!! I also had a Key Lime Colada it was SUPERB!! 💃🏽😄💃🏽😄💃🏽 Flora-Bama is 💣💣💣!!!

name: Susan Strong
text: Fun place to see, and I also won $50 on a scratch off

name: VictoriaGrace
text: No it's not a super great restaurant. It's just that you hear all about it so you have to go check it out if you're near.  It got 4 stars for being friendly and quick.  It's just as described which I won't repeat but I'm glad we didn't pass it up.  I guess I could say it's expensive mediocre food but it's an experience.

name: JOSH MOODY ADVENTURES IN LIVING
text: An absolute blast every time we are here. A must do if you are in the area. Fantastic bar and venue

name: John Moodhard
text: Neat place.  Great people working there !  Great food and entertainment available.  Lots of fun but the limited parking is a fail.

resp.text: Hey John! We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your time at Flora-Bama! We are sorry that parking was limited, but we hope to have you back on the line again soon!

name: Tabitha McAnally
text: Shane was an Aplus server, food was great, atmosphere was superb and the bushwackers were on point!

name: Eileen Dalton
text: Interesting establishment with multiple floors!!

name: Laurie Waddell
text: Good people  nice  Bands  Drinks were  High  priced.

name: Lisa Getts-Folsom
text: Great place! Lot's of music in different areas of the place. Had a Bushwacker and was not disappointed.

name: Tim Myers
text: Great place to eat, listen to live music, dance, have some drinks and look at the ocean.

name: Speedy G
text: It was okay for a Sunday night. Even met a couple cool chicks.

resp.text: Glad you met some great people. Thank you for coming to hang out with us!

name: David Alday
text: Lots of fun. Good food in big portions at reasonable prices. Nice views on both sides and friendly staff. They even take dogs on the canal side.

name: Kristie Martin
text: We have been coming to the Florabama since the 90's. We love it! Great atmosphere!

name: Will Corley
text: Lucia was a fabulous server!! and brandon was so cute he should call me! great experience all around

name: jay dempsey
text: I am all and love the atmosphere is so bad did you see the

name: Chris Russo
text: Those Mahi Tacos though! Thanks Syd for the amazing experience as well as excellent suggestions. We will be back asking for you. Never have I ever had better service. Ask for Syd!!!

name: Julia Lewis
text: Always a great time, at FloraBama on our May trip to Orange Beach ⛱

name: David Vann
text: A bigger, wilder, Flora-Bama than days-gone-by. Good luck on holiday weekends.

name: Carmela Russo-Pitstick
text: Unique watering hole. Nice views. Friendly staff

name: Becky Coleman
text: Fun time playing bingo.. love seeing Sam

name: Dana Garman
text: The absolute best place to listen to incredible live music! Great talent 7 nights a week! I seek out live music in every state i visit, which is quite an extensive list of places. Flora-Bama is still my favorite!

name: C K
text: We visited this restaurant/bar on July 29, 2019 after hearing recommendations from several others who had been there.   We were told there was a 1 and a half hour wait, which we were fine with because the location is pleasant enough to just sit, have a drink and look at the water.  It ended up taking about 2 hours to get seated.  The kitchen is a food trailer in the back of the property, where there is lots of sand and open sea air (which I thought was a little odd).  While waiting to be seated we sat and watched the waiters and waitresses come out and smoke cigarettes at the kitchen trailer while checking on their customers food.  I even saw one waiter take a plate of food into the restaurant while smoking his cigarette at the same time.  Once seated we waited 45 minutes for our food, and the food was absolutely horrible.  8 of us ate, no one liked the food other than my 7 year old whose kid's fried shrimp seemed to be pretty good.  I had the chicken strips. . . $15 for 5 tiny pieces of chicken that tasted like they were fried in the same grease as the fish (see attached picture).  My advice is drive a half mile past this restaurant to take pictures at the actual Florida/Alabama state line. . . then go somewhere else to have a decent meal and stay away from this tourist trap.

name: Bibiana Phillips
text: Historic, weird, fun, crazy fun place. I hope they are there another 100 years!!

name: Karen Stamps
text: Great casual food & atmosphere. On the beach. Good fun!!!

name: John Walling
text: Great atmosphere... good eats..on the ocean.. just feels like old school gulf entertainment

name: Leea Reno
text: One of the best places great food and a little  something for everyone's likes.

name: Jessica Pfoff
text: This was our 3rd trip the Orange Beach/Gulf Shores area and Flora-Bama is our favorite place to go!! We love everything about it. The food is AMAZING, the drinks and atmosphere just top it all off. We were there for my 21st birthday and it was a great night seeing Justin Moore and Bruce Smelley. We ended up at Flora-Bama 3 out of the 5 days we were in the area. Highly recommend!!

resp.text: Thanks so much for your kind words! We hope to have you back on the line soon!

name: Craig Barber
text: Awesome!!!! Insanely fun! A very must see place!! Bands all great!!

name: Margaret Higgins
text: Had amazing Shrimp tacos with our wonderful server Brandon! Definitely a family favorite:)

name: Chelsea Stephens
text: I get it now - why people are obsessed with this bar! It was FANTASTIC. While a little sketchy with COVID, as long as you’re careful and don’t go at peak times, you should be fine. I ordered the classic Bushwacker and shrimp tacos... hello!! SO GOOD!!! Both far exceeded my expectations.

name: Mikki Hess
text: My first time there n we enjoyed all the different little bars easy to get a drink n enjoyed all the different music.

name: Scott Laisney
text: Half florida, half alabama. Not a red neck? Stay on your side!!!

name: Karly Stevens
text: Fun lively bar. Great live music. Excellent drink specials.

name: Matthew Green
text: I had a great time. Multiple rooms with multiple bands. If there's a song you do not like, head to another room and you'll be dancing again in no time. Drinks were all great. I had the key lime drink and hurricane which were both delicious. Awesome crowd. I will go again in the future.

name: Kellie McLaughlin
text: Always love to visit this place when we are in town.  Can't wait to come when they ha e live shows

name: Rebecca Bailey
text: Awesome time painting all the little kids at the Easter Egg Hunt...Great job Flora Bama

name: Mark Pippin
text: Good food, drink and games for the kiddos while the adults relax.

name: AJ Witbro
text:
No.  Don’t do it.

Sure, Go for drinks; don’t bother eating there.    2 hour wait, 90 minute wait to get cold food.  .. on a Wednesday.

resp.text: Hey AJ...thank you so much for the feedback. It's our only way to try and improve the overall guest experience. Also, thank you for your business. The entire area has had a really difficult time finding staff across the board and we also have been short staffed, so we apologize for your long wait. We hope to be fully ramped up soon and certainly hope you will return to see us so we can get you some quick delicious food. Our sincerest apologies on your wait. We look forward to being able to serve you again in the future.

name: Marie Weimer
text: This place is great! So many different venues in one place!

name: Bill Anderson
text: An experience for sure.  Very accurate pours (read: they're not giving you a single extra drop of alcohol in your mixed drink), so if you're used to generous bartenders you might be disappointed.  Three stages, 10 bars.

name: Jill Fisher
text: Outdoor dining was ok...people at next table provided us with cigarette smoke n foul language. This was a family lunch for us...not a night out. Never go there again

resp.text: Thank you for dining with us Jill! We apologize that the other customers made the experience a little less than desirable. We have a lot of dining options with our two sit down restaurants across the street, Flora-Bama Yacht Club and Flora-Bama Ole River Grill and hope that you will come back and see us at one of those to dine with your family.

name: Jason Jones
text: The place was amazing. The staff was great and the views never stop. The place is a sprawling complex that we only explored superficially.  We ate on the river side of the complex and when we asked what was on the other side of the road our server answered, “Everything.”  That was too much for this trip so we decided to leave that for our next visit.  Yet before leaving we were encouraged to write on anything but the tables to commemorate our visit. They even supplied the permanent markers. If you visit make sure to leave plenty of time for traffic; it’s worth it.

name: Ed Podgorski
text: Ok place. Good entertainment.  No table service. I imagine this place hops at night.

name: Barb Wilson
text: Gretchen did an amazing job! friendly and very helpful!

name: Sammy Gately
text: Great food at the yacht club and awesome entertainment across the street at the package and lounge.

name: Lynn Murphy
text: Great fun and great music and drinks.  This is a must see and do when you visit this part of your vacation travels to the Florida/Alabama line.  Xxoo

name: Gary Dzurny
text: One of my favorite bars... whups,  Restaurants!  Oysters & Bushwackers - what a combination.

name: Chalea Chapman
text: During the day we went it was quieter but at night I'm sure it would be a whole different crowd. I recommend the flora-bama jama if you like fruity drinks.

name: Danielle Dombrock
text: Fun place for kids and adults. Bingo, bands, playing at the beach. Bushwaker was fun to try

name: James Ford
text: Nice get away place on the beach not to far to walk

name: Ralph Bishop Jr
text: A very cool place for couples to families. They have their family time and their adult time. Live music lots of events. The whole surrounding area of gulf shores, orange beach, destin and Pensacola have great things and places to do but if your in the area Flora-Bama is a must visit.

name: Yony Escalante
text: Brandon Treated us so well! Always made sure we were taken care with anything we needed

resp.text: Thanks so much for these kind words! We'll be sure to pass them along to Brandon!

name: Christi Miller
text: I lived in Pensacola when Florabama was a tiny shack. My parents still live on Perdido Key so I've been able to see the enormous growth over the years. Even with the publicity and the tourism, the staff is still awesome. One of my favorite places on earth.

name: Margarita Ibbott (DownshiftingPRO)
text:
Why 5 stars? Because it is like no other bar that I've been to. It has great live music, fantastic people watching, amazing drinks - do not leave without trying a bushwacker - and Sunday church service to cleanse your sins away.

I love that there is graffiti everywhere and you can leave your mark. You can also see all the bars thrown up to the rafters. Truly a unique experience.

name: Mark “Lenny” bolden
text: Really cool piece of history, cool loung, grill , and beach !

name: Dale Stemen
text: Good atmosphere, cold drinks, good music, on the beach and wasn't hot yet..

name: Scott Smales
text: Always a great time at the Flora-Bama! Delicious drinks, great small bites,  and of course the best spot for luve music!!!

name: Barbara King
text:
Always great! Bingo and live music at 2 pm....
Everyone should visit if in the area.

name: carly biggs
text:
Place was amazing and huge.  😁
Had a great beach view where you could walk out and the food was good.

resp.text: Hey Carly! We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your time at Flora-Bama! We hope to have you back on the line soon!

name: Deborah Kotfinn
text: What an awesome experience on my first meal and visit to orange beach! Wendy was our server and she was an absolute sweetheart! We had fried oyster po boys , shrimp po boys, bienville oysters. Excellent food, excellent service

resp.text: Thank you so much for these kind words! We hope to have you back on the line soon!

name: Jason Beard
text: Such a dive bar.... it's GREAT!! It can get a little crowded though.

name: Todd Snyder
text: I loved this tattered shack! As a parrot head I had to check out the bamabreeze. I had Cajun oysters and a keylime colada. Both were excellent. Great gift shop.  The staff was happy smiling and friendly. I for sure wanna go back to this place. The place wreaked of history and booze. Awesome!

resp.text: Hey Todd! We are so glad to hear you had a great time at Flora-Bama! We hope to have you back on the line soon!

name: Shaina Zelhart
text: Amazing food and our waitress BB was also amazing

name: Jason Cunningham
text: Super friendly and helpful on getting me drunk on the beach in a lawn chair without having to move.

name: Tanya Dews (gypzee)
text: New to the city, found this place for potluck Thanksgiving. Best idea all year

name: gina nease
text: Grr chin was the best sever ! Happy and very good at suggesting the best food to try. She also give us the details of the current events!!!

name: Martha Dodge
text: Had a wonderful time had a bushwacker and it really bushwhacked you 😂

name: Joe Steiger (Tiger)
text: Great place, great food!

name: Dorma Hutcheson
text: Always a fun time.  Glad to be back on the coast!

name: dannys girl
text: The beach side was awesome!! However.... the food from the restaurant on the other side of the road made me puke my guts out,it used to be better,and when we ordered the waitress kept saying ooh that was a joke,was that a joke, and all we did was tell her our order

resp.text: Hey! I am so sorry to hear that you did not have a pleasant experience with our restaurants. Could you send more information about which restaurant you dined at and what you ordered to mary@florabama.com? We strive to make sure each guest enjoys their time, so I'm sorry to hear that you did not. We hope to have you back soon!

name: Ryan Hard
text: Great drinks for a reasonable price, the oysters were delicious.

name: D “Deeg” J
text:
Awesome place
Great music
Nice and friendly people

name: Steve Low
text: A little further...for me...than Pensacola Beach, but with the bridge out, best alternative for a beach bar. Got there much earlier today than most people...had lunch and was impressed with the same friendly staff as always. My experience has been the nightlife mostly... great place for a night out!

name: Erica Ecklar
text: Staff was wonderful! Food was absolutely good.

name: Adam Sorrell
text: Save your money and go to any other restaurant. Sat down with a family of 7 and it took 1 hour and 10 minutes to get our food. When the food arrived 5 of the 7 dishes were cold. Sent 2 of them back and 20 minutes later they returned with the same plate that had been microwaved. This place is a bar, not a restaurant.

resp.text: Hey Adam, thank you for choosing to come to our establishment. We apologize for the slow service. We have certainly struggled with staffing like a lot of businesses have in the area. We will address this with our team and make sure it is improved quickly. We hope that you can give us another opportunity to show you a great time. If you could email me some more information at jenifer@florabama.com that would be great for me to get some more details to address it properly. Thanks again for your business.

name: Dave Ingalls
text: Gretchen was amazing.  Did a outstanding job😀

name: Vincent Harigel
text: A great place to see. I have heard about it but never been there till recently. I will visit agaIn.

name: Colleen Cohan Zampanti
text: Wonderful place to get the full experience. Nice people

name: Maliha Clements
text: Super crowded but a good time for people without kiddos in my opinion!😁

name: Melissa Geister

Burgers are fabulous!
Beach side entertainment was excellent!🇺🇲😎

My 1st time back in 32 years! Wow! It most definitely has changed!😂 A bit LARGER, too.

resp.text: We are so glad you enjoyed your time here! We hope to have you back on the line soon!

name: Joshua Chase

name: Denise Guile

text: Rude server and worst oysters I’ve ever eaten. Setting and lights were the only thing going for it.

resp.text: Hey George! Im so sorry that you did not have a pleasant experience with us. Feel free to email any feedback you have to mary@florabama.com. We hope to have you back soon!

name: Astrid Cox
text: Dirty place. Too much people, no place to sit. Not a good place to go with kids and eat something. Sad!

resp.text: Hey Astrid! Thank you for choosing to spend your time with us. We apologize that your time with us was less than what you expected. We have a cleaning crew that cleans the entire bar every morning prior to opening, so we will address this with that team to make sure they are doing a thorough job like they should, so thank you for the feedback. We hope you'll come back to see us again. We also have two sit down restaurants across the street, Flora-Bama Yacht Club and Flora-Bama Ole River Grill which are very family friendly and an excellent environment for kids to be able to run around and enjoy a meal.

name: Karen B
text: Had a really nice time! Waitress was wonderful, my food was delicious, and the sunset was perfect!

name: Mark Pearson
text:
No words to describe how much fun this place is. I am from St. Louis and I wish we had one. Lol
Great services in all areas too

name: violet reese
text: Very disappointing. The servers and bartenders were on there phones texting and talking about what was on Facebook instead of serving us. We tried to order drinks and food but not one server was willing to offer help. The place was not busy at all- just a bunch of coworkers walking around chit chatting with each other instead of serving customers. I'm a customer who is known for leaving $100 tips too. Another couple has left as well after trying to get a servers attention to order. I understand it's slow and not busy season but there are still customers like us and the other couple that left who were ready to spend our money there. Unfortunately we had to leave since the servers were too busy with looking at their cell phones. - so disappointing.

resp.text:
Hey Violet!

We are so sorry you did not have a good experience! We'd love to get more information on what happened. If you could, please email mary@florabama.com with more details. We hope to hear from you soon! Thanks!

name: Jack Harris
text: Fun place. Good music, excellent drinks and the beach is wonderful.

name: Bruce Pajak
text: Great place to come have great food, drinks, enjoy great live entertainment with friends. My friend's brought me here to check it out when visiting them, being locals they get come here often. It definitely is a lot of fun people enjoying themselves good music. I will definitely come back again when I visit my brother as well. I definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a good place come and enjoy a good time out with friends.

name: Plytinum
text: Good food, soups a banger. Pretty cool scenery too, you can write all over the place.

name: Joscyln Mohr
text: Definitely a fun spot, day or night. Drinks, a walk on the beach, listening to live music, or a bite to eat. Fun to be had by all! We will be back!

name: A Rich
text: Cool place. Definitely worth a stop!

name: Burt Athey
text: Employees or family to me. My prayers go out to them for showing us a beautiful place in Paradise.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Burt!!

name: David NELSON

name: Juan Martinez
text: This restaurant has no idea of what service is all about ,we waited 3 hours to be seated and and an extra hour to be served.This happened on a Tuesday can you imagine going on the weekend .They run out of food and silverware  and still they continue taking customers, worst experience  ever. The food is not worth eaiting that long for.

resp.text: Hey Juan! Would you email more information about your experience with us to mary@florabama.com? We apologize that you did not have the best experience with us and would love feedback on how to improve!

name: Donald Smith
text: Awsome bar great local bands

name: Wayne Taylor
text: Cant say enough good things. Music was GREAT.

name: Delores Gamiere
text: Always a fun place to have a drink on the beach.

name: Lori Hinkley
text: Great fun. Even got free customer appreciation food and drink.

name: Daniel Van Orden
text: Located on the beach, this is a world known hangout for food and specialty drinks. Limited food menu but great tasting.  We ate the raw oysters, shrimp and chicken fingers baskets. Ashley did a wonderful job of taking care of our drink needs. Parking mostly across street but they have well controlled cross walk that stops traffic.  Social distance, hand sanitizer and masks strongly encouraged per FL & AL governor's orders.

name: Beth Witt
text: Fun, great music and very friendly staff

name: Lisa Camp
text: Rockin' wild fun, great food, and plenty of room for dancing!

name: Ann Yarbrough
text: Beautiful old bar on a beautiful beach! Fun good music food people atmosphere! Got it!?

name: Roads Traveled Photography
text:
Flora-Bama, the Florida and Alabama border is k own for the party to party!
It’s a great place to visit. Lots of great restaurants, shopping and gorgeous beaches.
Be prepared for a LOT of crowed during bust seasons

name: Makayla Bieker
text: Cool place to go with friends or even family. Several different things going on here. Music. Live bands. Dancing. Pool table. Hockey. Outside access. Food. 10/10 recommend

name: Art Jacobs
text: Wow. My first time  and it was awesome . I will  return.

name: Angie Queen
text: Only thing masks aren't required and social distancing is not observed.  If that makes you uncomfortable then you should not go here.

name: Jeremy Drost
text:
Flora-Bama!
Nuff Said!

name: Matthew Lyons
text: Always a good time. Family friendly before 5:30. Great place for a snack, beer and let the kids run around a bit. Open air options along with inside stages.

name: Natalie Ezell
text: The staff is always friendly and the food is great! Where else can you get great music and a killer Bushwacker while soaking up the sun on a white sandy beache? Love this place!

name: cary edwards
text: Great location and always good music very fun place

name: Lenny L
text: My 3rd favorite place on the planet.. Outstanding drinks/ music/ service

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words Lenny! We are gonna do our best to work our way up to number 1 on your list :).

name: John democker
text: Really a one of a kind establishment, 3 stories of live music and multiple bars inside, as well as an oyster bar

name: Deana Hall
text: Great atmosphere, friendly staff and good food.

name: Kathy Martin
text: We always have a good time at the Flora-Bama.  We go there often.  It is a MUST STOP when on the coast.

resp.text: Kathy, we thank you for your rating! Come back and see us again soon :)

name: Kacie Logan
text: Bit of a tourist trap but still fun

name: brent watts
text: Good food friendly people fun atmosphere

name: mike curry
text: Best char grilled oysters I have ever had !!!

name: Maggie Marchbanks
text: They have the best burgers and our server Brandon was great!

name: Kenneth Gordon
text:
We love this place, live across the water on the island and we even go to church here on Sunday morning.

If you are near OB, this is a must stop.  And dont forget, CHURCH ON SUNDAY.  Come as you are, we dont care.

name: Tonya Medina
text: Church on Sundays. Walk out back to the water its absolutely relaxing. Chairs and music make the day happy. Cold drinks and food available right on the gulf come see the sunsets at Flora Bama.

name: Patty Sue (Curious Traveler)
text: Beautiful Lounge, great food, friendly people, right on the beach

name: Shane Hric
text: This is a fun tourist place. Flora Bama has the lounge bar, Ole River Grille, and Yacht Club! The cool thing is the Florida and Alabama State line where you can pose for pictures! The customer service on the second floor of the lounge was excellent with Stephanie the bar tender. The customer service at the souvenir shop was so so. The rest was fun to check out along the bay shore with boaters hanging out! Each place had live music, so it was fun all around!

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking time to let us know about your recent visit to the Flora-Bama, we're so happy to hear you had a large time! We love that you checked out what all of our properties have to offer, so much to see and do around here! We sure hope to have you back again soon, next time you're in the area... stay safe & take care, friend!

name: Sophie Snyder
text: Loved the hush puppies, the oysters were great, and loved the music.

name: Monty Blandford
text: Classis dive bar.....but what a place. Not to be missed.

name: Tracy Herrmann
text: Always fun from the gift shop to the servers & bartenders. Love the live music!

name: Christopher McCarthy
text: What a blast! Live music,  fun crowd. I will be back.

name: Gary Fehlhaber
text: Great service, nice to see a place open for fun.

name: Brandon Franklin
text: First time there and we absolutely enjoyed ourselves.. the live music tonight was amazing! I requested the song 'Simple Man' and was completely impressed by the way it was done. The staff was very friendly and considerate as well. 👍🏾👍🏾

name: Josh Anderson
text: Great food! Good vibes and drinks.

name: Toney Grim
text: I have been coming to the Flora-Bama for years and years and years. It is consistently the one place on the Gulf coast that ALWAYS has great music, good food and a true southern atmosphere of hospitality, Courteous people and beautiful scenery. If you are looking to relax and refuel while looking upon some of the best beach side days or nights in the world, this is the place. I hope to see you and your smiling faces next time!

name: rob hammond
text: Good beach atmosphere, good food, good entertainment. 👍

name: Butch Brown
text: Great food and a great Beach 15 feet away

name: Linda Trautman
text: Classic and historical! The dueling pianos were awesome, drinks reasonably priced and courteous staff. I'll be back!

name: Suzanne Chapman
text: It was Awesome. I love the shrimp basket and the fries with bacon and cheese. The staff was wonderful. I had a small medical situation and they took wonderful care of me. Will be returning soon.

name: Brian Brucher
text:
Elevator was outta order and the website needs to be updated.
Otherwise the Bushwhacker was awesome.

resp.text: Hey Brian! Thank you for your review. We had a bad rain storm come through last week that got water in the elevator and we are working to get it fixed as soon as possible. We apologize for the inconvenience. It should be up and running soon. Glad you enjoyed our delicious house cocktail. We hope to see you again soon.

name: Lynn Private
text: A blast!  So much to see and enjoy here.  Drinks are amazing.

name: Stan Reese
text: Somewhat clean and peaceful. Really small but that was good with only one other dog there.

name: J Cee
text:
A must go for vacationers, it wasn't too crowded when we stopped by on a Thursday night. I can imagine this place is shoulder to shoulder packed on weekends and holidays.

Took a little to navigate and find our favorite place. Loved the piano bar the most! Food was okay, I had the fried fritters and my husband had the fish wrap. Cocktails were delightful and had a great happy hour special.

Kids not allowed after 6pm.

name: Ricky Cook
text: Laid back Great place for a beer.

name: Cee Pee
text: Great food and atmosphere. Very friendly and helpful employees.

resp.text: Hey Cee Pee! We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your stay! We hope to have you back soon!

name: Melissa McClure
text: Great concert! Taylor Hicks !

name: Tommy Metcalfe
text: Awesome palce..everyone should go there at least once.

name: Andrew Bellamy
text: Such a great place to go. We went back three times the week we were on vacation. The place has lots of different bands playing. It was fun to look around. Drinks and food were amazing. Family fun during the day. Great night life.

name: Eric Allan
text: I can definitely say I've never been anywhere quite like this. The novelty of being on the state line is of course a big draw, but the overall atmosphere is incomparable. Multiple areas exist to get food and drinks...no shortage of pub grub and seafood favorites, plus great drinks at reasonable prices. Multiple levels and areas of seating also provide great variety, whether you want to enjoy the sun at the lower rail, watch the waves from the upper deck, or stay dry inside. Probably the most outlandish and fascinatingly fun aspect is literally every portion of wall, railing, sign, door and anything else you can think of, is covered with names of patrons. Being at a place that actually encourages you to write on the building is pretty neat. Further still, there's often lives music, and the staff is laid-back and fun.

name: Mike Crumly
text: Good food.  A little pricey on drinks but they were good.

name: Adam Lawson
text: Holy guacamole! There's like a dozen freaking bars in one!!!! Decent drink prices and soooo many people!!!!

resp.text: Hey Adam! Thank you for your kind words! We hope to have you back on the line soon!

name: Gary Temple
text: Really enjoyed this landmark eating and drinking establishment!  Oyesters and nachos were great and the frozen cocktails went down too easy. Visitor must-see and bring your own sharpie!

name: Odell P. Jr
text: Great drinks, live music and fun fun fun atmosphere, a must visit

name: Danny Roach
text: My favorite place..always a good time at the florbama..

name: Donny Beckham
text: If you go here and wear a mask you'll get threatened so if I could leave a 0 star review I would. DO NOT GO TO THIS ESTABLISHMENT.

resp.text: Hey Donny, thank you for the feedback. This is certainly not how we want our customers to be treated. While we follow the Executive Orders given by the Governor of Florida which currently has no mask mandate, we want any customer to do whatever makes them feel comfortable and safe. We also have masks available in the gift shop for anyone who would like one. We apologize if you were treated any other way. I would love some more information regarding the staff and the situation so we can address it with them directly. Please email me at jenifer@florabama.com

name: Jenny Tackett
text: Have to have a Bushwhacker!  The beach is beautiful and even in January playing in the water was fun!

name: Keith Butler
text: I live an hour away and have never had a bad time there. Awesome place.

name: Sean imp
text: Nice service and good drinks. but an absolute COVID hot spot, walked in on the venue of about 100 people all grouped together and grinding on each underneath what I assume are sweaty used bras.

name: Dana Brown Weaver
text: My favorite place on the planet. The food is good. The people are amazing. Can't beat the atmosphere.

name: Vanda Peppers
text: Great place to hear music.

name: David Barnard
text: Even during Covid Flora Bama is an experience for any true music fan, especially a Country fan. Awesome detour

name: TW
text: What a awesome place. It's a must visit. Try the Bushwhacker it's a chocolate frosty with a kick. Very friendly staff and patrons.

name: Shane Adams
text: Had a excellent time roll tide

name: Anthony Guillen
text: The service was great. Once you get done eating or drinking a cold one. You can walk down to the beach and have a relaxing time.

name: KCCO Trophy
text: Bartender Stephanie was AWESOME! Very polite and we had a Great time.

name: BeaMo
text: ALWAYS A GOOD TIME. The gift shop is my favorite ! 😍 great drinks and views !

name: Katie Potts
text: Best drinks, best live music, wish there was more seafood like crabs or lobster but it’s more of a casual place. They have church on Sundays and an outside bar. We went twice in five days and I will defiantly go back next time!!!

name: Tree Techniques
text: Music, food, bra room, lotto well id say you can't go wrong. Will go again

name: Bob Morrison
text: Most tender Chicken Nachos ever

name: Nathan Harris
text: Nobody was wearing a mask. Over 40,000 people have died from Covid in Florida and Alabama and nobody was wearing a freaking mask.

resp.text: Hey Nathan! Thank you for giving us some feedback. We operate out of Florida and follow the executive orders given by the Governor of Florida. Currently, neither Florida or Alabama have any mask mandates. We encourage anyone who wants to wear a mask to do so, and even have them in our gift shop readily available to anyone who wants one, but we do not require it per the mandates of both of the states executive orders. We do hope you will come back to see us in the future and hope you still enjoyed your time while you were with us.

name: Christy Elrod
text: Wonderful time wonderful people. Favorite was Scott. Loved every song !!!! Can't wait to go back !!!!

name: Chuck Smith
text: Always great place to hear good music

name: Joe Hause
text: Awesome place. A little bit for everyone.

name: milo smith
text: The live music is a real treat, you sit in the main stage & there is no cover charge, you get great service & you get to listen to great music!

name: Da La
text: Food was decent but the prices were extremely high

name: Meishka Davis
text: Laid back family friendly atmosphere with lots of different things to do for the whole family. There are several drinking and dining options from amazing seafood dishes to other meat or vegetarian choices on the menu. The beach is just steps away to get sunbaked, go swimming or both. This is a great place to check out that will definitely be worth your time, shoes optional! Check out the gift shop on your way in or out, lots of great finds.

name: Alicia Hubert
text: Nice place for live music and drinks

name: Sara Nelson
text: Great atmosphere! Definitely try the oysters!!

name: Erin Adkinson
text: A fun place to eat and then enjoy the beach. You can park there for free and use there beach access. No coolers allowed, but you can just pop back into the bar for a drink and they have water stations as well. And, you can rent loungers on the beach through a seperate company for $35. Yes please! And thank you!

name: Steven Rohland
text: Highly entertaining, lots to see and a great experience. Several bars in one building, good live music. Nice gift shop.

name: Robert Reak
text: Lots of fun. Can't wait to go back!

name: Kitty
text: Such a fun place, great music, drinks are good

name: Michael Hollier
text: Definitely will search your bags an check you with a metal detector before you go in. Food was great an grab a bushwhacker drink while you wait.

resp.text: Thanks for taking time to let us know about your recent visit, we hope ya'll had a great time and we look forward to seeing you all again soon!

name: Greg Lawson
text: Fun place.  Food is good.  Always great entertainment.

name: Donel Baswell
text: Good live music and decent bushwackers.

name: Mark Mehill
text: The Godfather of beach bars.  Live entertainment, multiple bars overlooking the gulf and one hell of a liquor dispensing system

name: Kyle Hanson
text: I’ve been here several times and I’ve never had a bad time. The recent Riley Green concert was a hit! The only downsides were the long lines to get in and for the drinks. The grade A live entertainment continued for the rest of the night after the main concert. Even on off nights they have great acts. It’s hard not to have a good time here if you like country and rock music.

name: Leslie Neal-Richardson
text: Great place to chill and enjoy the local entertainment. The oysters are the bomb along with a bushwacker.

name: Rick Rohne
text: Bad service today.  Normally great service in the summer

name: Zack Deimel
text: My new favorite place to eat at! Good drinks, awesome food, and friendly staff.

name: Dianna Stargel (Fancy Paws)
text: Food was good, service was great. The view and atmosphere were great.

name: Andrew Schutt
text: Super unique place! Love the bushwhackers - I always look forward to getting one when I’m down south. The entertainment here is also superb. We saw dueling pianos on this particular occasion - quite a riot! If you’re in the area, ya gotta stop by here!

name: Jennette Jenkins
text: Neat little place to check out

name: eaglewarrior 35
text: We had a great time. Our son (11) fished and our dog Princess Fiona was welcomed as one of us. Our bartender was amazing. Great people good food wonderful time

name: Karen Lynch
text: There is nothing like the Flora-Bama on the gulf coast!  Laid back.  Sand.  Music.   It never disappoints.

name: Sound Buryer Music
text: This place was awesome! Lots of energy!

name: Marissa Colombo
text: Something for everyone! The bar itself is nothing to write home about. It is a dive but it’s right on the water down has beautiful views. Staff and guests are all friendly. Children are welcome and dogs are welcome too across the street. Great music and cheap drinks! Overall a good vibe

name: Rhett Oselette
text: Definitely worth checking out if in the area.

name: Nikki Krachinski
text: Amazing place....good food, great people, awesome live band!!!

resp.text: Hey Nikki! We are so glad you enjoyed your time here! We hope to have you back on the line soon!

name: John Matthews
text: Bars are filthy but I guess to be expected since this is college hangouts.  Food not that great but shrimp tacos were good.

name: Jeremiah Rust
text: Nice place to hang out, eat and drink.  Three stages, two have decent dance floors.  Plenty of tables and whatnot to eat or just hangout and drink.  Parking is a serious consideration if you are showing up after dinner.  Servers and bar tenders are very nice and friendly with fast service!

name: Jeff Richardson
text: Mullet Toss is the best time to come!

name: Bryan Powell
text: A wood shack with additions... Cool history and patrons leave their own mark on any free space not already autographed.  With a Chesney song endorsement, it's become a gold mine.

name: Mark Paladino
text: Great place to go with an assortment of bars and music venues. Friendly people !

name: Thea Pate
text: Don't go on a Wednesday.  Don't order the oysters. Don't expect much. Live music.... the only appeal.

resp.text: Hey Thea! Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your time at Flora-Bama. I would love some more feedback about what we can improve on for Wednesdays and more about your experience. Feel free to email me at jenifer@florabama.com.

name: Deborah & Leroy Lawrence
text: As always...a great time was had by all! Flora-Bama rocks!

name: Ronald Roark
text: We had a great time at Flora-Bama drinking and listening to music

name: Halle Grogan
text: Jamie was the absolute best!!! She was extremely busy but still made time for our table and our needs. She had a smile on her face the entire time and made us feel so welcome! We are from TN but will definitely be back to see her!!

name: Lara Polk
text: Awesome location definitely a place to check out.

name: Corey Kolke
text: Another great weekend here!

name: D. Ramirez-Porter
text: Enjoyed Sunday Church service there!

name: Nelson Vaught
text: We were there all afternoon and started to leave and decided to take a restroom break before we left and the hags at the door tried to charge us a cover. We went on to the bathroom regardless of them. Poor service on their behalf!

name: Alexandra Blalock
text: We had a blast here for two nights of our vacation! Great food and drinks. It was busy but Jamie always made sure we were taken care of. She was amazing! Will definitely be coming back.

name: Anon amoose
text: The line was incredibly long. We waited for over 30 mins, and gave up. At that rate it would have taken over 3 hours to get in the door.

name: Sherry Tromotola
text: Got Married on the beach at Flora-Bama on July 11th,  2020.  Celebrated with friends and family. Entertainment was an old friend JJ Hawkins! Awesome! Thank you Flora-Bama!

resp.text: CONGRATULATIONS!!!! We're so happy to hear everything went well!!! I know that probably made J's day too, knowing he could be a part of something so special with his friends :) Thank you so much for taking time to reach out, and if you could - send me your address to my email below! We'd love to send a little happy to our 2020 Flora-Bama newly weds! My name is Blakeli Calvert, I'm a marketing manager for the Flora-Bama properties, & my email is blakeli@florabama.com. Big hugs to ya'll and looking forward to hearing from you soon!

name: Dick Burgman
text: Nothing like it.  Gift shop,  3 or 4 bar.  Live music,  views of the gulf from the second floor.  Was worth the little extra drive.  Don't miss it

name: Jeff Roach
text: Some people you cannot give authority to and the afternoon/evening manager is one of those people. Such a disappointment after waiting so long to see this historical venue. I wish I never gone there. It was like meeting one of your favorite celebrities than being disappointed in their behavior.

resp.text: Hey Jeff! I am so sorry to hear you did not enjoy your time here at Flora-Bama. Could you email more information about your experience here to mary@florabama.com? We strive to make sure that each of our guests have a great time with us, so I apologize that you did not. We hope to have you back on the line soon!

name: The Yoga Chick
text:
A cool spot that’s very popular. We’ve driven past here multiple times and decided to stop today. The staff is super friendly and there is certainly a unique decor. I found that the drinks were a bit on the weak side but they all come out of the sprayer. There is also live music and church services.

My husband loves it here because he’s into the dive bar atmosphere. I would recommend that you stop in for a drink.

name: Art Jacobs
text: Wow. My first time  and it was awesome . I will  return.

name: Josh Anderson
text: Great food! Good vibes and drinks.

name: Toney Grim
text: I have been coming to the Flora-Bama for years and years and years. It is consistently the one place on the Gulf coast that ALWAYS has great music, good food and a true southern atmosphere of hospitality, Courteous people and beautiful scenery. If you are looking to relax and refuel while looking upon some of the best beach side days or nights in the world, this is the place. I hope to see you and your smiling faces next time!

name: Dara Miller Price
text: Great place for fun and music.  Nice people and they make a great bushwhacker.  We had a blast and bought a hat and T-shirt.  Lol.

name: Ayla Sharii
text: I've been all over the country, and I think this was the weirdest group of people I've ever seen all meshed together. There was an Astin Martin parked next to a  jacked up pick-up truck, people who looked like they have a trust fund next to half naked guys with mullets. There was live music, beach access, and a connected restuarant area across the street. The place is HUGE. You're allowed to take your alcohol with you between locations. EVERYTHING has been tagged. If nothing else, it's definitely worth going to just for the experience

name: Shane Hric
text: This is a fun tourist place. Flora Bama has the lounge bar, Ole River Grille, and Yacht Club! The cool thing is the Florida and Alabama State line where you can pose for pictures! The customer service on the second floor of the lounge was excellent with Stephanie the bar tender. The customer service at the souvenir shop was so so. The rest was fun to check out along the bay shore with boaters hanging out! Each place had live music, so it was fun all around!

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking time to let us know about your recent visit to the Flora-Bama, we're so happy to hear you had a large time! We love that you checked out what all of our properties have to offer, so much to see and do around here! We sure hope to have you back again soon, next time you're in the area... stay safe & take care, friend!

name: Joe Spadea
text: It's Flora-Bama! Great music in a very good venue! Well worth a stop.

name: Deana Hall
text: Great atmosphere, friendly staff and good food.

name: Suzanne Chapman
text: It was Awesome. I love the shrimp basket and the fries with bacon and cheese. The staff was wonderful. I had a small medical situation and they took wonderful care of me. Will be returning soon.

name: brent watts
text: Good food friendly people fun atmosphere

name: danny barbig
text: The food made me throw up and the waitress seemed very ditsy   other than that the other side was very enjoyable

resp.text: Hey Danny! I'm so sorry to hear that you did not have a pleasant experience with the food. Could you send more information about what you ordered to mary@florabama.com? We strive to make sure each guest enjoys their time, so I apologize you didn't have the best experience. We hope to have you back soon!

name: Missy “JB” Puppy
text: Egg dash was great, had activity stations for kids set up inside too. The Easter bunny skydiving and parachute landing on the beach in front of the kids was fantastic! My eight year old had a blast!

resp.text: So happy you all enjoyed our Easter Egg Hunt & Kids Fun Day! It was such beautiful day for it and we're already looking forward to next year!

name: Miss Molly
text: Awesome place. Right on the Florida, Alabama line. Bushwacker drinks are amazing! Something like 22 bars in all. Can't wait to go back. Cute gift shop also.

name: Les Howard
text:
One of my all time favorites.
I've been going here since the 1980's.
Fun place,  music ( live daily) as well as food and drink.
The beach overlooks are great.
Short boardwalk to the beach.
Try the world famous bushwacker,  you won't be disappointed.

name: Mary Kaye Washo
text: Great place to watch the sunset and have a cocktail🍹

name: Bonnie Meyerink
text: Had an amazing time!! Beautiful bride getting married on the beach! We will be back!

resp.text: Hey there!  Thanks for letting us know about your recent visit. We're so glad you had a large time! That was the son of one of our owners you saw tying the knot on the beach.. it was such a beautiful evening!  Hope to see ya back again soon :)

name: DONDREA Thompson
text: Music and fun! Enjoyed the experience!

name: Bunny Meadows
text: Beautiful sunrise Easter service on the Gulf!

name: Lauri D. Bridgen
text: Stopped in to buy shirts. Couldn’t stay for food or drinks. Had pets in the car, so my friend and I took turns running in real fast. Will stop again on the next trip. Glad I got to see it in person even if for only a few minutes.

name: papichulo110029
text:
Hyped up eatery; stale/dry fries, unpeeled shrimp with an excessive amount of seasoning which makes peeling them messy, and NOT a smoke free establishment (really, in 2019?).
Biker (Harley Davidson/cruiser) bar atmosphere

Maybe the nightclub aura is better.

Pros:
ok view of beach
Walk through access to the beach (must walk through entire establishment to get to the beach.

name: Justin Stroud
text: Greatest place fo all time

name: Scot Abel
text: Always a great place to visit. We had lunch across the street at their yacht club, stopped here for a few drinks. Promptly seated on the top, ocean-side area with an awesome view and cooling winds. Superb, attentive service.

name: Pam Collier
text: Always a favorite spot in the afternoon with the kiddos along. Enjoyed cold beers and great oysters, raw and cooked 4 ways.  Checked off a bucket list item for a friend and walked on the beautiful beach front.  Saw some Moon jelly fish.

name: Mandy French
text: Kids and adults alike loved it! We played bingo and endured a bushwhacker. I would recommend a bushwhacker from any other place on the coast before florabama lol but the whole place is such a fun experience and the cheese fries are killer!

name: Peter Ho
text: Yee yee!

name: Jacky White
text: Great atmosphere and very friendly staff

name: CantBeAfraid ToTry
text: Good  food but was out of oysters.  I understand but still disappointed.  Live music always good.

name: Nickie Mullins
text: GREAT PLACE to visit ... wanting to return soon 😁😁

name: Murph
text: Multiple bars on both sides of the border and riverside and Gulf side on the beach. Good food and live music. Make sure you sign the walls!

name: Jake
text: If you are in the mood for some really good raw oysters then this is the place. Meshes really good with beer. #merica

name: Robert Crouch
text: If you cannot have fun here then you are dead.

name: Jacob Schaffer
text: Ultimately it's the atmosphere that sells it. It you're coming for a good time with the intent for that fun to be supplemented by a little thing called booze, this is your place. Honestly, the food is subpar, but it's good enough for the atmosphere. I don't drink, but I enjoyed the drunkness surrounding me. Good ol' floribama time.

name: jmarie1887
text: An interesting spot, with a lot of different areas to hang out and listen to live music which is nice. Seems like it would be more fun at night (we came around dinner time). However I had to take off 2 stars due to the really miserable, unfriendly bartender that we had. Also, I’m not sure if they have a stray cat that visits, but there were a few spots that smelled like straight cat urine.

name: Thomas McGill
text: Everyone needs to come here at least one time.

name: Cheyenne Martin
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our time here. The staff was awesome, and the drinks were great. We will definitely be returning

name: Jennifer Braud
text: Very unique place! Lots of bars and levels, it's a must see to appreciate

name: Matt Rowe
text: Great staff, friendly environment. Awesome Church Services on Sundays...

name: Jennifer Bardwell
text: My favorite bar in Perdido Key! The bushwackers are the best and the atmosphere is so unique! Love it!!! Visit everytime we are in town!!

name: RON MULLEN
text: Food was good but they were short on servers.

name: hugo constantino
text: Awesome place! Happy hour was till 6pm with $3 beer. The bar tender upstairs (older bald man) makes good margaritas. Access to the beach and great oysters. Live music too...

name: Scott Sanders
text: Food was good, but unfortunately in the fall the bar is slow, but we had a great time, first visit in 25 years! I love this place.... The nachos are very good, but the atmosphere is way better!

name: Jason Hall
text: You got to go.we loved it

name: rebekah lusk
text: went for lunch one day at the beach. the food is so amazing!!! get the shrimp tacos!! you will not be disappointed. great chicken tenders and crispy fries. classic, delicious vacation food at a good price. definitely going back for more!

resp.text: We are so thankful for your visit Rebekah! We hope to see you again soon!

name: Hugh Turner
text: Great bands and party atmosphere

name: Stacy Stroud
text: Fun to stop in and check out when visiting.

name: Brandon Dial
text: Still a great place!

name: Laura Bentley
text: Amazing food and service! The live music was a wonderfull touch!

name: Jennifer Whitcher
text: Stephanie was awesome! She had great conversation and very friendly and let us borrow her sharpie! We will be back to see her again one Saturday or Sunday!

name: kerry kay
text: Best bar best drinks so much fun everyone must go there while in the area.

name: Edith Woodard
text: Yummy food and good music

name: Sean Larkin
text: Down at beaches doing roadside service for AAA & My company Amen Roadside Service,it was crazy no fuel cars have flats it was during the hurricane Sally  thanks Sean Amen Roadside Service

name: Gracie Fowler
text: They had live music. Drinks for the adults. Moments that were special and everything. One thing i didn't like that much about it was that there wasn't a lot of food options but then again it was mostly a bar so i cant blame them....but overall it was a really nice place.

resp.text: Thanks for letting us know about your recent visit and please know your comments have been passed to upper management for further review and action. We do hope to have you all back again soon!

name: Mary McKeown
text: Great music!! Drinks are over-priced but the food was good

name: Jennifer Munguia
text: This place is rocking. Tons of live music. Many different stages. Outdoor area with beach access. Several bars. Signed bras hanging from the ceiling.

name: Mike J. Mitchell
text: Great bar to spend the afternoon, good music and good atmosphere.

name: Dan Miller
text: Really great place to visit!

name: Jessica Miller
text: I agree with CK s review.  The restaurant has nice views being on the water.  We were treated to a spectacular sunset.  We were seated quickly despite being 7:30 on a Friday.  The live music was OK.  However, it took us 45+ minutes to get our food... My children feel asleep waiting.  We ordered the steak and shrimp meal and the Cobb salad.  My daughter's steak tasted "stale" but my son's was good.  The veggies were overcooked and flavorless.  My salad was ok but a disappointing amount of mix ins.  The only really good thing was the key lime pie... It was delicious.  I doubt we'll be back.  But here's some pictures of our pretty sunset even though it doesn't do it justice!

name: StuMan Chu
text: A very unique "shack" right on the beach. This place is huge and had at least two live performance stages and 4-5 bars within it's large rambling structure. It even has a large merchandise store. Across the street is their liquor store as well. It literally straddles the Florida/Alabama line, hence the name, Flora-Bama. They have a somewhat limited menu, but what we had was really good. I highly recommend the oyster sampler platter. We loved every roasted bite of each variety. They are also known for their Bushwhacker drink. The easiest way to describe this  is a Wendy's frosty with liquor. It has three different kinds, I beleive, and it's quite tasty and their strongest drink, even though it's premade. Our bartender Stacy was amazing and had all of the best recommendations.  She's very knowledgeable about the local area as well. One of the unique things about this venue is that they seemingly encourage you to write on virtually everything, and I mean everything, everywhere! Bring your Sharpie! We were they're in early December. I can't imagine how crowded this must be in season!!! All in all a fun place, with good music, good and drink!  The staff was very nice too!

You can always find live music, the coldest bushwhackers and a tasty bite to eat day or night. Come by land or by boat.

name: Junk Kids Treasures
text: Terrible customer service at the bar (with the bra line on the ceiling). Extremely rude bartender (J) and server (T) . We were refused water while ordering beer on a hot 4th of July weekend. I was discriminated against and not served. We asked why and were told it’s because we did not tip when in fact we had. (Not that it should matter as tipping is based on service!) My friend was treated nicely while I was not. I am transgender and it became apparent that they had issue with this. We were told we could not sit at the table the hostess had seated us at.  This was rudely yelled to us across the room bringing everyone’s attention to us. When I stood by the table at the bar I was told I had to sit and not ‘wander around’ When I paid the bill for my second drink, my change was literally thrown at me. Other tables around us were getting service without issue. We had asked to speak to the manager but they never came. My friend defended me to them and asked for their names. We decided to just leave however the bartender requested us to be thrown out and security escorted us to the door. Extremely unfortunate end to my holiday vacation.  I have always enjoyed this restaurant/bar and visited with my family on previous trips. Now that I am 22 and transgender I am obviously no longer welcome here. Disgusting!

name: Chris Beaven
text: We ate at the ole river grill. The food was a solid 4.5, service was a 3.5. Our server was obviously overwhelmed with numerous tables and not enough help. She was great at the beginning, but as more tables came in, she was clearly over worked. Not to mention, my wife and I are both police officers, and when we tried to make entry into the gift shop we were met with an over zealous ‘security’ officer who violated our HR 218 rights. There were no signs posted at the entry way defining that LE cannot carry on their premises. We just wanted to buy some swag from the gift shop, but after being denied entry because of our legally carried firearms by two active police officers under HR 218 we decided to leave. If you’re a LEO, do not spend your money here.

resp.text: Hi Chris - Please let me first apologize for the delay in response, and I can assure you that your comment was passed to upper management at the time received, including our ownership team, for further review. If possible, could you send me an email to the following address so that I may get a good contact number for our GM to reach out to you? We would really appreciate your time to explain why this happened on our premises as the LEOSA law is a little different for bar and restaurant operations mandated by the state of Florida. We truly love and appreciate all law enforcement, and we would sincerely love the opportunity to make things right with you. My name is Blakeli Calvert, my email is blakeli@florabama.com, and I look forward to hearing from you soon.

resp.text: Hi Jennifer - Thank you for taking time to let us know about your recent visit to the Flora-Bama Oyster Bar & Restaurant. On behalf of our team, I want to extend my sincerest apologies for the experience you all had. I'm not one to make excuses but it seems you may have caught us at a "not so great" moment. Though we have been in the midst of recent changes given on Friday, June 26th, 2020 to convert our operations back from bar to restaurant, that in no way should reflect in the service and food order consistency. Please know your comments have been passed to upper management for further review and action. We do hope to have you all back for a better experience and in effort to make things right. Again, thank you for the feedback and we hope to have you all back again soon.

text: Place was over hyped.  And everyone should keep track of how many drinks you order.  When you get your bill they will have 2-6 drinks more than what you ordered.  There was 4 groups of us that had bills and every one of them had 2 or more drinks than what was ordered.  Don't waste your time with this place.

name: Jennifer Poindexter
text:
Weekend night is pretty crowded but understandably so. It's an amazing venue if you like live music and an indoor/outdoor atmosphere.
The place is huge. It almost looks like there was the original place and they decided to add on. Then add on again and again.
You can roam inside and outside, upstairs and down all night. Even has a boardwalk to the beach.
We went on a Saturday night and they had at least 10 bars open that night that were all over the place.
The food they offered is more of appetizers and finger food that I seen. We ordered the nachos, get your choice of beef or chicken. They were out of chicken so obviously we had gotten beef and it was to greasy that we couldn't really eat it. But other than that it was good. They also had a food trailer sitting there but didnt order from it.
Gift shop was great, found lots of stuff for loved ones and ourselves.  Some more adult oriented things that are funny if you are into that sort if thing.
We seen that they have what I would call a club/dance hall, another place called the flora-bama yacht club and the old river grill. Didnt get to the yacht club but the old river grill was by far my favorite.
Great atmosphere,  neat little bar and grill that u can get to by land or water, had picnic tables and beach chairs set up on the beach. Couple different corn hole games set up for u to play.
Will definitely be back there on my next trip down.

name: Paul Hood
text: Enjoy Rick Young performance in the Top Deck!

text: This is a great atmosphere for adult entertainment!  Great live bands. When we ordered Lyft, he made sure we were with the right person and they knew where we were going!  Country went over and definitely, beyond his job to show us a great time.  Thank you Country, we will definitely be back.  From your Midwest Fans.  Go Nebraska!

name: Whitney Miller
text:
A must do if you come to the Alabama, Florida Gulf coast. The Flora-Bama was a famous little local bar/liquor store that has survived hell and high water a few times and evolved into the legendary place it is today. Well to tell the truth it was legendary before it evolved.
You can always find live music, the coldest bushwhackers and a tasty bite to eat day or night. Come by land or by boat.

name: Chris Beaven
text: We ate at the ole river grill. The food was a solid 4.5, service was a 3.5. Our server was obviously overwhelmed with numerous tables and not enough help. She was great at the beginning, but as more tables came in, she was clearly over worked. Not to mention, my wife and I are both police officers, and when we tried to make entry into the gift shop we were met with an over zealous ‘security’ officer who violated our HR 218 rights. There were no signs posted at the entry way defining that LE cannot carry on their premises. We just wanted to buy some swag from the gift shop, but after being denied entry because of our legally carried firearms by two active police officers under HR 218 we decided to leave. If you’re a LEO, do not spend your money here.

resp.text: Hi Chris - Please let me first apologize for the delay in response, and I can assure you that your comment was passed to upper management at the time received, including our ownership team, for further review. If possible, could you send me an email to the following address so that I may get a good contact number for our GM to reach out to you? We would really appreciate your time to explain why this happened on our premises as the LEOSA law is a little different for bar and restaurant operations mandated by the state of Florida. We truly love and appreciate all law enforcement, and we would sincerely love the opportunity to make things right with you. My name is Blakeli Calvert, my email is blakeli@florabama.com, and I look forward to hearing from you soon.

name: Junk Kids Treasures
text: Terrible customer service at the bar (with the bra line on the ceiling). Extremely rude bartender (J) and server (T) . We were refused water while ordering beer on a hot 4th of July weekend. I was discriminated against and not served. We asked why and were told it’s because we did not tip when in fact we had. (Not that it should matter as tipping is based on service!) My friend was treated nicely while I was not. I am transgender and it became apparent that they had issue with this. We were told we could not sit at the table the hostess had seated us at.  This was rudely yelled to us across the room bringing everyone’s attention to us. When I stood by the table at the bar I was told I had to sit and not ‘wander around’ When I paid the bill for my second drink, my change was literally thrown at me. Other tables around us were getting service without issue. We had asked to speak to the manager but they never came. My friend defended me to them and asked for their names. We decided to just leave however the bartender requested us to be thrown out and security escorted us to the door. Extremely unfortunate end to my holiday vacation.  I have always enjoyed this restaurant/bar and visited with my family on previous trips. Now that I am 22 and transgender I am obviously no longer welcome here. Disgusting!

text:
We got clam strips and moz sticks for appetizers. Both were really good. I enjoyed the clam strips a lot.
My husband got the raw oysters. Man! Beautiful!
Then for a meal he got the fried oyster and shrimp basket.
I am usually not a fan of fried shrimp but these were amazing.
The oysters were "the best I ever had" according to my husband.
Love the atmosphere and friendly staff!

name: Raymond Genovese
text:
This is a must stop each and every visit while in Gulf Shores/Orange Beach/Perdido Key!

I’ve been back each and every year since 1988!

On my first visit, I along with five other friends happened to see this little hole in a wall joint at the Alabama/Florida state line.  (Note: It has grown substantially since Hurricane Ivan destroyed it in 2004)!  At any rate, we popped in this packaged liquor store and notice a bar in the rear, what the heck “let’s have one and go!” What a blast we had!  6 hours and $450 later the six of us hailed a cab back to our condo and left our van in the parking lot.

Flora Bama is bigger and better since than, larger rooms where different bands play from morning until night! Great food, drinks, beach, did I mention music?

A must stop for anyone vacationing in the area.

name: Stephen Como
text: The place to party the night away.  Weekends, special events and when the "tourist season" is here it gets CRAZY and extremely busy. Live music in the various different rooms, reasonably priced drinks, and definitely and place to meet new friends. The police do make this place a priority to keep everyone safe and keep eye out for driving under influence so please keep this in mind. Also, there is a Church service on the beach early Sunday mornings then back inside for a drink. Enjoy!

name: Joey Chase
text: A must do when we are in town. The bushwhackers are amazing, there's a bunch of different bars to go to, making fun of bingo is a hoot (and free), live music, good food, even church on Sundays. There is so much to do here, you'll please anyone you're with.

name: The Royal Market
text: Love Love Love  their fish tacos!  I enjoy hanging here it’s an awesome place to come with friends.. we have fun every time.. it’s a must for this Special ONE of a kind place...

name: Jack Webster
text:
If you're visiting the AL Gulf Coast the Flora Bama is something to see.  It's a world famous bar on the sand that has live music 7 days a week.  If you're not someone who likes bars then go to Church there on Sunday.  Best, and most meaningful service you probably will ever attended.  Their motto is "Where it's OK not to be OK" services at 9 & 11.  Greatest Easter Sunrise On the beach Service ever.  Get baptised in the Gulf of Mexico for the most meaningful and unforgettable baptism ever.

Whatever your visit to the area is for, the Flora Bama should be on your list of places to see.

resp.text:
Hi Reyna - Thank you for taking time to let us know about your recent visit to the Flora-Bama. On behalf of our team, please let me start by extending my sincerest apologies for the treatment you received from some of our staff. We absolutely do not tolerate this sort of behavior from our employees, and I would like to get a little more info from you if possible. Can you tell me what day/time you were here, any sort of description of what they looked like and/or where in the Flora-Bama did this occur?
Please know your comments have been passed to upper management, as well as our Ownership Team, for further review and action and, any additional info you may have would be helpful so that we may address this with the appropriate staff. Again, I'm so very sorry this happened but I would love to try and make things right. Please feel free to reach out to me directly with any other info you have using the following email address: blakeli@florabama.com.
I hope to hear back from you soon - Blakeli Calvert, Marketing Manager Flora-Bama
