text: So much fun and more live music in one place than I've ever seen. The food is great too!

name: Matt Sloan
text: Good food and nice environment for the kids before 6

name: Missy MacGown
text: If you've never been there then you gotta go see it. Such a cool place with so many signatures all over the walls, tables, duct work. You name it. The oldest one I saw was from 1973. Very good food, great staff.

name: Trent Howard
text: Know that this is just a shack beach bar. It's fun every night. Bands are great. We went on Wednesday night and the band was great. Drinks are consistent and good. Food is OK. It's a raw bar, I love taking the kids to bingo during the day. It's fun yet tacky.

resp.text: Thank you for the review! We hope to see you again soon! :)

name: Darrell King
text: Great atmosphere and the drinks came back quick and cold

name: Scott Ward
text: The food and atmosphere was excellent. I would have given 4 stars, but our server wasn't very attentive.  She really struggled to provide food suggestions and get drink refills.

name: Rachael Hensley
text: This is a typical Nashville Broadway bar but better; I would know cause I'm from Nashville

name: Rachel Sanders
text: Fun place, good music and drinks!

name: Gladys Stibal
text: A amazingly fun place and great food.

name: Donna Whitehead
text: Big place.  Great bands.  Right on the beach

name: Bill Cook
text: Food was great and plentiful.Service was very good.Place very clean.Friendly staff.

name: Amanda Eve Tapia
text: Very affordable entry. Overall has good vibes. This place needs a bigger range in their music selection though. Flora-Bama is also very unfriendly with under 21 year olds. They might as well make it 21+

name: Laura Clingman
text: I stopped in when they first opened for the day, I had heard about Flora-Bama, especially when Kenny Chesney played there the one time. I just had to check it out oh, but I wasn't interested in the bar atmosphere, I just wanted to check the place out. It is amazing! If you want to get a real idea of how big the place is and how much neat stuff is in there, go when it's not busy. I would imagine that place rocks at night though!

name: Billy
text: Never a dull moment

name: Patricia Pensyl
text: This was the first time ive been there. They had a rodeo going on. Not like the ones in Texas that we have, but it wad a happening place to be. Every corner you turned was something new to do. Had a blast!!!!!

name: Elaine Pickett
text: Raw oysters we're yummy !

name: josh moody
text: Love this place!!

name: Matthew Schrock
text: Unfortunately we went on a weekday that was kind of chilly. You can definitely tell this place has potential to be great on a warm summer day will definitely look forward to trying to go back sometime when things are happening.

resp.text: Hey there!  Thanks for letting us know about your recent visit. The sunshine and warmer weather definitely helps the vibe and energy around here, but we try to make every day a fun day! Hope to see ya back again soon :)

name: Amanda Cook
text: Food was great and loved the live music

name: Brittnee Snowdell
text: It was amazing! Just a great relaxing dive joint. The food is so delicious and a good price for the portions. Staff was just excellent and so very very friendly. Open air restaurant which was just nice and refreshing. Good music. Talked to the table next to is and they will even take the fish you have caught and cook it up for you! We were impressed and will he back!

resp.text: We appreciate your review Brittnee! We hope to see you again soon! :)

name: Kathy Cunningham
text: Bingo, beach and bushwakers

name: Kimberley Hooper Riggs
text: Always a great place to go and relax and have a drink and listen to some tunes.

name: Mario Carrillo
text:
5 stars hand down... if I could  rate it any higher I would.
Excellent service,
The food is extremely  high quality.
The Entertainment  has been by far the best I've  seen and heard in the Area.

name: Kathi Edwards
text: Nice place to plan an end place for a motorcycle ride. Adult drinks, food and entertainment.

name: Sonya Holt
text: Historically beautiful sunsets and wonderful memories made here!

name: Angel Supreme
text: Big fun for every ONE! Come see. 😎😇

name: Rita Perfater
text: Just a fun, raunchy place. Entertainment in every bar, of which there are many. We were in the main bar, it is unique. So very friendly. Had a local cream ale. The popped corn was tasty and plentiful. Not really a place for lids.

name: Antoni Gambetta
text:
This place is a destination bar for sure. There is the loud raucous aspect, but there is also the very heartfelt local music scene too.

We spent the afternoon in the main bar and listen to Tbone play acoustic guitar and interact with the crowd.

Florabama is a spot you need to visit at least once, but if you come a second time, be sure to see its multiple sides.

name: Candace Cheatham
text: Hardly any parking. If you are going to an event..park further away and grab a Lyft or an Uber. Small inside also.. but it is a fun place

name: Everette Long
text: Unique bar that is a must do stop if in the Orange Beach area. Church meeting going on in one area and amazing bar with balcony seating and thousands of bras hanging from the ceiling. The Bamaburger is the best ever.

name: C.M. Blair
text: Bar out back, on the beachfront. Shop up front. Tight parking, recommend parking across the street.

name: Michelle Treece
text: Love this place! So much fun, great music, good food!

name: Meika LeBlanc
text: Ya know, we come here every time we visit. Even though the drinks are usually under poured and over priced, it’s still a great time. Wanna know one of the coolest perks they have? If you’re military, you get in for free. BUT WAIT. There’s a catch. This respectful and “grateful” perk goes out the window during events like the Mullet Toss. Yep. That’s right. Even though military doesn’t get to pick and choose when they deploy overseas for a year to protect this country...FloraBama wants to save $10 and charge them when the place is already packed and definitely breaking fire code. This is just tacky. Tacky, cheap...and don’t ever say you appreciate your veterans because if you did, you wouldn’t pick and choose when they’d pay to get in. Just like my spouse didn’t pick and choose when she left for Afghanistan and is currently serving now..  My spouse and others cant come with right now cause they’re out there protecting and and sometimes have to pay the ultimate sacrifice to have your overpriced bar.

resp.text:
Hi Meika,
Thank you for letting us know about your recent experience. I can understand your frustrations, but we are extremely grateful for our Military as we host dozens of military events here throughout the year, and majority of our staff are retired or inactive military. In regards to the the Mullet Toss event, and all events that may take place on Friday's, we only allow entry for those who have purchased tickets or those with Flora-Bama Membership Cards. We don't accept S.I.N. Cards or Military ID's for free entry as those specific events are ticket entry only (majority of the money collected we donate to local charities, including military non-profits). These specific ticketed events would be for Mullet Toss, Bulls on the Beach in September, New Years Eve (if falls on a Friday) and any other event that may fall on a Friday. Please know your comments will be passed to upper management for further review and action. I do apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused, but please feel free to email me at the address below with any other comments you have. I'd love to offer you all some free admission and drink cards as we would love to have you back for the experience you were looking to have.
Blakeli@florabama.com

name: Carolyn Hoskin
text: This place has grown so much over the years . I love the new river side bar, you can bring pets on this side. Come by boat or vehicle. It has four stages and on busy weekends your sure to find something of your musical taste. The bushwackers are awesome, be sure to add the dark rum topper for the extra kick. We will be back.

name: Teresa LePoris
text: Fun place bring money and expect to uber or lyft home

name: Randy Brown
text: This is the ultimate Road House music always great Jay Hawkins who is a wonderful very talented musician and songwriter you cannot say Flora-Bama without thinking Jay Hawkins

name: dean italiano
text:
The Rodeo.... announcer said it was overbooked. I’d say by double. People sitting on ground to see the event, and people w tickets turned away due to overcrowding.
It was a Nightmare to park and cops were not directing traffic that went back for miles.
Hopefully the money collected for st Jude made up for the mess.
Bar/building is extremely unkept, dirty and smells. Bathrooms are horrific.
I don’t see the allure.

name: Julio Sánchez
text: The place was immersive and the atmosphere was great, the restrooms however, only reason I'm giving it 4 stars!

name: Elaine Pearson
text: A great experience--a must for everyone that visits the GULF COAST‼️

name: Jamie Bradford
text: Great place to go to church on Sunday morning.   See Country at the bar.   Outstanding service! He went out of his way to make sure we had everything we needed!

name: Matt Codding
text: I didn’t have the people around me to make the experience but understood that it could be a great fun night with friends. Good live music. Good bartenders.

resp.text: We like to think we're one of those places that you can enjoy chilling and listening to music in the Main bar upstairs, or if you're feeling more lively, you can listen to the bands down stairs while dancing with hundreds of friends you've never met! Thanks for the review and we're glad you had a good time. Hope to see you again soon.

name: Robert Crawford
text: Always a great time. Get “bushwacked” for “the best time you won’t remember”. Seeing Big Earl is a must and never disappoints. The only cover band that has a Tittie Wheel. You’ll find out....

name: Araceli Lugo
text: Got to Sunday service and then eat!

name: Keith Cain
text: Great music and a fun place to just hang out.

name: Tina Rowland
text: This was my first visit. We went because someone in our group wanted oysters. They didn't have them, so we went across street for them, then came back. Listened to some open mic night... So ok, some not. It was a unique experience.

name: David Baum
text: Good food and the music was good also.

name: Yvonne Faulkner
text: Great place to go for drinks and live music. It's a funky place, an institution, a landmark. You can't go to Florida/Alabama and not visit this place.

name: Michael Hanlon
text: Great atmosphere bam

name: Emma Stroup
text: Interesting place. Ranges from the elderly to college kids. Bushwhackers are delicious! Good music and a great place to meet people. The boardwalk and beach view at night is gorgeous.

resp.text: We look forward to your next visit with us! Thank you for the review.

name: Jackie Sausley
text: I was surprised that in November it was was warm and comfortable in the bars. Live music, no bottled beer, just cans.

name: Kathy Alexander
text: Loved it....come here every time I come to Alabama

name: Lord Berkley
text: Best worst bar ever. Never a bad memory was made there that i can recall...

name: Tiago Dias
text: The bar is pretty cool, it's huge with very nice decoration. Service is somewhat good, but could be better. Perhaps I was not lucky on visiting the place during off season. I'm pretty sure it has potential for more during spring and summer.

name: Jennifer Jackson- Keating
text: A one-of-a-kind experience on the Florida-Alabama state line. Anything goes including Mullet (the fish) which get thrown in an annul event aptly named the Mullet Toss. Just go!

name: Jimmie Rodgers
text: It must be experienced, stay in Perdido and be entertained at the Flora-Bama.

name: Donna Rooks
text: Huge-cool-bar on the beach. Packed on weekends. Live music. Church held here on Sundays.

name: Nicholas salisbury
text: Enjoyed it. The weather is crazy but great place to visit.

name: Cringe gurl24
text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE. A YEARLY TRADITION.

name: Roy C
text: This place is cool. We were there Saturday night and Sunday night. Saturday had a lot of people but it never really felt crowded because it is so big. Sunday was very busy too. I was shocked at how many people were there. They have live music every night.

name: Danny Chambers
text: Biggest and best dive bar ever. Many floors, bands, and bras. Good food

name: Grant Galloway
text: Great atmosphere the variety of live bands gives people choices throughout the night. A must see a great experience

resp.text: Thanks for letting us know about your recent visit, we're so glad you all had a large time! Come back and see us again soon :)

name: Rochelle A
text: A "joint" right on the Gulf of Mexico on the Florida and Alabama line. Music and food are just as fresh and crisp as the breeze in the winter. Song writers festival is a music lovers dream. Never a dull moment and friends are to be made easily no matter your station in life.

name: Dwight Jones
text: Good food too early get there early for the shows

name: tom speaker
text: Love it here. Where else can you play free bingo for prizes listen to great bands and music and go to church on Sundays. Could argue they deserve a 5 . Depending on the bands they are a 5 on given days.

name: John O'Connor
text: Fun beach bar with great live music.

name: Kelly Miears
text: It doesn't seem very clean, the bathrooms arent great... but it is an experience. The place is huge, with many bands to choose from... and you can find all types and ages of people. It is a melting pot at a great beachfront spot on the state line.

name: Dustin Harper
text: Good food, great atmosphere, clean and reasonable prices. We will be back.

name: Christy Miles
text: Great service and good food

name: Donna Brunet
text: This place has the best burgers!! Great atmosphere also. The staff is a little slow but it's because they're usually so packed.

resp.text: So glad you all had a large time! Thank you for your comment as they will be passed on to upper management for further review and action. Hope to see ya back here on the line soon!

name: Kevin Slate
text: Definitely a bro college bar on the weekends.  Went both on a Friday and a Sat and the crowd was very different.  I think it is worth experiencing either way because the music was on point, the bartenders awesome and   the vibe was lively and fun.  It is a must go.

resp.text: So glad you all had a great time! Hope to see you back here on the line soon :)

name: Mechelle Wainwright

name: Jason Maxwell
text: Very unique place where there's great music and drinks "Bushwacker".... An atmosphere where all mixtures of people from bikers to priest hang out!  Don't forget the Sunday worship on the water... Hands down the best!

name: Mike Ruggiero

name: Janet Pickens
text:
I attended a Bible Study at the FloraBama church. What a great group of people that love the Lord.
Study group is very good group of loving ladies with a huge heart.
The FloraBama is wonderful to the church and does so much for them.
A great minister also.

name: Huntduxw12ga
text: What a beautiful beach running the whole tourist area!!

name: Ashlynn Combs
text: Amazing..... simply amazing!!!

name: Beth Hunt
text: A lot of fun for ringing in the New Year!

name: Anita Glasgow
text: Surprised by some of the callers risque marks with children being in the hall.  If it were my children I would have got up and left.  His off the wall remarks should be for adults only.

name: Chad Curtis
text: Great time with killer music; as always!!!!

name: Jonathan Puzan
text: A must see destination on the gulf coast. Live music and a safe drinking environment like you've never seen. World famous, an all star staff, and don't forget to look into the Frank Brown International Songwriters Festival.

resp.text: Hey Jonathan! Thanks so much for the rave review, the Frank Brown Songwriters Festival is definitely not one to miss! Hope to see ya soon back on the line :)

name: Tim Mauldin
text: First time visitor and I had a great time.  Prices for drinks were reasonable, food was good and staff seemed to be friendly and attentive.  It was a hot day, so outside seating was very hot, but, I really had no issues with that.  Why didn't I give it a 5 star review?  Cleanliness of the restrooms.

name: S. Loar
text: NOT ENOUGH WORDS TO DESCRIBE HOW AMAZING & FUN THIS PLACE IS!

name: Prentiss Griffith
text: Soooo much history and things to take in!

name: Greg Snow
text: A must see. We are there every year..

name: Mark Sasser
text: Awesome! And I didnt get kicked out so there's always that! Great environment great service!

name: SYA Sparkey
text: Not the best service. Drink prices high.

name: Benjamin Foster
text: New Year’s Eve band in main bar was ancient and awful. It was karaoke night at the senior center. There wasn’t enough energy on stage to power the original light bulb which I assume the performers were present to see.

name: Danny Parra
text: We love going to the free bingo games with the kids, always a fun time!

name: KH ChemSold
text: I had a great experience here, and the food was delicious, while vacationing here in Alabama. I'll definitely be back.

name: Daniel Tougas
text: Don't miss this place! It's Great!

name: Rainy Day
text: Bingo totally fun. Not what I expected.... very relaxed atmosphere and hilarious host. Loved it.

name: Douglass Rudolph
text: Great music  Great ppl. Great time

name: Michael Butler
text: Once a hurricane tore the old Flora-Bama down-- dealt her all kinds of destruction, busted timbers, scads of pink & dayglo bras swept out to sea.  Oh, the humanity!  Local wags figured it would cost at least $2,000.00 to rebuild the joint.  And it was a joint... and a dive,  as in the very best definition of joints and dives.  Today's F-B is more of a cleaned up, semi-homogenized mishmash of the old girl.  There are vague, vestigial traces around in the books & crannies, still.  And a bra will still occasionally find its way to the floor as a band plays and alcohol flows.  Haven't spotted any up in  the rafters yet.  Maybe I haven't looked hard enough. If you haven't been, go-- but be aware that this version isn't as gritty as the old version.

name: Judy Sawyer
text: Nice cute place. Had so much fun with the people we were with.

name: Tyrone Jackson (Reel Jack Fishing)
text: Pretty cool environment. The live music is pretty good as well. The store is a little expensive though. Military gets in free with ID which is awesome! I like the multiple club setup as well.

name: Chelsie Steveson
text: Don't let the Internet lie to you... this is a bar. I read that it was a family friendly eating establishment, but I guess that's if you are there before 5:30pm. I had my 18 year old sister with me and we went ahead and paid the cover charge @ 6:15 which was more than triple the usual... when we got in we bought our food which was  below subpar for bar food despite it being cheaper than other places. When we tried to leave the not-so-pleasant  woman at the door to the beach said we couldn't come back in because we had the 18 year old, which we thought would be fine. I tried to explain that we wanted to walk around the beach to leave but where was the best place to get back to the street, I didn't get a straight answer from her but she also didn't say it wasn't possible. IT IS NOT POSSIBLE UNLESS YOU ARE STAYING ON THAT BEACH!!! We ended up going into a private condo complex, calling to a man on his 3rd floor balcony and getting him to come down and let us out the front door. Why she wouldn't tell us that the beach had no public access when we asked flat out, I do not know. Be forewarned there is a restaurant on the north side of the street. If you want to have a pleasant dinner go there. The staff is beyond rude and unhelpful, especially if you have someone with you, that they allow in, but is not of drinking age.

resp.text: Chelsie, we recently had a manager's meeting and discussed your review. It was poor communication on our part and we are working to counsel the employees on how to better their customer service skills. We hope that you and your sister return, there is a better experience to be had!

name: Patrick Dittoe
text: Sunday service. Packed with great people.

name: Peggy Joiner
text: Great place to visit and have a drink. Got great beach views. Kid friendly during the day more for adults in the evenings. Check it out.

name: Gregory Forck
text: What a place! Inexpensive food, great beer and awesome music. We were there for hours and had the best time.

name: dean italiano
text:
The Rodeo.... announcer said it was overbooked. I’d say by double. People sitting on ground to see the event, and people w tickets turned away due to overcrowding.
It was a Nightmare to park and cops were not directing traffic that went back for miles.
Hopefully the money collected for st Jude made up for the mess.
Bar/building is extremely unkept, dirty and smells. Bathrooms are horrific.
I don’t see the allure.

text: Enjoyed it. The weather is crazy but great place to visit.

name: Rick Cockram
text: What an intereatimg bar restaurant. Loads of fun to be had here.

name: Amanda Orman
text: I have been a frequent customer of Flora-Bama for the last few months since moving to Pensacola and have always had a wonderful time, but within the last few weeks something must have changed because my encounter this evening was so much less than desirable. I knew that everyone at Flora-Bama was on high alert when we were Immediately questioned about our IDs upon walking in, which are all legitimate and have been used multiple times and have never been an issue. The girl at the front desk called the police to have my Illinois ID verified (which I understand as Illinois has new, very poorly made IDs and I am in Florida- which probably aren't the most commonly seen ID). However, after it was verified by the police, my friends and I went to the bathroom as we had just driven for an hour to get to Flora-Bama. It was then that my underage friend, who was given a permanent marker U and a blue wristband for being underage, was immediately targeted by two employees and interrogated about his age. When he entered the establishment he had presented his military ID which showed that he was 19 (never presented a fake) and told the employees that he was indeed 19 when asked. However, because his permanent marker washed off in the bathroom when washing his hands, he no longer had  the U but still had the blue wristband indicating he was underage. Despite explaining that he just walked in minutes prior and was going to go get a new U drawn on, he was rudely thrown out of the bar, and the rest of us in our party were ejected with him. I am absolutely appalled at how Flora-Bama has treated a member of the armed forces who has broken ZERO rules of this establishment. As a result of this horrific experience, we will no longer be returning to flora-bama and plan to share this information with our friends and coworkers who are interested in attending. We hope that management considers looking into these employees and their poor customer service skills because I imagine that we are not the only customers that Flora-Bama has lost tonight because of them.

resp.text: Hey there - Thank you for taking time to let us know about your recent visit to the Flora-Bama. On behalf of our team please let me extend my sincerest apologies for the experience you all had. If possible, can you give me a little more info - what day were you all here that this occurred, time of day, any kind of description on the waiter/waitress? Any additional comments you may have would be helpful so that we may address this with the appropriate staff. This is not AT ALL any kind of behavior we tolerate nor condone and please know your comments have been passed to upper management for further review and action. If you'd like, please feel free to email me any additional comments to blakeli@florabama.com so that I may pass this on to our Management and Ownership team. Again, I'm so very sorry about this but I'd love to help make things right. Hope to hear back from you soon - Blakeli Calvert

name: Michael Butler
text: Once a hurricane tore the old Flora-Bama down-- dealt her all kinds of destruction, busted timbers, scads of pink & dayglo bras swept out to sea.  Oh, the humanity!  Local wags figured it would cost at least $2,000.00 to rebuild the joint.  And it was a joint... and a dive,  as in the very best definition of joints and dives.  Today's F-B is more of a cleaned up, semi-homogenized mishmash of the old girl.  There are vague, vestigial traces around in the books & crannies, still.  And a bra will still occasionally find its way to the floor as a band plays and alcohol flows.  Haven't spotted any up in  the rafters yet.  Maybe I haven't looked hard enough. If you haven't been, go-- but be aware that this version isn't as gritty as the old version.

name: Charles Ruckstuhl
text: although the Flora-Bama has been a favorite hangout of mine for many years, I am leaving a negative review you because of the incessant and ridiculous traffic jams created everyday. The solution would be to construct an elevated boardwalk to allow patrons to cross the road without stopping traffic. The Flora-Bama makes so much money that you would think this would be a simple solution that they would have already implemented. It is unacceptable to affect the general public so negatively and ignore the problem that it creates.

resp.text:
Hi Charles, If you have noticed the Alabama side has made recent changes to the road. We are waiting on the Florida DOT to finish the work on the other side. You can imagine the years of work this has taken to get the project started. We understand your frustration but just imagine the amount of work our team has put in to get both states to work together. After summer the Florida group is suppose to do their work and at least they did not choose to start during season.

We appreciate your opinions but our staff members read every review posted on here and we truly wish you would reconsider since they have no control over the Department of Transportation scheduling. Thanks so much.

name: Patty Mills
text: This rating is based solely on our service.  The food was good but our server wasn't.  The place was by no means even close to being full, yet our server couldn't seem to remember to check on us with any kind of regularity. We sat on the patio. Other servers around us were friendly with their guests, one even taking pictures for one of her table's guests.  Ours only seemed to remember to check on us whenever she got a new table assigned to her that happened to be in our seating area. We got there around 7:30 and it was almost 9 when we left - and it was all due to poor service.  The time it took us to eat & have a few drinks would have gotten us out in 30-45 minutes max. The rest of the time was a frustrating waiting game.  One time after our food was served, I asked for salt and ketchup. She never brought any, nor did she ever remember (or apologize when she saw that I had scavenged them from several other tables). We will pass on revisiting this place again whenever we're back in this area.

name: Amanda Orman
text: I have been a frequent customer of Flora-Bama for the last few months since moving to Pensacola and have always had a wonderful time, but within the last few weeks something must have changed because my encounter this evening was so much less than desirable. I knew that everyone at Flora-Bama was on high alert when we were Immediately questioned about our IDs upon walking in, which are all legitimate and have been used multiple times and have never been an issue. The girl at the front desk called the police to have my Illinois ID verified (which I understand as Illinois has new, very poorly made IDs and I am in Florida- which probably aren't the most commonly seen ID). However, after it was verified by the police, my friends and I went to the bathroom as we had just driven for an hour to get to Flora-Bama. It was then that my underage friend, who was given a permanent marker U and a blue wristband for being underage, was immediately targeted by two employees and interrogated about his age. When he entered the establishment he had presented his military ID which showed that he was 19 (never presented a fake) and told the employees that he was indeed 19 when asked. However, because his permanent marker washed off in the bathroom when washing his hands, he no longer had  the U but still had the blue wristband indicating he was underage. Despite explaining that he just walked in minutes prior and was going to go get a new U drawn on, he was rudely thrown out of the bar, and the rest of us in our party were ejected with him. I am absolutely appalled at how Flora-Bama has treated a member of the armed forces who has broken ZERO rules of this establishment. As a result of this horrific experience, we will no longer be returning to flora-bama and plan to share this information with our friends and coworkers who are interested in attending. We hope that management considers looking into these employees and their poor customer service skills because I imagine that we are not the only customers that Flora-Bama has lost tonight because of them.

name: Emily Boyd-Suter
text: Great for lunch when everything else was closed due to Hurricane Michael. The staff was polite and food was tasty, can't ask for much more.

name: Jackie Sausley
text: I was surprised that in November it was was warm and comfortable in the bars. Live music, no bottled beer, just cans.

name: David Terrell
text: My daughter and family were excited to be able to dance there

name: Stan Smith
text: Pretty cool place with 3 stages and live music all night, food was good too.  Crowded in some places but lots of room to roam around with several varieties of local and well known artist.

name: Emily Howe
text: All time favorite bar! Great music, amazing staff, great drinks. One of a kind. Can't beat it

name: Xavier Arrington
text: The place was nice but it was too hot for me.

name: Troy Bell
text: Bartender was very cool, Lucas. Just a slow night and not very familiar with the facility.

name: Teresa Jones
text: Last Night here. Having a good time.

name: K & B
text: Lots of bars. Lots of music. Just a good time to be had by all.

name: Sally Geurts
text: Awesome service today from Sara.  She was super friendly and recommended the best shrimp on the appetizers ever.   The menu says it is spicy but it really isn't.   It is just delicious.   My husband and I booth loved it.

resp.text: Yum! Thanks for visiting Sally! Hope to see you again soon.

name: Dawn Sunshine
text: Bingo was a blast. So glad we stumbled in at that time. Drinks were good. Location is ideal for fun!

name: Christopher Fowler
text: Didn't expect to have such an amazing time. My friends took me out for the evening, and I got hooked on the bushwhackers and one of the most entertaining funk/R&B bands I've seen. The lead singer (looked like Steve Harvey) had the place jumpin. Will definitely be back for the drinks and entertainment.

name: John Baugher
text: Good atmosphere , cold beer and exceptional Oysters !

name: Jesslyn Wright

name: Angela Stephenson
text: We've had thanksgiving lunch here believe it or not! Everybody brings a covered dish. Pretty crowded, but good fellowship. We stopped in for t-shirts this trip, but the bar scene is very crowded and there's a cover charge, so we didn't fool with it. Wanted something with a low key envt.

resp.text: We are so glad you stopped in Angela, you will have to come again during the day when it is more relaxed! Thank you for the review :)

name: George Russell
text: Awesome.  Can't say enough.  Best Bushwackers in ALABAMA.  Great food and excellent bands.

name: Amanda Sanders
text: Love, love Flora-Bama

name: Jax Foux

name: Melissa Kadorian Azarva

text: Great atmosphere and plenty of music

name: robin gonzales
text: I had a wonderful time

name: Vivian Vaughn

name: tim vanmatre

name: Pamela Prather

name: Nancy Lepera

name: Stan Smith

pretty cool place, you have to go in through the gift shop. lol. Cop car sitting outside with the lights running given, every night.  no big deal though keep your nose clean and you won't have a problem.
5 stars goes to having TITO'S on tap, is that not COOL #titovodka

name: Michael Ward
text: Fun atmosphere. Great place to party! Sunday church services there are enjoyable, as well. Can pull right up on your boat too. Very convenient.

name: James Jones
text: It is very large Place much bigger than you would think from the outside but once we went inside there wasn't many people but that was due to being in an offseason but if you're down there and you have a chance you should go because it's a very interesting historical place kind of a gym of the location

text: If you're staying within a close drive if the flora-bama, definitely check it out. The grill is family friendly, but I dont reccomend the bar for kids. The staff was great and the menu was okay. I dont feel like there was anything particularly special about this restaurant/bar other than the affiliation with Kenny Chesney. So, if you're a kenny chesney buff, go to the bar, not the restaurant.

name: Diana Roberts
text: Love this place!!!!

name: Katherine Calloway
text: Unique place with lots to see and multiple bands playing. Good food and drinks! Beach is just across board walk and it's beautiful!!

text: Great live music - very crowded! Made for a great atmosphere filled with festival-goers. Not sure yet if it's my scene so I'll have to visit again next year for a redo. ;)

name: Ashleigh Sweet
text: Fun if you are looking for a more casual, fun setting. Always a ton of bachelorette and bachelor parties there. A very diverse crowd makes for great people watching. Always have at least 2 bands playing in one of their many bar areas.

name: Tucker Nebel
text: I love this place. There are so many places to go and explore. The food is really good. The wings are better than you'd expect and of course all of the seafood is really good.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We look forward to seeing you on your next visit!

name: seekerfine
text: What a fun place...drinks a little pricey..entertainment outstanding

name: Ginny Lyon
text:
Stopped by Flora-Bama restaurants/bars to check it out. It's right on the Florida Alabama line, and that's how it got it's name.
They have 2 restaurants on one side or the street and another along with some bars on the other side of the road. They have live music and offer free bingo certain days during the week. You really need to try the bingo it's a hoot. Not your ordinary bingo, it's all free! There is a gift shop as well.
Flora-Bama is right on the beach and the view is spectacular. Check out the sunset, beautiful.
If your visiting the Gulf Shores of Alabama or the areas of Pensacola, Florida you need to stop by to see it, it's nothing fancy...just down home fun!

resp.text: Thanks for the awesome review, Ginny! So glad you had a large time and we hope to see you back soon!

name: Tom Taylor
text: Spent the afternoon there having drinks and listening to T-bone Montgomery.   Excellent music, great service, and cheap but good drinks.

name: David Crow
text: Great gift shop and service. Busy place on the beach and you can count on a solid Sunday preaching while enjoying a beverage. My first Bushwhacker experience -a delicious frosted drink that's not for the weary.

resp.text: We appreciate your review David and hope to see you again soon! :)

name: Jeanette Bricker
text: Smelled very strong of cigarettes.

name: Lacey Burnett
text: Always well taken care of here. Be patient with the staff when they are packed. They can't hear everyone at once. And also, but most importantly,  if you have time on your visit they hold Sunday service at 9& 11 great church.

name: SCOTT WOLSTENHOLME
text: Love this place ...home away from home...

name: Joanne Gibson
text: Always a fun place to be. For the mullet toss The trolley (from Winn Dixie perdido/Publix orange beach) is the way to go.

text: 10 bars with 5 different bands playing, cold beer and great atmosphere would definitely revisit or reccomend to anyone

name: Jason Nitcholas
text: Awesome if you like country music,  not for me

name: Susan Yager
text: It's a fun place if you want to party like an animal.  It seems dirty and it can be smoky.  The church on Sunday, though, is awesome!

name: Renee Goertz
text: Always a blast. Every. Time

name: Samantha Crane
text: Amazing time at the beach, restraint and shops

name: Erskin Hickman
text: Great "tourist stop". Food is OK. A bit pricey.

name: Sandi Neering
text: I cannot say enough about this place. By far THE best place for the best music ever.  Sraff is wonderful, security if great, the music entertainment is out of this world ..thank you Joe Gilchrist!

name: Yamaha 457
text: Beer was warm

name: Lissa Brooks
text: Three friends and I, all locals, just paid $5 a piece to get into this place. They spent 5 minutes analyzing one of their IDs because it was brand new with a different holo. We finally got let in, he makes a joke about it being like TSA and we all got kicked out immediately. We literally weren’t inside for a minute. I’m pretty sure it’s because he’s covered in tattoos but that’s cool. They’ll continue to let spring breakers in with molly and coke like the ones behind us so they can spend daddy’s money but not locals with face tattoos. Shouldn’t have gone in the first place, definitely not coming back.

name: Brian Keast
text: Stop here every time I'm on vacay down here. Love the atmosphere 😎

name: Doug Walker
text: One of our favorite places to go at the beach!  Lots of different musicians and styles so you can find what you like. If you haven't been, you should give it a try!

name: Sheila Steimel
text: Great music!! Love the atmosphere. Absolutely love you can hear the band on the beach!!

name: Aaron Osborne
text: Like their saying says, good times and good music

name: Linda Gosa
text: Good music, friendly staff and happy people.  The food is amazingly good for a beach hangout.  Never had a bad meal there.  "Not Your Mother's Bingo" is free from 1-4 from M-F and is lots of fun.

name: Jim Aicone
text: A Gulf Coast landmark that is worth the visit. Even if it's just to walk around and snap some photos. Lots of activities during the day throughout the year. From BINGO to live music on multiple stages something is always going on. Bring a sharpie and mark your visit with a permanent memory. Char-grilled oysters, burgers, seafood and bushwackers to enjoy. It truly is one of America's last great Roadhouse!

name: Rachel Graham
text: Great bar for locals and tourists alike.  Widely varied crowd, from wedding parties to divorce parties, 21st birthdays to 70+.  There are several bars within this bar and the music varies at each one so you will probably find something you like.  Great for people watching as well.  There are always lines of taxi's waiting to take you home at the end of the night so don't be a dummy and drink and drive there is no need.  Have your ID, they will check!! There are a lot of college kids, I usually never wear any type of college colors on game days.  Alcohol and sports don't mix well in the south :)

resp.text: That about sums it up! ;) We appreciate your review, Rachel. Hope to see you again soon.

name: Tiffani Avery
text: Super dead. Vibe was lacking luster. We left without even visiting the bar.

name: Amber Turrentine
text: Easy beach access. They have live music most of the time. My only complaint is that they are unorganized with food orders. I'm not sure if the buzzer didn't go off or if they skipped over my order but I had to wait over an hour for a 1/2 dozen oysters. They said they were "about to make them" 3 times. The food is expensive but that was expected.

name: David Mitchell
text: Always a great time, a grunge bar on the beach on steroids!

name: william eliason
text: This place was so fun. If you are in the area it is a must see!!

name: Nichole Bentley
text: Great tourist bar. Food was ok, music was great.

name: thomas mitchell

name: Emmy Nelson

resp.text: We appreciate your review Lemont, see you next time!

name: John Smith
text: We were on vacation and went to the Flora Bama Yacht Club. We ate on the beach and the food was delicious. The mixed drinks are very reasonable. The bushwacker is a populat drink and packs a punch.

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to let us know about your recent visit. So glad you all had a large time and enjoyed your dining experience with us! Hope to see ya'll back again soon :)

name: Brianna Lemay
text: Awesome music, great drinks, affordable prices. What more could you ask for?

name: sarah hernandez
text: employees were very rude tonigjt

resp.text:
Hi Sarah - Thank you for taking time to let us know about your recent visit to the Flora-Bama. On behalf of our team, please let me start by extending my sincerest apologies for the treatment you received from some of our staff. We absolutely do not tolerate this sort of behavior from our employees, and I would like to get a little more info from you if possible. Can you tell me what day/time you were here, any sort of description of what they looked like and/or where in the Flora-Bama did this occur?
Please know your comments have been passed to upper management, as well as our Ownership Team, for further review and action and, any additional info you may have would be helpful so that we may address this with the appropriate staff. Again, I'm so very sorry this happened but I would love to try and make things right. Please feel free to reach out to me directly with any other info you have using the following email address: blakeli@florabama.com.
I hope to hear back from you soon - Blakeli Calvert, Marketing Manager Flora-Bama

name: Dave Miller
text: A Gulf Coast staple, and I hope it lasts forever.  I revisited after being away for several years and was impressed by it's growth.  Best beach bar I've ever been acquainted with, and it will make you want to return to Perdido Key!

name: Ashley Crim- Smith
text: Best place to be anytime!!! Great customer service, kid friendly most of the time, and great place to make memories!!

name: Lucindy WeaverByrd
text: I didn't eat there I went on a Friday night it was packed out the drinks I had were good but cost $7 but that is how it is in a bar. Music was ok but every one was just standing around listening not dancing. I personally didn't like it because I like a DJ better

resp.text:
Hi Angie,
Thank you for taking time to let us know about your recent visit with us. We're so sorry to hear your experience at the Flora-Bama wasn't the best, was there something in particular that may have happened to cause a not-so-great night? Please know your comments have been passed to upper management for further review and action, and we do hope to have you back for a better visit next time you're in the area.

name: Jessie Lovell
text: Love playing bingo. Food great also

name: kelly heimbach
text: Such a fun and interesting place!  Had the best drink ever there (key lime colada)! Great entertainment! Gotta visit the gift shop!

name: Eyes On
text: Historic place to visit, but on a rainy day not much to do here. If you like oysters you're okay otherwise head across the street for a better food selection.

resp.text: Hey there! Thanks for letting us know about your recent visit. The sunshine and warmer weather definitely helps the vibe and energy around here, but we try to make every day a fun day! Across the street at the Yacht Club and Ole River Grill, they have a much larger menu selection so we're happy you all were able to take a visit there. Hope to see ya back again soon :)

name: Keegan
text: We visited this place on August 4, 2019, and we were abruptly kicked out because two women entered the same stall because one needed medical help. We were then escorted downstairs without knowing where we were going. The person with medical problems was told that her eyes “looked glassy” and that the “U” on her hand was gone after washing her hands in the bathroom. We were then asked to leave, and we’re sent to the gift shop downstairs. I can’t say we will ever return here.

text: Simply amazing. I know nothing about the Marty's stickers

name: chad weathers
text: There are other places with better service and food if you just keep driving a couple of minutes down the road.

name: Christa Burton
text: Only reason 4 star is the fellow that was checking IDs and stamping hands was not a but friendly,  but sure why.  Everyone else was great, music in all 3 areas was GREAT!!

resp.text: Hi Christa - Thanks for taking time to let us know about your recent visit. On behalf of the Flora-Bama, I'd like to apologize for the distasteful welcome you all experienced. Please know your comments have been passed to upper management for further review and action. We do hope you'll come back to see us when in the area again as we'd love to show you a better start to a great night!

name: Steph Eastwood
text: Always a to-do Everytime we vacation in Gulf Shores! Friendly staff, good entertainment, full of history!! Perseverance is prevalent!!

text: We had a great time! Music was awesome, drinks were great! Thanks for the memories

text: Really good place to have a drink. Live entertainment laid back casual place.

name: LC T
text: This place is so fun!  Watch out-- the Bushwacker hits you when you least expect it!

name: Steven T
text: Love the atmosphere. Great music. A must visit.

name: Garrett Henson
text: Good music and good drinks

name: Glenn Morgan
text: Had a great time. Great live music and good drinks!

name: Sumit Sarkar
text:
Went on a Tuesday night when it was pretty quiet. Huge place that could be more clean. Perhaps the grime adds to the ambience. The staff was friendly and the specialty cocktails we ordered were half the price of most places. The only down side is they have limited ingredients at the bar, no Campari, for example. Still the bartender made a White Lady for us from my phone after I looked up the recipe. Their music acts even on a slow night are still good.

For families, come earlier in the afternoon and play bingo to win prizes. Under 18 have to leave by 6pm.

name: Jerry Lee
text: Careful place to go. The food was excellent. Great atmosphere.

name: Amanda Melton
text: Although it's gone a bit commercial, this place is the absolute definition of a dive bar. Being on the beach puts it over the top! Get a drink, walk out to the gulf and enjoy life! Shoes not necessary.

resp.text: You are absolutely right! Thank you :)

name: Bob Oliver
text: This bar was a lot of fun.  The live entertainer was fantastic.

name: Mary Baskett
text: What a unique place! Loved the "Duelling Pianos" show on Thursday evening.

resp.text: Thanks so much for letting us know about your recent visit! We're so happy to hear you all had a great time, the Dueling Pianos on Thursday nights is such a huge hit and we have big love for those guys! Hope to see ya back here On The Line again soon :)

name: Aaron Osborne
text: Like their saying says, good times and good music

name: Ginny Lyon
text:
Stopped by Flora-Bama restaurants/bars to check it out. It's right on the Florida Alabama line, and that's how it got it's name.
They have 2 restaurants on one side or the street and another along with some bars on the other side of the road. They have live music and offer free bingo certain days during the week. You really need to try the bingo it's a hoot. Not your ordinary bingo, it's all free! There is a gift shop as well.
Flora-Bama is right on the beach and the view is spectacular. Check out the sunset, beautiful.

resp.text: Thanks for the awesome review, Ginny! So glad you had a large time and we hope to see you back soon!

name: Sheila Steimel
text: Great music!! Love the atmosphere. Absolutely love you can hear the band on the beach!!

name: Trevor Shaw
text: Took a week quasivacation to help some friends at Snowball Derby and check out some new things. This place was next door to a condo rented. Walking the beach on Sunday around 8am and heard "High on that Mountain" while taking in the scenery and watching dolphins swim. It added to the experience. Then checked out the lounge and it was pretty damn cool. Atmosphere is great although didn't get past the second floor where band was playing. Acoustic duet was on point and staff was cool which brought it all together to make this place badass. I'm from Texas but will be returning as soon as I can to continue where I left off. Might even pick up a guitar myself and have a little fun. Definitely a place to go. No affiliation to gay ass MTV show.

name: Adam Brothers
text: Good atmosphere. Good drinks, live bands.

name: Della Hager
text: Good place to sign the walls,ceilings, roofs,tables,toilet seats and anywhere else there is a place.Been there had fun,good bands,had fun.ORIGINAL ROAD HOUSE !Great there is church on Sundays,,,Worship On The Water! People are great and laid back! Had a great time there the 5 months we were in the area,,,,hoping to make the area our home base!

name: chris banta
text: This place is very cool. The staff is very friendly and alot to see there. The drinks were cold. And the food is excellent and it has a nice gift shop.

name: David Burke
text: Great atmosphere. Expect to have your face melted off because of how hot it is though.

name: Andrew Fitzpatrick
text: The Perdido Brothers were a pleasant surprise on this random Wednesday night.  The place definitely did not disappoint.

name: Paul Corsa
text: We spent New Years Eve at the Flora-Bama. It was amazing to see such a crowd with no metal detectors; no visible fights; and everybody just having fun. 5$ cab rides were available all night for anyone who didn't feel up to driving home. We returned Sunday to attend Church and have breakfast after. What a wonderful way to share the floorspace and to help raise money for children's charities too. Keep up the good work.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We are so glad you enjoyed your experience and look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Gary Shekels
text: Great service. Great food. Good price. Clean restaurant.

name: Mary Baskett
text: What a unique place! Loved the "Duelling Pianos" show on Thursday evening.

resp.text: Thanks so much for letting us know about your recent visit! We're so happy to hear you all had a great time, the Dueling Pianos on Thursday nights is such a huge hit and we have big love for those guys! Hope to see ya back here On The Line again soon :)

name: James Holland
text: The church Is excellent this morning their service is great you need to go out and check out the Sunday morning service at the Flora bama at 9 and 11 o'clock and have a blessed day

name: Jim Overturf
text: Music was first rate. That is why you go there. Kinda dirty and not well kept in dome areas. Drinks are ok.

name: casey bates
text: A ton of fun! Can't wait to go back! Thinking of you guys during hurricane Michael!

name: Ann Aukerman
text: Fun place!

name: Bill Winnett
text: This place is amazing.

name: Ashley Lynn
text: Had a blast, got too drunk, someone stole my phone. Be on alert

name: Missy Rampage
text:
Just stopped for Powerball tickets.  That's on the inland side of the highway, y'all.
Quick and easy.

name: Lace Family Lace
text: Awesome location. It was a good time for all of us, especially the bingo caller who was having as much of a good time as we were. Although I gotta say, most people wash their bare feet off after leaving the beach, you wash your bare feet off after leaving the FloraBama. Also good if you need to purchase Florida lottery tickets, since Alabama does not have the lottery.

name: Lori Dalton
text: Fun and everyone's real nice

name: Bobby Barronton
text: We attended the  church at Flora-Bama. It was a great experience.

name: Alan Hutchens
text: Great place with live music.

name: Jamie C Gee
text: The Church service on Sunday Is the best thing about it other than souvenir shop. Food is a minus 5 stars even if your drunk

name: Chris Radloff
text: An institution rooted deep into Gulf Shores history. Have a Bushwacker or 2 and find a place to write your name somewhere in the bar and become a part of this iconic landmark.

name: John Meyer
text: Great place to hang out.

name: Beth Turner
text: Always fun! Great burgers, band was great

name: Heather Olson
text: Pretty neat place.

text: Took a week quasivacation to help some friends at Snowball Derby and check out some new things. This place was next door to a condo rented. Walking the beach on Sunday around 8am and heard "High on that Mountain" while taking in the scenery and watching dolphins swim. It added to the experience.
